25.text: انْظُرْ كَيْفَ ضَرَبُوا لَكَ الْأَمْثَالَ فَضَلُّوا فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَبِيلًا
25.translation: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.
25.transliteration: Unzur kaifa daraboo lakal amsaala fadalloo falaa yastatee'oona sabeelaa

25.text: تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي إِنْ شَاءَ جَعَلَ لَكَ خَيْرًا مِنْ ذَٰلِكَ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ وَيَجْعَلْ لَكَ قُصُورًا
25.translation: Blessed is He who, if He willed, could have made for you [something] better than that - gardens beneath which rivers flow - and could make for you palaces.
25.transliteration: Tabaarakal lazeee in shaaa'a ja'ala laka khairam min zaalika jannaatin tajree min tahtihal anhaaru wa yaj'al laka qusooraa

25.text: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا بِالسَّاعَةِ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لِمَنْ كَذَّبَ بِالسَّاعَةِ سَعِيرًا
25.translation: But they have denied the Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a Blaze.
25.transliteration: Bal kazzaboo bis Saa'ati wa a'tadnaa liman kazzaba bis Saa'ati sa'eeraa

25.text: إِذَا رَأَتْهُمْ مِنْ مَكَانٍ بَعِيدٍ سَمِعُوا لَهَا تَغَيُّظًا وَزَفِيرًا
25.translation: When the Hellfire sees them from a distant place, they will hear its fury and roaring.
25.transliteration: Izaa ra'at hum mim ma kaanim ba'eedin sami'oo lahaa taghaiyuzanw wa zafeeraa

25.text: وَإِذَا أُلْقُوا مِنْهَا مَكَانًا ضَيِّقًا مُقَرَّنِينَ دَعَوْا هُنَالِكَ ثُبُورًا
25.translation: And when they are thrown into a narrow place therein bound in chains, they will cry out thereupon for destruction.
25.transliteration: Wa izaaa ulqoo minhaa makaanan daiyiqam muqar raneena da'aw hunaalika subooraa

25.text: لَا تَدْعُوا الْيَوْمَ ثُبُورًا وَاحِدًا وَادْعُوا ثُبُورًا كَثِيرًا
25.translation: [They will be told], "Do not cry this Day for one destruction but cry for much destruction."
25.transliteration: Laa tad'ul yawma subooranw waahidanw wad'oo subooran kaseeraa

25.text: قُلْ أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ أَمْ جَنَّةُ الْخُلْدِ الَّتِي وُعِدَ الْمُتَّقُونَ ۚ كَانَتْ لَهُمْ جَزَاءً وَمَصِيرًا
25.translation: Say, "Is that better or the Garden of Eternity which is promised to the righteous? It will be for them a reward and destination.
25.transliteration: Qul azaalika khairun am Jannatul khuldil latee wu'idal muttaqoon; kaanat lahum jazaaa'anw wa maseeraa

25.text: لَهُمْ فِيهَا مَا يَشَاءُونَ خَالِدِينَ ۚ كَانَ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ وَعْدًا مَسْئُولًا
25.translation: For them therein is whatever they wish, [while] abiding eternally. It is ever upon your Lord a promise [worthy to be] requested.
25.transliteration: Lahum feehaa maa yashaaa'oona khaalideen; kaana 'alaa Rabbika wa'dam mas'oolaa

25.text: وَيَوْمَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ فَيَقُولُ أَأَنْتُمْ أَضْلَلْتُمْ عِبَادِي هَٰؤُلَاءِ أَمْ هُمْ ضَلُّوا السَّبِيلَ
25.translation: And [mention] the Day He will gather them and that which they worship besides Allah and will say, "Did you mislead these, My servants, or did they [themselves] stray from the way?"
25.transliteration: Wa Yawma yahshuruhum wa maa ya'budoona min doonil lahi fa yaqoolu 'a-antum adlaltum 'ibaadee haaa'ulaaa'i am hum dallus sabeel

25.text: قَالُوا سُبْحَانَكَ مَا كَانَ يَنْبَغِي لَنَا أَنْ نَتَّخِذَ مِنْ دُونِكَ مِنْ أَوْلِيَاءَ وَلَٰكِنْ مَتَّعْتَهُمْ وَآبَاءَهُمْ حَتَّىٰ نَسُوا الذِّكْرَ وَكَانُوا قَوْمًا بُورًا
25.translation: They will say, "Exalted are You! It was not for us to take besides You any allies. But You provided comforts for them and their fathers until they forgot the message and became a people ruined."
25.transliteration: Qaaloo Subhaanaka maa kaana yambaghee lanaaa an nattakhiza min doonika min awliyaaa'a wa laakim matta'tahum wa aabaaa'ahum hattaa nasuz zikra wa kaanoo qawmam booraa

25.text: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوكُمْ بِمَا تَقُولُونَ فَمَا تَسْتَطِيعُونَ صَرْفًا وَلَا نَصْرًا ۚ وَمَنْ يَظْلِمْ مِنْكُمْ نُذِقْهُ عَذَابًا كَبِيرًا
25.translation: So they will deny you, [disbelievers], in what you say, and you cannot avert [punishment] or [find] help. And whoever commits injustice among you - We will make him taste a great punishment.
25.transliteration: Faqad kazzabookum bimaa taqooloona famaa tastatee'oona sarfanw wa laa nasraa; wa mai yazlim minkum nuziqhu 'azaaban kabeeraa

25.text: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا قَبْلَكَ مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ إِلَّا إِنَّهُمْ لَيَأْكُلُونَ الطَّعَامَ وَيَمْشُونَ فِي الْأَسْوَاقِ ۗ وَجَعَلْنَا بَعْضَكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ فِتْنَةً أَتَصْبِرُونَ ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ بَصِيرًا
25.translation: And We did not send before you, [O Muhammad], any of the messengers except that they ate food and walked in the markets. And We have made some of you [people] as trial for others - will you have patience? And ever is your Lord, Seeing.
25.transliteration: Wa maaa arsalnaa qablaka minal mursaleena illaaa innahum la yaakuloonat ta'aama wa yamshoona fil aswaaq; wa ja'alnaa ba'dakum liba'din fitnatan atasbiroon; wa kaana Rabbuka Baseera

25.text: ۞ وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ لَا يَرْجُونَ لِقَاءَنَا لَوْلَا أُنْزِلَ عَلَيْنَا الْمَلَائِكَةُ أَوْ نَرَىٰ رَبَّنَا ۗ لَقَدِ اسْتَكْبَرُوا فِي أَنْفُسِهِمْ وَعَتَوْا عُتُوًّا كَبِيرًا
25.translation: And those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Why were not angels sent down to us, or [why] do we [not] see our Lord?" They have certainly become arrogant within themselves and [become] insolent with great insolence.
25.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeena laa yarjoona liqaaa'anaa law laaa unzila 'alainal malaaa'ikatu awnaraa Rabbanaa; laqadistakbaroo feee anfusihim wa 'ataw 'utuwwan kabeeraa

25.text: يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَ الْمَلَائِكَةَ لَا بُشْرَىٰ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُجْرِمِينَ وَيَقُولُونَ حِجْرًا مَحْجُورًا
25.translation: The day they see the angels - no good tidings will there be that day for the criminals, and [the angels] will say, "Prevented and inaccessible."
25.transliteration: Yawma yarawnal malaaa 'ikata laa bushraa Yawma'izil lilmujrimeena wa yaqooloona hijram mahjooraa

25.text: وَقَدِمْنَا إِلَىٰ مَا عَمِلُوا مِنْ عَمَلٍ فَجَعَلْنَاهُ هَبَاءً مَنْثُورًا
25.translation: And We will regard what they have done of deeds and make them as dust dispersed.
25.transliteration: Wa qadimnaaa ilaa maa 'amiloo min 'amalin faja'alnaahu habaaa'am mansooraa

25.text: أَصْحَابُ الْجَنَّةِ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَيْرٌ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَأَحْسَنُ مَقِيلًا
25.translation: The companions of Paradise, that Day, are [in] a better settlement and better resting place.
25.transliteration: As haabul jannati yawma'izin khairum mustaqar ranw wa ahsanu maqeela

25.text: وَيَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ السَّمَاءُ بِالْغَمَامِ وَنُزِّلَ الْمَلَائِكَةُ تَنْزِيلًا
25.translation: And [mention] the Day when the heaven will split open with [emerging] clouds, and the angels will be sent down in successive descent.
25.transliteration: Wa Yawma tashaqqaqus samaaa'u bilghamaami wa nuzzilal malaaa'ikatu tanzeela

25.text: الْمُلْكُ يَوْمَئِذٍ الْحَقُّ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ ۚ وَكَانَ يَوْمًا عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ عَسِيرًا
25.translation: True sovereignty, that Day, is for the Most Merciful. And it will be upon the disbelievers a difficult Day.
25.transliteration: Almulku Yawma'izinil haqqu lir Rahmaan; wa kaana Yawman'alal kaafireena 'aseeraa

25.text: وَيَوْمَ يَعَضُّ الظَّالِمُ عَلَىٰ يَدَيْهِ يَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي اتَّخَذْتُ مَعَ الرَّسُولِ سَبِيلًا
25.translation: And the Day the wrongdoer will bite on his hands [in regret] he will say, "Oh, I wish I had taken with the Messenger a way.
25.transliteration: Wa Yawma ya'adduz zaalimu 'alaa yadaihi yaqoolu yaa laitanit takhaztu ma'ar Rasooli sabeelaa

25.text: يَا وَيْلَتَىٰ لَيْتَنِي لَمْ أَتَّخِذْ فُلَانًا خَلِيلًا
25.translation: Oh, woe to me! I wish I had not taken that one as a friend.
25.transliteration: Yaa wailataa laitanee lam attakhiz fulaanan khaleelaa

25.text: لَقَدْ أَضَلَّنِي عَنِ الذِّكْرِ بَعْدَ إِذْ جَاءَنِي ۗ وَكَانَ الشَّيْطَانُ لِلْإِنْسَانِ خَذُولًا
25.translation: He led me away from the remembrance after it had come to me. And ever is Satan, to man, a deserter."
25.transliteration: Laqad adallanee 'aniz zikri ba'da iz jaaa'anee; wa kaanash Shaitaanu lil insaani khazoolaa

25.text: وَقَالَ الرَّسُولُ يَا رَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِي اتَّخَذُوا هَٰذَا الْقُرْآنَ مَهْجُورًا
25.translation: And the Messenger has said, "O my Lord, indeed my people have taken this Qur'an as [a thing] abandoned."
25.transliteration: Wa qaalar Rasoolu yaa Rabbi inna qawmit takhazoo haazal Qur-aana mahjooraa

25.text: وَكَذَٰلِكَ جَعَلْنَا لِكُلِّ نَبِيٍّ عَدُوًّا مِنَ الْمُجْرِمِينَ ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِرَبِّكَ هَادِيًا وَنَصِيرًا
25.translation: And thus have We made for every prophet an enemy from among the criminals. But sufficient is your Lord as a guide and a helper.
25.transliteration: Wa kazaalika ja'alnaa likulli Nabiyyin 'aduwwam minal mujrimeen; wa kafaa bi Rabbika haadiyanw wa naseeraa

25.text: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوْلَا نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ الْقُرْآنُ جُمْلَةً وَاحِدَةً ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ لِنُثَبِّتَ بِهِ فُؤَادَكَ ۖ وَرَتَّلْنَاهُ تَرْتِيلًا
25.translation: And those who disbelieve say, "Why was the Qur'an not revealed to him all at once?" Thus [it is] that We may strengthen thereby your heart. And We have spaced it distinctly.
25.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeena kafaroo law laa nuzzila 'alaihil Quraanu jumlatanw waahidah; kazaalika linusabbita bihee fu'aadaka wa rattalnaahu tarteelaa

25.text: وَلَا يَأْتُونَكَ بِمَثَلٍ إِلَّا جِئْنَاكَ بِالْحَقِّ وَأَحْسَنَ تَفْسِيرًا
25.translation: And they do not come to you with an argument except that We bring you the truth and the best explanation.
25.transliteration: Wa laa yaatoonaka bimasainn illaa ji'naaka bilhaqqi wa ahsana tafseeraa

25.text: الَّذِينَ يُحْشَرُونَ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ أُولَٰئِكَ شَرٌّ مَكَانًا وَأَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
25.translation: The ones who are gathered on their faces to Hell - those are the worst in position and farthest astray in [their] way.
25.transliteration: Allazeena yuhsharoona 'alaa wujoohim ilaa jahannama ulaaa'ika sharrum makaananw wa adallu sabeelaa )section 3)

25.text: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى الْكِتَابَ وَجَعَلْنَا مَعَهُ أَخَاهُ هَارُونَ وَزِيرًا
25.translation: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture and appointed with him his brother Aaron as an assistant.
25.transliteration: Wa laqad aatainaa Moosal Kitaaba wa ja'alnaa ma'ahooo akhaahu Haaroona wazeeraa

25.text: فَقُلْنَا اذْهَبَا إِلَى الْقَوْمِ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا فَدَمَّرْنَاهُمْ تَدْمِيرًا
25.translation: And We said, "Go both of you to the people who have denied Our signs." Then We destroyed them with [complete] destruction.
25.transliteration: Faqulnaz habaaa ilal qawmil lazeena kazzaboo bi Aayaatinaa fadammarnaahum tadmeeraa

25.text: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ لَمَّا كَذَّبُوا الرُّسُلَ أَغْرَقْنَاهُمْ وَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ لِلنَّاسِ آيَةً ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لِلظَّالِمِينَ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
25.translation: And the people of Noah - when they denied the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them for mankind a sign. And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.
25.transliteration: Wa qawma Noohil lammaa kazzabur Rusula aghraqnaahum wa ja'alnaahum linnaasi Aayatanw wa a'tadnaa lizzaalimeena 'azaaban aleemaa

25.text: وَعَادًا وَثَمُودَ وَأَصْحَابَ الرَّسِّ وَقُرُونًا بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ كَثِيرًا
25.translation: And [We destroyed] 'Aad and Thamud and the companions of the well and many generations between them.
25.transliteration: Wa 'Aadanw Samooda wa As haabar Rassi wa quroonam baina zaalika kaseeraa

25.text: وَكُلًّا ضَرَبْنَا لَهُ الْأَمْثَالَ ۖ وَكُلًّا تَبَّرْنَا تَتْبِيرًا
25.translation: And for each We presented examples [as warnings], and each We destroyed with [total] destruction.
25.transliteration: Wa kullandarabnaa lahul amsaala wa kullan tabbarnaa tatbeera

25.text: وَلَقَدْ أَتَوْا عَلَى الْقَرْيَةِ الَّتِي أُمْطِرَتْ مَطَرَ السَّوْءِ ۚ أَفَلَمْ يَكُونُوا يَرَوْنَهَا ۚ بَلْ كَانُوا لَا يَرْجُونَ نُشُورًا
25.translation: And they have already come upon the town which was showered with a rain of evil. So have they not seen it? But they are not expecting resurrection.
25.transliteration: Wa laqad ataw 'alal qaryatil lateee umtirat mataras saw'; afalam yakoonoo yarawnahaa; bal kaanoo laa yarjoona nushooraa

25.text: وَإِذَا رَأَوْكَ إِنْ يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَٰذَا الَّذِي بَعَثَ اللَّهُ رَسُولًا
25.translation: And when they see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger?
25.transliteration: Wa izaa ra awka iny yattakhizoonaka illaa huzuwan ahaazal lazee ba'asal laahu Rasoolaa

25.text: إِنْ كَادَ لَيُضِلُّنَا عَنْ آلِهَتِنَا لَوْلَا أَنْ صَبَرْنَا عَلَيْهَا ۚ وَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ حِينَ يَرَوْنَ الْعَذَابَ مَنْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
25.translation: He almost would have misled us from our gods had we not been steadfast in [worship of] them." But they are going to know, when they see the punishment, who is farthest astray in [his] way.
25.transliteration: In kaada la yudillunaa 'an aalihatinaa law laaa an sabarnaa 'alaihaa; wa sawfa ya'lamoona heena yarawnal 'azaaba man adallu sabeela

25.text: أَرَأَيْتَ مَنِ اتَّخَذَ إِلَٰهَهُ هَوَاهُ أَفَأَنْتَ تَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ وَكِيلًا
25.translation: Have you seen the one who takes as his god his own desire? Then would you be responsible for him?
25.transliteration: Ara'aita manit takhaza ilaahahoo hawaahu afa anta takoonu 'alaihi wakeelaa

25.text: أَمْ تَحْسَبُ أَنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ يَسْمَعُونَ أَوْ يَعْقِلُونَ ۚ إِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا كَالْأَنْعَامِ ۖ بَلْ هُمْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
25.translation: Or do you think that most of them hear or reason? They are not except like livestock. Rather, they are [even] more astray in [their] way.
25.transliteration: Am tahsabu annna aksarahum yasma'oona aw ya''qiloon; in hum illaa kal an'aami bal hum adallu sabeelan

25.text: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَيْفَ مَدَّ الظِّلَّ وَلَوْ شَاءَ لَجَعَلَهُ سَاكِنًا ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَا الشَّمْسَ عَلَيْهِ دَلِيلًا
25.translation: Have you not considered your Lord - how He extends the shadow, and if He willed, He could have made it stationary? Then We made the sun for it an indication.
25.transliteration: Alam tara ilaa Rabbika kaifa maddaz zilla wa law shaaa'a laja'alahoo saakinan summa ja'alnash shamsa 'alaihe daleelaa

25.text: ثُمَّ قَبَضْنَاهُ إِلَيْنَا قَبْضًا يَسِيرًا
25.translation: Then We hold it in hand for a brief grasp.
25.transliteration: Summa qabadnaahu ilainaa qabdany yaseeraa

25.text: وَهُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ اللَّيْلَ لِبَاسًا وَالنَّوْمَ سُبَاتًا وَجَعَلَ النَّهَارَ نُشُورًا
25.translation: And it is He who has made the night for you as clothing and sleep [a means for] rest and has made the day a resurrection.
25.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazee ja'ala lakumul laila libaasanw wannawma subaatanw wa ja'alan nahaara nushooraa

25.text: وَهُوَ الَّذِي أَرْسَلَ الرِّيَاحَ بُشْرًا بَيْنَ يَدَيْ رَحْمَتِهِ ۚ وَأَنْزَلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً طَهُورًا
25.translation: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy, and We send down from the sky pure water
25.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazeee arsalar riyaaha bushram baina yadai rahmatih; wa anzalnaa minas samaaa'i maaa'an tahooraa

25.text: لِنُحْيِيَ بِهِ بَلْدَةً مَيْتًا وَنُسْقِيَهُ مِمَّا خَلَقْنَا أَنْعَامًا وَأَنَاسِيَّ كَثِيرًا
25.translation: That We may bring to life thereby a dead land and give it as drink to those We created of numerous livestock and men.
25.transliteration: Linuhyiya bihee balda tam maitanw wa nusqiyahoo mimmaa khalaqnaaa an'aa manw wa anaasiyya kaseeraa

25.text: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَاهُ بَيْنَهُمْ لِيَذَّكَّرُوا فَأَبَىٰ أَكْثَرُ النَّاسِ إِلَّا كُفُورًا
25.translation: And We have certainly distributed it among them that they might be reminded, but most of the people refuse except disbelief.
25.transliteration: Wa laqad sarrafnaahu bainahum li yazzakkaroo fa abaaa aksarun naasi illaa kufooraa

25.text: وَلَوْ شِئْنَا لَبَعَثْنَا فِي كُلِّ قَرْيَةٍ نَذِيرًا
25.translation: And if We had willed, We could have sent into every city a warner.
25.transliteration: Wa law shi'naa laba'asnaa fee kulli qar yatin nazeeraa

25.text: فَلَا تُطِعِ الْكَافِرِينَ وَجَاهِدْهُمْ بِهِ جِهَادًا كَبِيرًا
25.translation: So do not obey the disbelievers, and strive against them with the Qur'an a great striving.
25.transliteration: Falaa tuti'il kaafireena wa jaahidhum bihee jihaadan kabeeraa

25.text: ۞ وَهُوَ الَّذِي مَرَجَ الْبَحْرَيْنِ هَٰذَا عَذْبٌ فُرَاتٌ وَهَٰذَا مِلْحٌ أُجَاجٌ وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخًا وَحِجْرًا مَحْجُورًا
25.translation: And it is He who has released [simultaneously] the two seas, one fresh and sweet and one salty and bitter, and He placed between them a barrier and prohibiting partition.
25.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazee marajal bahraini haazaa 'azbun furaatunw wa haazaa milhun ujaaj; wa ja'ala bainahumaa barzakhanw wa hijram mahjooraa

25.text: وَهُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ مِنَ الْمَاءِ بَشَرًا فَجَعَلَهُ نَسَبًا وَصِهْرًا ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ قَدِيرًا
25.translation: And it is He who has created from water a human being and made him [a relative by] lineage and marriage. And ever is your Lord competent [concerning creation].
25.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazee khalaqa minal maaa'i basharran fa ja'alahoo nasaban wa sihraa; wa kaana Rabbuka Qadeeraa

25.text: وَيَعْبُدُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنْفَعُهُمْ وَلَا يَضُرُّهُمْ ۗ وَكَانَ الْكَافِرُ عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِ ظَهِيرًا
25.translation: But they worship rather than Allah that which does not benefit them or harm them, and the disbeliever is ever, against his Lord, an assistant [to Satan].
25.transliteration: Wa ya'budoona min doonil laahi maa laa yanfa'uhum wa laa yadurruhum; wa kaanal kaafiru 'alaa Rabbihee zaheeraa

25.text: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرًا وَنَذِيرًا
25.translation: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
25.transliteration: Wa maa arsalnaaka illaa mubashshiranw wa nazeeraa

25.text: قُلْ مَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِلَّا مَنْ شَاءَ أَنْ يَتَّخِذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا
25.translation: Say, "I do not ask of you for it any payment - only that whoever wills might take to his Lord a way."
25.transliteration: Qul maaa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin illaa man shaaa'a ai yattakhiza ilaa Rabbihee sabeelaa

25.text: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى الْحَيِّ الَّذِي لَا يَمُوتُ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِهِ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِهِ بِذُنُوبِ عِبَادِهِ خَبِيرًا
25.translation: And rely upon the Ever-Living who does not die, and exalt [Allah] with His praise. And sufficient is He to be, with the sins of His servants, Acquainted -
25.transliteration: Wa tawakkal 'alal Haiyil lazee laa yamootu wa sabbih bihamdih; wa kafaa bihee bizunoobi 'ibaadihee khabeeraa

25.text: الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ اسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ ۚ الرَّحْمَٰنُ فَاسْأَلْ بِهِ خَبِيرًا
25.translation: He who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days and then established Himself above the Throne - the Most Merciful, so ask about Him one well informed.
25.transliteration: Allazee khalaqas samaawaati wal arda wa maa bainahumaa fee sittati aiyaamin summmmastawaa 'alal 'Arsh; ar Rahmaanu fas'al bihee khabeeraa

25.text: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ اسْجُدُوا لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ قَالُوا وَمَا الرَّحْمَٰنُ أَنَسْجُدُ لِمَا تَأْمُرُنَا وَزَادَهُمْ نُفُورًا ۩
25.translation: And when it is said to them, "Prostrate to the Most Merciful," they say, "And what is the Most Merciful? Should we prostrate to that which you order us?" And it increases them in aversion.
25.transliteration: Wa izaa qeela lahumus judoo lir Rahmaani qaaloo wa mar Rahmaanu anasjudu limaa taamurunaa wa zaadahum nufooraa

25.text: تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ فِي السَّمَاءِ بُرُوجًا وَجَعَلَ فِيهَا سِرَاجًا وَقَمَرًا مُنِيرًا
25.translation: Blessed is He who has placed in the sky great stars and placed therein a [burning] lamp and luminous moon.
25.transliteration: Tabaarakal lazee ja'ala fis samaaa'i buroojanw wa ja'ala feehaa siraajanw wa qamaram muneeraa

25.text: وَهُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ خِلْفَةً لِمَنْ أَرَادَ أَنْ يَذَّكَّرَ أَوْ أَرَادَ شُكُورًا
25.translation: And it is He who has made the night and the day in succession for whoever desires to remember or desires gratitude.
25.transliteration: Wa huwal lazee ja'alal laila wannahaara khilfatal liman araada ai yazzakkara aw araadaa shookooraa

25.text: وَعِبَادُ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الَّذِينَ يَمْشُونَ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ هَوْنًا وَإِذَا خَاطَبَهُمُ الْجَاهِلُونَ قَالُوا سَلَامًا
25.translation: And the servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth easily, and when the ignorant address them [harshly], they say [words of] peace,
25.transliteration: Wa 'ibaadur Rahmaanil lazeena yamshoona 'alal ardi hawnanw wa izaa khaata bahumul jaahiloona qaaloo salaamaa

25.text: وَالَّذِينَ يَبِيتُونَ لِرَبِّهِمْ سُجَّدًا وَقِيَامًا
25.translation: And those who spend [part of] the night to their Lord prostrating and standing [in prayer]
25.transliteration: Wallazeena yabeetoona li Rabbihim sujjadanw wa qiyaamaa

25.text: وَالَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا اصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ إِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًا
25.translation: And those who say, "Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell. Indeed, its punishment is ever adhering;
25.transliteration: Wallazeena yaqooloona Rabbanas rif 'annnaa 'azaaba Jahannama inn 'azaabahaa kaana gharaamaa

25.text: إِنَّهَا سَاءَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا
25.translation: Indeed, it is evil as a settlement and residence."
25.transliteration: Innahaa saaa'at mustaqarranw wa muqaamaa

25.text: وَالَّذِينَ إِذَا أَنْفَقُوا لَمْ يُسْرِفُوا وَلَمْ يَقْتُرُوا وَكَانَ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ قَوَامًا
25.translation: And [they are] those who, when they spend, do so not excessively or sparingly but are ever, between that, [justly] moderate
25.transliteration: Wallazeena izaaa anfaqoo lam yusrifoo wa lam yaqturoo wa kaana baina zaalika qawaamaa

25.text: وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَدْعُونَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ وَلَا يَقْتُلُونَ النَّفْسَ الَّتِي حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا يَزْنُونَ ۚ وَمَنْ يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ يَلْقَ أَثَامًا
25.translation: And those who do not invoke with Allah another deity or kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed], except by right, and do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse. And whoever should do that will meet a penalty.
25.transliteration: Wallazeena laa yad'oona ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhara wa laa yaqtuloonan nafsal latee harramal laahu illaa bilhaqqi wa laa yaznoon; wa mai yaf'al zaalika yalqa asaamaa

25.text: يُضَاعَفْ لَهُ الْعَذَابُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وَيَخْلُدْ فِيهِ مُهَانًا
25.translation: Multiplied for him is the punishment on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein humiliated -
25.transliteration: Yudaa'af lahul 'azaabu Yawmal Qiyaamati wa yakhlud feehee muhaanaa

25.text: إِلَّا مَنْ تَابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلًا صَالِحًا فَأُولَٰئِكَ يُبَدِّلُ اللَّهُ سَيِّئَاتِهِمْ حَسَنَاتٍ ۗ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ غَفُورًا رَحِيمًا
25.translation: Except for those who repent, believe and do righteous work. For them Allah will replace their evil deeds with good. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
25.transliteration: Illaa man taaba wa 'aamana wa 'amila 'amalan saalihan fa ulaaa'ika yubad dilul laahu saiyi aatihim hasanaat; wa kaanal laahu Ghafoorar Raheemaa

25.text: وَمَنْ تَابَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَإِنَّهُ يَتُوبُ إِلَى اللَّهِ مَتَابًا
25.translation: And he who repents and does righteousness does indeed turn to Allah with [accepted] repentance.
25.transliteration: Wa man taaba wa 'amila saalihan fa innnahoo yatoobu ilal laahi mataabaa

25.text: وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَشْهَدُونَ الزُّورَ وَإِذَا مَرُّوا بِاللَّغْوِ مَرُّوا كِرَامًا
25.translation: And [they are] those who do not testify to falsehood, and when they pass near ill speech, they pass by with dignity.
25.transliteration: Wallazeena laa yash hadoonaz zoora wa izaa marroo billaghwi marroo kiraamaa

25.text: وَالَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِّرُوا بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ لَمْ يَخِرُّوا عَلَيْهَا صُمًّا وَعُمْيَانًا
25.translation: And those who, when reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall upon them deaf and blind.
25.transliteration: Wallazeena izaa zukkiroo bi Aayaati Rabbihim lam yakhirroo 'alaihaa summanw wa'umyaanaa

25.text: وَالَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَاجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّاتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍ وَاجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا
25.translation: And those who say, "Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous."
25.transliteration: Wallazeena yaqooloona Rabbanaa hab lanaa min azwaajinaa wa zurriyaatinaa qurrata a'yuninw waj 'alnaa lilmuttaqeena Imaamaa

25.text: أُولَٰئِكَ يُجْزَوْنَ الْغُرْفَةَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا وَيُلَقَّوْنَ فِيهَا تَحِيَّةً وَسَلَامًا
25.translation: Those will be awarded the Chamber for what they patiently endured, and they will be received therein with greetings and [words of] peace.
25.transliteration: Ulaaa'ika yujzawnal ghurfata bimaa sabaroo wa yulaqqawna feehaa tahiyyatanw wa salaamaa

25.text: خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ حَسُنَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا
25.translation: Abiding eternally therein. Good is the settlement and residence.
25.transliteration: Khaalideena feehaa; hasunat mustaqarranw wa muqaamaa

25.text: قُلْ مَا يَعْبَأُ بِكُمْ رَبِّي لَوْلَا دُعَاؤُكُمْ ۖ فَقَدْ كَذَّبْتُمْ فَسَوْفَ يَكُونُ لِزَامًا
25.translation: Say, "What would my Lord care for you if not for your supplication?" For you [disbelievers] have denied, so your denial is going to be adherent.
25.transliteration: Qul maa ya'ba'u bikum Rabbee law laa du'aaa'ukum faqad kazzabtum fasawfa yakoonu lizaamaa

26.translation: Ta, Seen, Meem.
26.transliteration: Taa-Seeen-Meeem

26.translation: These are the verses of the clear Book.
26.transliteration: Tilka Aayaatul Kitaabil Mubeen

26.text: لَعَلَّكَ بَاخِعٌ نَفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا مُؤْمِنِينَ
26.translation: Perhaps, [O Muhammad], you would kill yourself with grief that they will not be believers.
26.transliteration: La'allaka baakhi'un nafsaka allaa yakoonoo mu'mineen

26.text: إِنْ نَشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِمْ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ آيَةً فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَاقُهُمْ لَهَا خَاضِعِينَ
26.translation: If We willed, We could send down to them from the sky a sign for which their necks would remain humbled.
26.transliteration: In nashaa nunazzil 'alaihim minas samaaa'i Aayatan fazallat a'naaquhum lahaa khaadi'een

26.text: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِمْ مِنْ ذِكْرٍ مِنَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ
26.translation: And no revelation comes to them anew from the Most Merciful except that they turn away from it.
26.transliteration: Wa maa yaateehim min zikrim minar Rahmaani muhdasin illaa kaanoo 'anhu mu'rideen

26.text: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنْبَاءُ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
26.translation: For they have already denied, but there will come to them the news of that which they used to ridicule.
26.transliteration: Faqad kazzaboo fasa yaateehim ambaaa'u maa kaanoo bihee yastahzi'oon

26.text: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا إِلَى الْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنْبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِنْ كُلِّ زَوْجٍ كَرِيمٍ
26.translation: Did they not look at the earth - how much We have produced therein from every noble kind?
26.transliteration: Awa lam yaraw ilal ardi kam ambatnaa feehaa min kulli zawjin kareem

26.text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
26.translation: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
26.transliteration: Inn fee zaalika la Aayah; wa maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen

26.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
26.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la Huwal 'Azeezur Raheem

26.text: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ ائْتِ الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ
26.translation: And [mention] when your Lord called Moses, [saying], "Go to the wrongdoing people -
26.transliteration: Wa iz naadaa Rabbuka Moosaaa ani'-til qawmaz zaalimeen

26.translation: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear Allah?"
26.transliteration: Qawma Fir'awn; alaa yattaqoon

26.text: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي أَخَافُ أَنْ يُكَذِّبُونِ
26.translation: He said, "My Lord, indeed I fear that they will deny me
26.transliteration: Qaala Rabbi inneee akhaafu ai yukazziboon

26.text: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِي وَلَا يَنْطَلِقُ لِسَانِي فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَارُونَ
26.translation: And that my breast will tighten and my tongue will not be fluent, so send for Aaron.
26.transliteration: Wa yadeequ sadree wa laa yantaliqu lisaanee fa arsil ilaa Haaroon

26.text: وَلَهُمْ عَلَيَّ ذَنْبٌ فَأَخَافُ أَنْ يَقْتُلُونِ
26.translation: And they have upon me a [claim due to] sin, so I fear that they will kill me."
26.transliteration: Wa lahum 'alaiya zambun fa akhaafu ai yaqtuloon

26.text: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ فَاذْهَبَا بِآيَاتِنَا ۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُمْ مُسْتَمِعُونَ
26.translation: [Allah] said, "No. Go both of you with Our signs; indeed, We are with you, listening.
26.transliteration: Qaala kallaa fazhabaa bi Aayaatinaaa innaa ma'akum mustami'oon

26.text: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَا إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
26.translation: Go to Pharaoh and say, 'We are the messengers of the Lord of the worlds,
26.transliteration: Faatiyaa Fir'awna faqoolaaa innaa Rasoolu Rabbil 'aalameen

26.translation: [Commanded to say], "Send with us the Children of Israel."'"
26.transliteration: An arsil ma'anaa Baneee Israaa'eel

26.text: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
26.translation: [Pharaoh] said, "Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you remained among us for years of your life?
26.transliteration: Qaala alam nurabbika feenaa waleedanw wa labista feenaa min 'umurika sineen

26.text: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ الَّتِي فَعَلْتَ وَأَنْتَ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ
26.translation: And [then] you did your deed which you did, and you were of the ungrateful."
26.transliteration: Wa fa'alta fa'latakal latee fa'alta wa anta minal kaafireen

26.text: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَا إِذًا وَأَنَا مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ
26.translation: [Moses] said, "I did it, then, while I was of those astray.
26.transliteration: Qaala fa'altuhaaa izanw wa ana minad daaaleen

26.text: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنْكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكْمًا وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
26.translation: So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me wisdom and prophethood and appointed me [as one] of the messengers.
26.transliteration: Fafarartu minkum lam maa khiftukum fawahaba lee Rabbee hukmanw wa ja'alanee minal mursaleen

26.text: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنْ عَبَّدْتَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
26.translation: And is this a favor of which you remind me - that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"
26.transliteration: Wa tilka ni'matun tamun nuhaa 'alaiya an 'abbatta Baneee Israaa'eel

26.translation: Said Pharaoh, "And what is the Lord of the worlds?"
26.transliteration: Qaala Fir'awnu wa maa Rabbul 'aalameen

26.text: قَالَ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُوقِنِينَ
26.translation: [Moses] said, "The Lord of the heavens and earth and that between them, if you should be convinced."
26.transliteration: Qaala Rabbus samaawaati wal ardi wa maa bainahumaa in kuntum mooqineen

26.translation: [Pharaoh] said to those around him, "Do you not hear?"
26.transliteration: Qaala liman hawlahooo alaa tastami'oon

26.translation: [Moses] said, "Your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers."
26.transliteration: Qaala Rabbukum wa Rabbu aabaaa'ikumul awwaleen

26.text: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ الَّذِي أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ
26.translation: [Pharaoh] said, "Indeed, your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad."
26.transliteration: Qaala inna Rasoolakumul lazee ursila ilaikum lamajnoon

26.text: قَالَ رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
26.translation: [Moses] said, "Lord of the east and the west and that between them, if you were to reason."
26.transliteration: Qaala Rabbul mashriqi wal maghribi wa maa baina humaa in kuntum ta'qiloon

26.text: قَالَ لَئِنِ اتَّخَذْتَ إِلَٰهًا غَيْرِي لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ الْمَسْجُونِينَ
26.translation: [Pharaoh] said, "If you take a god other than me, I will surely place you among those imprisoned."
26.transliteration: Qaala la'init takhazta ilaahan ghairee la aj'alannaka minal masjooneen

26.translation: [Moses] said, "Even if I brought you proof manifest?"
26.transliteration: Qaala awalw ji'tuka bishai'im mubeen

26.text: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِ إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
26.translation: [Pharaoh] said, "Then bring it, if you should be of the truthful."
26.transliteration: Qaala faati biheee in kunta minas saadiqeen

26.text: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُبِينٌ
26.translation: So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.
26.transliteration: Fa alqaa 'asaahu fa izaaa hiya su'baanum mubeen

26.text: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيْضَاءُ لِلنَّاظِرِينَ
26.translation: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white for the observers.
26.transliteration: Wa naza'a yadahoo faizaa hiya baidaaa'u linnaa zireen

26.text: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَاحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
26.translation: [Pharaoh] said to the eminent ones around him, "Indeed, this is a learned magician.
26.transliteration: Qaala lilmala-i hawlahooo inna haazaa lasaahirun 'aleem

26.text: يُرِيدُ أَنْ يُخْرِجَكُمْ مِنْ أَرْضِكُمْ بِسِحْرِهِ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
26.translation: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic, so what do you advise?"
26.transliteration: Yureedu ai yukhrijakum min ardikum bisihrihee famaazaa taamuroon

26.text: قَالُوا أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَابْعَثْ فِي الْمَدَائِنِ حَاشِرِينَ
26.translation: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers
26.transliteration: Qaalooo arjih wa akhaahu wab'as filmadaaa'ini haashireen

26.translation: Who will bring you every learned, skilled magician."
26.transliteration: Yaatooka bikulli sah haarin 'aleem

26.translation: So the magicians were assembled for the appointment of a well-known day.
26.transliteration: Fa jumi'as saharatu limeeqaati Yawmim ma'loom

26.translation: And it was said to the people, "Will you congregate
26.transliteration: Wa qeela linnaasi hal antum mujtami'oon

26.text: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ السَّحَرَةَ إِنْ كَانُوا هُمُ الْغَالِبِينَ
26.translation: That we might follow the magicians if they are the predominant?"
26.transliteration: La'allanaa nattabi'us saharata in kaanoo humul ghaalibeen

26.text: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ السَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِنْ كُنَّا نَحْنُ الْغَالِبِينَ
26.translation: And when the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, "Is there indeed for us a reward if we are the predominant?"
26.transliteration: Falammaa jaaa'as saharatu qaaloo li Fir'awna a'inna lanaa la ajjran in kunnaa nahnul ghaalibeen

26.text: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَمِنَ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ
26.translation: He said, "Yes, and indeed, you will then be of those near [to me]."
26.transliteration: Qaala na'am wa innakum izal laminal muqarrabeen

26.text: قَالَ لَهُمْ مُوسَىٰ أَلْقُوا مَا أَنْتُمْ مُلْقُونَ
26.translation: Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you will throw."
26.transliteration: Qaala lahum Moosaaa alqoo maaa antum mulqoon

26.text: فَأَلْقَوْا حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الْغَالِبُونَ
26.translation: So they threw their ropes and their staffs and said, "By the might of Pharaoh, indeed it is we who are predominant."
26.transliteration: Fa alqaw hibaalahum wa 'isiyyahum wa qaaloo bi'izzati Fir'awna innaa lanahnul ghaaliboon

26.text: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
26.translation: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it devoured what they falsified.
26.transliteration: Fa alqaa Moosaa 'asaahu fa izaa hiya talqafu maa yaafikoon

26.translation: So the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allah].
26.transliteration: Fa ulqiyas saharatu saajideen

26.translation: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,
26.transliteration: Qaalooo aamannaa bi Rabbil 'aalameen

26.translation: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
26.transliteration: Rabbi Moosaa wa Haaroon

26.text: قَالَ آمَنْتُمْ لَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ آذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ الَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُمْ مِنْ خِلَافٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
26.translation: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed Moses before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic, but you are going to know. I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you all."
26.transliteration: Qaala aamantum lahoo qabla an aazana lakum innahoo lakabeerukumul lazee 'alla makumus sihra falasawfa ta'lamoon; la uqatti'anna aidiyakum wa arjulakum min khilaafinw wa la usallibanna kum ajma'een

26.text: قَالُوا لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنْقَلِبُونَ
26.translation: They said, "No harm. Indeed, to our Lord we will return.
26.transliteration: Qaaloo la daira innaaa ilaa Rabbinaa munqalliboon

26.text: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَنْ يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَايَانَا أَنْ كُنَّا أَوَّلَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
26.translation: Indeed, we aspire that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we were the first of the believers."
26.transliteration: Innaa natma'u ai yaghfira lanaa Rabbunna khataa yaanaaa an kunnaaa awwalal mu'mineen

26.text: ۞ وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي إِنَّكُمْ مُتَّبَعُونَ
26.translation: And We inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants; indeed, you will be pursued."
26.transliteration: Wa awhainaaa ilaa Moosaaa an asri bi'ibaadeee innakum muttaba'oon

26.translation: Then Pharaoh sent among the cities gatherers
26.transliteration: Fa arsala Fir'awnu filmadaaa'ini haashireen

26.translation: [And said], "Indeed, those are but a small band,
26.transliteration: Inna haaa'ulaaa'i lashir zimatun qaleeloon

26.translation: And indeed, they are enraging us,
26.transliteration: Wa innahum lanaa laghaaa'izoon

26.translation: And indeed, we are a cautious society... "
26.transliteration: Wa innaa lajamee'un haaziroon

26.translation: So We removed them from gardens and springs
26.transliteration: Fa akhrajnaahum min Jannaatinw wa 'uyoon

26.translation: And treasures and honorable station -
26.transliteration: Wa kunoozinw wa ma qaamin kareem

26.translation: Thus. And We caused to inherit it the Children of Israel.
26.transliteration: Kazaalika wa awrasnaahaa Baneee Israaa'eel

26.translation: So they pursued them at sunrise.
26.transliteration: Fa atba'oohum mushriqeen

26.text: فَلَمَّا تَرَاءَى الْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَابُ مُوسَىٰ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ
26.translation: And when the two companies saw one another, the companions of Moses said, "Indeed, we are to be overtaken!"
26.transliteration: Falammaa taraaa'al jam'aani qaala as haabu Moosaaa innaa lamudrakoon

26.text: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهْدِينِ
26.translation: [Moses] said, "No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me."
26.transliteration: Qaala kallaaa inna ma'iya Rabbee sa yahdeen

26.text: فَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ اضْرِبْ بِعَصَاكَ الْبَحْرَ ۖ فَانْفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍ كَالطَّوْدِ الْعَظِيمِ
26.translation: Then We inspired to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea," and it parted, and each portion was like a great towering mountain.
26.transliteration: Fa awhainaaa ilaa Moosaaa anidrib bi'asaakal bahra fanfalaqa fakaana kullu firqin kattawdil 'azeem

26.translation: And We advanced thereto the pursuers.
26.transliteration: Wa azlafnaa sammal aakhareen

26.translation: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.
26.transliteration: Wa anjainaa Moosaa wa mam ma'ahooo ajma'een

26.translation: Then We drowned the others.
26.transliteration: Summa aghraqnal aakhareen

26.text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
26.translation: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
26.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika la Aayaah; wa maa kaana aksaru hu mu'mineen

26.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
26.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la Huwal 'Azeezur Raheem

26.translation: And recite to them the news of Abraham,
26.transliteration: Watlu 'alaihim naba-a Ibraaheem

26.text: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
26.translation: When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"
26.transliteration: Iz qaala li abeehi wa qawmihee maa ta'budoon

26.text: قَالُوا نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَاكِفِينَ
26.translation: They said, "We worship idols and remain to them devoted."
26.transliteration: Qaaloo na'budu asnaaman fanazallu lahaa 'aakifeen

26.translation: He said, "Do they hear you when you supplicate?
26.transliteration: Qaala hal yasma'oona kum iz tad'oon

26.translation: Or do they benefit you, or do they harm?"
26.transliteration: Aw yanfa'oonakum aw yadurroon

26.text: قَالُوا بَلْ وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
26.translation: They said, "But we found our fathers doing thus."
26.transliteration: Qaaloo bal wajadnaaa aabaaa 'anaa kazaalika yaf'aloon

26.translation: He said, "Then do you see what you have been worshipping,
26.transliteration: Qaala afara 'aitum maa kuntum ta'budoon

26.translation: You and your ancient forefathers?
26.transliteration: Antum wa aabaaa'ukumul aqdamoon

26.text: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّ لِي إِلَّا رَبَّ الْعَالَمِينَ
26.translation: Indeed, they are enemies to me, except the Lord of the worlds,
26.transliteration: Fa innahum 'aduwwwul leee illaa Rabbal 'aalameen

26.translation: Who created me, and He [it is who] guides me.
26.transliteration: Allazee khalaqanee fa Huwa yahdeen

26.translation: And it is He who feeds me and gives me drink.
26.transliteration: Wallazee Huwa yut'imunee wa yasqeen

26.translation: And when I am ill, it is He who cures me
26.transliteration: Wa izaa mardtu fahuwa yashfeen

26.translation: And who will cause me to die and then bring me to life
26.transliteration: Wallazee yumeetunee summa yuhyeen

26.text: وَالَّذِي أَطْمَعُ أَنْ يَغْفِرَ لِي خَطِيئَتِي يَوْمَ الدِّينِ
26.translation: And who I aspire that He will forgive me my sin on the Day of Recompense."
26.transliteration: Wallazeee atma'u ai yaghfira lee khateee' atee Yawmad Deen

26.text: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي حُكْمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِي بِالصَّالِحِينَ
26.translation: [And he said], "My Lord, grant me authority and join me with the righteous.
26.transliteration: Rabbi hab lee hukmanw wa alhiqnee bis saaliheen

26.text: وَاجْعَلْ لِي لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِي الْآخِرِينَ
26.translation: And grant me a reputation of honor among later generations.
26.transliteration: Waj'al lee lisaana sidqin fil aakhireen

26.translation: And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure.
26.transliteration: Waj'alnee minw warasati Jannnatin Na'eem

26.text: وَاغْفِرْ لِأَبِي إِنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ
26.translation: And forgive my father. Indeed, he has been of those astray.
26.transliteration: Waghfir li abeee innahoo kaana mind daalleen

26.translation: And do not disgrace me on the Day they are [all] resurrected -
26.transliteration: Wa laa tukhzinee Yawma yub'asoon

26.text: يَوْمَ لَا يَنْفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ
26.translation: The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children
26.transliteration: Yawma laa yanfa'u maalunw wa laa banoon

26.text: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى اللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
26.translation: But only one who comes to Allah with a sound heart."
26.transliteration: Illaa man atal laaha biqalbin saleem

26.translation: And Paradise will be brought near [that Day] to the righteous.
26.transliteration: Wa uzlifatil Jannatu lilmuttaqeen

26.translation: And Hellfire will be brought forth for the deviators,
26.transliteration: Wa burrizatil Jaheemu lilghaaween

26.text: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
26.translation: And it will be said to them, "Where are those you used to worship
26.transliteration: Wa qeela lahum aina maa kuntum ta'budoon

26.text: مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ هَلْ يَنْصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنْتَصِرُونَ
26.translation: Other than Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?"
26.transliteration: Min doonil laahi hal yansuroonakum aw yantasiroon

26.translation: So they will be overturned into Hellfire, they and the deviators
26.transliteration: Fakubkiboo feehaa hum walghaawoon

26.translation: And the soldiers of Iblees, all together.
26.transliteration: Wa junoodu Ibleesa ajma'oon

26.translation: They will say while they dispute therein,
26.transliteration: Qaaloo wa hum feehaa yakkhtasimoon

26.text: تَاللَّهِ إِنْ كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ مُبِينٍ
26.translation: "By Allah, we were indeed in manifest error
26.transliteration: Tallaahi in kunnaa lafee dalaalim mubeen

26.translation: When we equated you with the Lord of the worlds.
26.transliteration: Iz nusawweekum bi Rabbil 'aalameen

26.translation: And no one misguided us except the criminals.
26.transliteration: Wa maaa adallanaaa illal mujrimoon

26.translation: So now we have no intercessors
26.transliteration: Famaa lanaa min shaa fi'een

26.translation: And not a devoted friend.
26.transliteration: Wa laa sadeeqin hameem

26.text: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
26.translation: Then if we only had a return [to the world] and could be of the believers... "
26.transliteration: Falaw anna lanaa karratan fanakoona minal mu'mineen

26.text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
26.translation: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
26.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika la Aayatanw wa maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen

26.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
26.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la Huwal 'Azeezur Raheem

26.translation: The people of Noah denied the messengers
26.transliteration: Kazzabat qawmu Noohinil Mursaleen

26.text: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
26.translation: When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?
26.transliteration: Iz qaala lahum akhoohum Noohun alaa tattaqoon

26.translation: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
26.transliteration: Innee lakum Rasoolun ameen

26.translation: So fear Allah and obey me.
26.transliteration: Fattaqullaaha wa atee'oon

26.text: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
26.translation: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
26.transliteration: Wa maaa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin in ajriya illaa 'alaa Rabbil 'aalameen

26.translation: So fear Allah and obey me."
26.transliteration: Fattaqul laaha wa atee'oon

26.translation: They said, "Should we believe you while you are followed by the lowest [class of people]?"
26.transliteration: Qaalooo anu'minu laka wattaba 'akal arzaloon

26.text: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِي بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
26.translation: He said, "And what is my knowledge of what they used to do?
26.transliteration: Qaala wa maa 'ilmee bimaa kaanoo ya'maloon

26.text: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّي ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ
26.translation: Their account is only upon my Lord, if you [could] perceive.
26.transliteration: In hisaabuhum illaa 'alaa Rabbee law tash'uroon

26.translation: And I am not one to drive away the believers.
26.transliteration: Wa maaa ana bitaaridil mu'mineen

26.translation: I am only a clear warner."
26.transliteration: In ana illaa nazeerum mubeen

26.text: قَالُوا لَئِنْ لَمْ تَنْتَهِ يَا نُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمَرْجُومِينَ
26.translation: They said, "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will surely be of those who are stoned."
26.transliteration: Qaaloo la'il lam tantahi yaa Noohu latakoonanna minal marjoomeen

26.translation: He said, "My Lord, indeed my people have denied me.
26.transliteration: Qaala Rabbi inna qawmee kazzaboon

26.text: فَافْتَحْ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَنْ مَعِيَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
26.translation: Then judge between me and them with decisive judgement and save me and those with me of the believers."
26.transliteration: Faftab bainee wa bai nahum fat hanw wa najjinee wa mam ma'iya minal mu'mineen

26.text: فَأَنْجَيْنَاهُ وَمَنْ مَعَهُ فِي الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ
26.translation: So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.
26.transliteration: Fa anjainaahu wa mamma'ahoo fil fulkil mashhoon

26.translation: Then We drowned thereafter the remaining ones.
26.transliteration: Summa aghraqnaa ba'dul baaqeen

26.text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
26.translation: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
26.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika la Aayaah; wa maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen

26.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
26.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la huwal 'Azeezur Raheem

26.translation: 'Aad denied the messengers
26.transliteration: Kazzabat 'Aadunil mursaleen

26.text: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
26.translation: When their brother Hud said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?
26.transliteration: Iz qaala lahum akhoohum Hoodun alaa tattaqoon

26.translation: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
26.transliteration: Innee lakum Rasoolun ameen

26.translation: So fear Allah and obey me.
26.transliteration: Fattaqullaaha wa atee'oon

26.text: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
26.translation: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
26.transliteration: Wa maa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin in ajriya illaa 'alaa Rabbil 'aalameen

26.translation: Do you construct on every elevation a sign, amusing yourselves,
26.transliteration: Atabnoona bikulli ree'in aayatan ta'basoon

26.translation: And take for yourselves palaces and fortresses that you might abide eternally?
26.transliteration: Wa tattakhizoona masaani'a la'allakum takhludoon

26.translation: And when you strike, you strike as tyrants.
26.transliteration: Wa izaa batashtum batashtum jabbaareen

26.translation: So fear Allah and obey me.
26.transliteration: Fattaqul laaha wa atee'oon

26.translation: And fear He who provided you with that which you know,
26.transliteration: Wattaqul lazeee amad dakum bimaa ta'lamoon

26.translation: Provided you with grazing livestock and children
26.transliteration: Amaddakum bi an'aa minw wa baneen

26.translation: And gardens and springs.
26.transliteration: Wa jannaatinw wa 'uyoon

26.text: إِنِّي أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
26.translation: Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."
26.transliteration: Innee akhaafu 'alaikum 'azaaba Yawmin 'azeem

26.text: قَالُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْنَا أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُنْ مِنَ الْوَاعِظِينَ
26.translation: They said, "It is all the same to us whether you advise or are not of the advisors.
26.transliteration: Qaaloo sawaaa'un 'alainaaa awa 'azta am lam takum minal waa'izeen

26.translation: This is not but the custom of the former peoples,
26.transliteration: In haazaaa illaa khuluqul awwaleen

26.translation: And we are not to be punished."
26.transliteration: Wa maa nahnu bimu 'azzabeen

26.text: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
26.translation: And they denied him, so We destroyed them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
26.transliteration: Fakazzaboohu fa ahlaknaahum; inna fee zaalika la aayah; wa maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen

26.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
26.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la huwal 'Azeezur Raheem

26.translation: Thamud denied the messengers
26.transliteration: Kazzabat Samoodul mursaleen

26.text: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَالِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
26.translation: When their brother Salih said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?
26.transliteration: Iz qaala lahum akhoohum Saalihun alaa tattaqoon

26.translation: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
26.transliteration: Innee lakum Rasoolun ameen

26.translation: So fear Allah and obey me.
26.transliteration: Fattaqul laaha wa atee'oon

26.text: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
26.translation: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
26.transliteration: Wa maaa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin in ajriya illaa 'alaa Rabbil 'aalameen

26.translation: Will you be left in what is here, secure [from death],
26.transliteration: Atutrakoona fee maa haahunnaaa aamineen

26.translation: Within gardens and springs
26.transliteration: Fee jannaatinw wa 'uyoon

26.translation: And fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit?
26.transliteration: Wa zuroo inw wa nakhlin tal 'uhaa hadeem

26.translation: And you carve out of the mountains, homes, with skill.
26.transliteration: Wa tanhitoona minal jibaali buyootan faariheen

26.translation: So fear Allah and obey me.
26.transliteration: Fattaqul laaha wa atee'oon

26.translation: And do not obey the order of the transgressors,
26.transliteration: Wa laa tutee'ooo amral musrifeen

26.text: الَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
26.translation: Who cause corruption in the land and do not amend."
26.transliteration: Allazeena yufsidoona fil ardi wa laa yuslihoon

26.translation: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.
26.transliteration: Qaalooo innamaa anta minal musahhareen

26.text: مَا أَنْتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِآيَةٍ إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
26.translation: You are but a man like ourselves, so bring a sign, if you should be of the truthful."
26.transliteration: Maaa anta illaa basharum mislunaa faati bi Aayatin in kunta minas saadiqeen

26.text: قَالَ هَٰذِهِ نَاقَةٌ لَهَا شِرْبٌ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَعْلُومٍ
26.translation: He said, "This is a she-camel. For her is a [time of] drink, and for you is a [time of] drink, [each] on a known day.
26.transliteration: Qaala haazihee naaqatul lahaa shirbunw w alakum shirbu yawmim ma'loom

26.text: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
26.translation: And do not touch her with harm, lest you be seized by the punishment of a terrible day."
26.transliteration: Wa laa tamassoohaa bisooo'in fa yaakhuzakum 'azaabu Yawmin 'Azeem

26.translation: But they hamstrung her and so became regretful.
26.transliteration: Fa'aqaroohaa fa asbahoo naadimeen

26.text: فَأَخَذَهُمُ الْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
26.translation: And the punishment seized them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
26.transliteration: Fa akhazahumul 'azaab; inna fee zaalika la Aayah; wa maa kaana aksaruhum m'mineen

26.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
26.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la Huwal 'Azeezur Raheem

26.translation: The people of Lot denied the messengers
26.transliteration: kazzabat qawmu Lootinil mursaleen

26.text: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
26.translation: When their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?
26.transliteration: Iz qaala lahum akhoohum Lootun alaa tattaqoon

26.translation: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
26.transliteration: Innee lakum rasoolun ameen

26.translation: So fear Allah and obey me.
26.transliteration: Fattaqul laaha wa atee'oon

26.text: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
26.translation: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
26.transliteration: Wa maaa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin in ajriya illaa 'alaa Rabbil 'aalameen

26.translation: Do you approach males among the worlds
26.transliteration: Ataatoonaz zukraana minal 'aalameen

26.text: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُمْ مِنْ أَزْوَاجِكُمْ ۚ بَلْ أَنْتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ
26.translation: And leave what your Lord has created for you as mates? But you are a people transgressing."
26.transliteration: Wa tazaroona maa khalaqa lakum Rabbukum min azwaajikum; bal antum qawmun 'aadoon

26.text: قَالُوا لَئِنْ لَمْ تَنْتَهِ يَا لُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمُخْرَجِينَ
26.translation: They said, "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will surely be of those evicted."
26.transliteration: Qaloo la'il lam tantahi yaa Lootu latakoonanna minal mukhrajeen

26.translation: He said, "Indeed, I am, toward your deed, of those who detest [it].
26.transliteration: Qaala innee li'amalikum minal qaaleen

26.translation: My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequence of] what they do."
26.transliteration: Rabbi najjjinee wa ahlee mimmmaa ya'maloon

26.translation: So We saved him and his family, all,
26.transliteration: Fanajjainaahu wa ahlahooo ajma'een

26.translation: Except an old woman among those who remained behind.
26.transliteration: Illaa 'ajoozan filghaabireen

26.translation: Then We destroyed the others.
26.transliteration: Summa dammarnal aa khareen

26.text: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ مَطَرًا ۖ فَسَاءَ مَطَرُ الْمُنْذَرِينَ
26.translation: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.
26.transliteration: Wa amtarnaa 'alaihim mataran fasaaa'a matarul munzareen

26.text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
26.translation: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
26.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika la Aayah; wa maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen

26.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
26.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la Huwal 'Azeezur Raheem

26.translation: The companions of the thicket denied the messengers
26.transliteration: Kazzaba As haabul Aykatil mursaleen

26.text: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
26.translation: When Shu'ayb said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?
26.transliteration: Iz qaala lahum Shu'aybun alaa tattaqoon

26.translation: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
26.transliteration: Innee lakum Rasoolun ameen

26.translation: So fear Allah and obey me.
26.transliteration: Fattaqul laaha wa atee'oon

26.text: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
26.translation: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
26.transliteration: Wa maaa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin in ajriya illaa 'alaa Rabbil 'aalameen

26.text: ۞ أَوْفُوا الْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا مِنَ الْمُخْسِرِينَ
26.translation: Give full measure and do not be of those who cause loss.
26.transliteration: Awful kaila wa laa takoonoo minal mukhsireen

26.translation: And weigh with an even balance.
26.transliteration: Wa zinoo bilqistaasil mustaqeem

26.text: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا النَّاسَ أَشْيَاءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا فِي الْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
26.translation: And do not deprive people of their due and do not commit abuse on earth, spreading corruption.
26.transliteration: Wa laa tabkhasun naasa ashyaaa 'ahum wa laa ta'saw fil ardi mufsideen

26.translation: And fear He who created you and the former creation."
26.transliteration: Wattaqul lazee khalaqakum waljibillatal awwaleen

26.translation: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.
26.transliteration: Qaalooo innamaa anta minal musahhareen

26.text: وَمَا أَنْتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُنَا وَإِنْ نَظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
26.translation: You are but a man like ourselves, and indeed, we think you are among the liars.
26.transliteration: Wa maaa anta illaa basharum mislunaa wa innazunnuka laminal kaazibeen

26.text: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
26.translation: So cause to fall upon us fragments of the sky, if you should be of the truthful."
26.transliteration: Fa asqit 'alainaa kisafam minas samaaa'i in kunta minas saadiqeen

26.translation: He said, "My Lord is most knowing of what you do."
26.transliteration: Qaala Rabbeee a'lamu bimaa ta'maloon

26.text: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ الظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
26.translation: And they denied him, so the punishment of the day of the black cloud seized them. Indeed, it was the punishment of a terrible day.
26.transliteration: Fakazzaboohu fa akhazahum 'azaabu Yawmiz zullah; innahoo kaana 'azaaba Yawmin 'Azeem

26.text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
26.translation: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
26.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika la Aayah; wa maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen

26.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
26.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la huwal 'Azeezur Raheem

26.translation: And indeed, the Qur'an is the revelation of the Lord of the worlds.
26.transliteration: Wa innahoo latanzeelu Rabbil 'aalameen

26.translation: The Trustworthy Spirit has brought it down
26.transliteration: Nazala bihir Roohul Ameen

26.translation: Upon your heart, [O Muhammad] - that you may be of the warners -
26.transliteration: 'Alaa qalbika litakoona minal munzireen

26.translation: In a clear Arabic language.
26.transliteration: Bilisaanin 'Arabiyyim mubeen

26.translation: And indeed, it is [mentioned] in the scriptures of former peoples.
26.transliteration: Wa innahoo lafee Zuburil awwaleen

26.text: أَوَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُمْ آيَةً أَنْ يَعْلَمَهُ عُلَمَاءُ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
26.translation: And has it not been a sign to them that it is recognized by the scholars of the Children of Israel?
26.transliteration: Awalam yakul lahum Aayatan ai ya'lamahoo 'ulamaaa'u Baneee Israaa'eel

26.translation: And even if We had revealed it to one among the foreigners
26.transliteration: Wa law nazzalnaahu 'alaa ba'dil a'jameen

26.text: فَقَرَأَهُ عَلَيْهِمْ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ مُؤْمِنِينَ
26.translation: And he had recited it to them [perfectly], they would [still] not have been believers in it.
26.transliteration: Faqara ahoo 'alaihim maa kaanoo bihee mu'mineen

26.translation: Thus have We inserted disbelief into the hearts of the criminals.
26.transliteration: Kazaalika salaknaahu fee quloobil mujrimeen

26.text: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ
26.translation: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.
26.transliteration: Laa yu'minoona bihee hattaa yarawul 'azaabal aleem

26.translation: And it will come to them suddenly while they perceive [it] not.
26.transliteration: Fayaatiyahum baghtatanw wa hum laa yash'uroon

26.translation: And they will say, "May we be reprieved?"
26.transliteration: Fa yaqooloo hal nahnu munzaroon

26.translation: So for Our punishment are they impatient?
26.transliteration: Aafabi 'azaabinaa yasta'jiloon

26.translation: Then have you considered if We gave them enjoyment for years
26.transliteration: Aara'aita im matta'naahum sineen

26.translation: And then there came to them that which they were promised?
26.transliteration: Summa jaaa'ahum maa kaanoo yoo'adoon

26.text: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُمْ مَا كَانُوا يُمَتَّعُونَ
26.translation: They would not be availed by the enjoyment with which they were provided.
26.transliteration: Maaa aghnaaa 'anhum maa kaanoo yumaatoo'oon

26.text: وَمَا أَهْلَكْنَا مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنْذِرُونَ
26.translation: And We did not destroy any city except that it had warners
26.transliteration: Wa maaa ahlaknaa min qaryatin illaa lahaa munziroon

26.translation: As a reminder; and never have We been unjust.
26.transliteration: Zikraa wa maa kunnaa zaalimeen

26.translation: And the devils have not brought the revelation down.
26.transliteration: Wa maa tanazzalat bihish Shayaateen

26.translation: It is not allowable for them, nor would they be able.
26.transliteration: Wa maa yambaghee lahum wa maa yastatee'oon

26.translation: Indeed they, from [its] hearing, are removed.
26.transliteration: Innahum 'anis sam'i lama'zooloon

26.text: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُعَذَّبِينَ
26.translation: So do not invoke with Allah another deity and [thus] be among the punished.
26.transliteration: Falaa tad'u ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhara fatakoona minal mu'azzabeen

26.translation: And warn, [O Muhammad], your closest kindred.
26.transliteration: Wa anzir 'asheeratakal aqrabeen

26.text: وَاخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
26.translation: And lower your wing to those who follow you of the believers.
26.transliteration: Wakhfid janaahaka limanit taba 'aka minal mu'mineen

26.text: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّي بَرِيءٌ مِمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
26.translation: And if they disobey you, then say, "Indeed, I am disassociated from what you are doing."
26.transliteration: Fa in asawka faqul innee bareee'um mimmmaa ta'maloon

26.translation: And rely upon the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,
26.transliteration: Wa tawakkal alal 'Azeezir Raheem

26.translation: Who sees you when you arise
26.transliteration: Allazee yaraaka heena taqoom

26.translation: And your movement among those who prostrate.
26.transliteration: Wa taqallubaka fis saajideen

26.translation: Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
26.transliteration: Innahoo Huwas Samee'ul 'Aleem

26.text: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَنْ تَنَزَّلُ الشَّيَاطِينُ
26.translation: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?
26.transliteration: Hal unabbi'ukum 'alaa man tanazzalush Shayaateen

26.translation: They descend upon every sinful liar.
26.transliteration: Tanazzalu 'alaa kulli affaakin aseem

26.translation: They pass on what is heard, and most of them are liars.
26.transliteration: Yulqoonas sam'a wa aksaruhum aaziboon

26.translation: And the poets - [only] the deviators follow them;
26.transliteration: Washshu 'araaa'u yattabi 'uhumul ghaawoon

26.text: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِي كُلِّ وَادٍ يَهِيمُونَ
26.translation: Do you not see that in every valley they roam
26.transliteration: Alam tara annahum fee kulli waadiny yaheemoon

26.translation: And that they say what they do not do? -
26.transliteration: Wa annahum yaqooloona ma laa yaf'aloon

26.text: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَذَكَرُوا اللَّهَ كَثِيرًا وَانْتَصَرُوا مِنْ بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا أَيَّ مُنْقَلَبٍ يَنْقَلِبُونَ
26.translation: Except those [poets] who believe and do righteous deeds and remember Allah often and defend [the Muslims] after they were wronged. And those who have wronged are going to know to what [kind of] return they will be returned.
26.transliteration: Illal lazeena aamanoo w a'amilus saalihaati wa zakarul laaha kaseeranw wantasaroo mim ba'di maa zulimoo; wa saya'lamul lazeena zalamooo aiya munqalbiny yanqaliboon

27.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ طس ۚ تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْقُرْآنِ وَكِتَابٍ مُبِينٍ
27.translation: Ta, Seen. These are the verses of the Qur'an and a clear Book
27.transliteration: Taa-Seeen; tilka Aayaatul Qur-aani wa Kitaabim Mubeen

27.text: هُدًى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
27.translation: As guidance and good tidings for the believers
27.transliteration: Hudanw wa bushraa lil mu'mineen

27.text: الَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ الصَّلَاةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ الزَّكَاةَ وَهُمْ بِالْآخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ
27.translation: Who establish prayer and give zakah, and of the Hereafter they are certain [in faith].
27.transliteration: Allazeena yuqeemoonas Salaata wa yu'toonaz Zakaata wa hum bil Aakhirati hum yooqinoon

27.text: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ زَيَّنَّا لَهُمْ أَعْمَالَهُمْ فَهُمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
27.translation: Indeed, for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made pleasing to them their deeds, so they wander blindly.
27.transliteration: Innal lazeena laa yu'mimoona bil Aakhirati zaiyannaa lahum a'maalahum fahum ya'mahoon

27.text: أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ لَهُمْ سُوءُ الْعَذَابِ وَهُمْ فِي الْآخِرَةِ هُمُ الْأَخْسَرُونَ
27.translation: Those are the ones for whom there will be the worst of punishment, and in the Hereafter they are the greatest losers.
27.transliteration: Ulaaa'ikal lazeena lahum sooo'ul 'azaabi wa hum fil Aakhirati humul akhsaroon

27.text: وَإِنَّكَ لَتُلَقَّى الْقُرْآنَ مِنْ لَدُنْ حَكِيمٍ عَلِيمٍ
27.translation: And indeed, [O Muhammad], you receive the Qur'an from one Wise and Knowing.
27.transliteration: Wa innaka latulaqqal Qur-aana mil ladun Hakeemin 'Aleem

27.text: إِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَهْلِهِ إِنِّي آنَسْتُ نَارًا سَآتِيكُمْ مِنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ آتِيكُمْ بِشِهَابٍ قَبَسٍ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ
27.translation: [Mention] when Moses said to his family, "Indeed, I have perceived a fire. I will bring you from there information or will bring you a burning torch that you may warm yourselves."
27.transliteration: Iz qaala Moosaa li ahliheee inneee aanastu naaran saaateekum minhaa bikhabarin aw aateekum bishihaabin qabasil la'allakum tastaloon

27.text: فَلَمَّا جَاءَهَا نُودِيَ أَنْ بُورِكَ مَنْ فِي النَّارِ وَمَنْ حَوْلَهَا وَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
27.translation: But when he came to it, he was called, "Blessed is whoever is at the fire and whoever is around it. And exalted is Allah, Lord of the worlds.
27.transliteration: Falammaa jaaa'ahaa noodiya am boorika man finnnnaari wa man hawlahaa wa Subhaanal laahi Rabbil 'aalameen

27.text: يَا مُوسَىٰ إِنَّهُ أَنَا اللَّهُ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
27.translation: O Moses, indeed it is I - Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise."
27.transliteration: Yaa Moosaaa innahooo Anal laahul 'Azeezul Hakeem

27.text: وَأَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَآهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَانٌّ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِرًا وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ ۚ يَا مُوسَىٰ لَا تَخَفْ إِنِّي لَا يَخَافُ لَدَيَّ الْمُرْسَلُونَ
27.translation: And [he was told], "Throw down your staff." But when he saw it writhing as if it were a snake, he turned in flight and did not return. [Allah said], "O Moses, fear not. Indeed, in My presence the messengers do not fear.
27.transliteration: Wa alqi 'asaak; falammmaa ra aahaa tahtazzu ka annahaa jaaannunw wallaa mudbiranw wa lam yu'aqqib; yaa Moosaa laa takhaf innee laa yakhaafu ladaiyal mursaloon

27.text: إِلَّا مَنْ ظَلَمَ ثُمَّ بَدَّلَ حُسْنًا بَعْدَ سُوءٍ فَإِنِّي غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ
27.translation: Otherwise, he who wrongs, then substitutes good after evil - indeed, I am Forgiving and Merciful.
27.transliteration: Illaa man zalama summa baddala husnam ba'da sooo'in fa innee Ghafoorur Raheem

27.text: وَأَدْخِلْ يَدَكَ فِي جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَاءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوءٍ ۖ فِي تِسْعِ آيَاتٍ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَقَوْمِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ
27.translation: And put your hand into the opening of your garment [at the breast]; it will come out white without disease. [These are] among the nine signs [you will take] to Pharaoh and his people. Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient."
27.transliteration: Wa adkhil yadaka fee jaibika takhruj baidaaa'a min ghairisooo'in feetis'i Aayaatin ilaa Fir'awna wa qawmih; innahum kaanoo qawman faasiqeen

27.text: فَلَمَّا جَاءَتْهُمْ آيَاتُنَا مُبْصِرَةً قَالُوا هَٰذَا سِحْرٌ مُبِينٌ
27.translation: But when there came to them Our visible signs, they said, "This is obvious magic."
27.transliteration: Falammaa jaaa'at hum Aayaatunaa mubsiratan qaaloo haazaa sihrum mubeen

27.text: وَجَحَدُوا بِهَا وَاسْتَيْقَنَتْهَا أَنْفُسُهُمْ ظُلْمًا وَعُلُوًّا ۚ فَانْظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُفْسِدِينَ
27.translation: And they rejected them, while their [inner] selves were convinced thereof, out of injustice and haughtiness. So see how was the end of the corrupters.
27.transliteration: Wa jahadoo bihaa wastaiqanat haaa anfusuhum zulmanw-wa 'uluwwaa; fanzur kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul mufsideen

27.text: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا دَاوُودَ وَسُلَيْمَانَ عِلْمًا ۖ وَقَالَا الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي فَضَّلَنَا عَلَىٰ كَثِيرٍ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
27.translation: And We had certainly given to David and Solomon knowledge, and they said, "Praise [is due] to Allah, who has favored us over many of His believing servants."
27.transliteration: Wa laqad aatainaa Daawooda wa sulaimaana 'ilmaa; wa qaalal hamdu lil laahil lazee faddalanaa 'alaa kaseerim min 'ibaadihil mu'mineen

27.text: وَوَرِثَ سُلَيْمَانُ دَاوُودَ ۖ وَقَالَ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ عُلِّمْنَا مَنْطِقَ الطَّيْرِ وَأُوتِينَا مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ ۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ الْفَضْلُ الْمُبِينُ
27.translation: And Solomon inherited David. He said, "O people, we have been taught the language of birds, and we have been given from all things. Indeed, this is evident bounty."
27.transliteration: Wa warisa Sulaimaanu Daawooda wa qaala yaaa aiyuhan naasu 'ullimnaa mantiqat tairi wa ooteenaa min kulli shai'in inna haazaa lahuwal fadlul mubeen

27.text: وَحُشِرَ لِسُلَيْمَانَ جُنُودُهُ مِنَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنْسِ وَالطَّيْرِ فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ
27.translation: And gathered for Solomon were his soldiers of the jinn and men and birds, and they were [marching] in rows.
27.transliteration: Wa hushira Sulaimaana junooduhoo minal jinni wal insi wattairi fahum yooza'oon

27.text: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا أَتَوْا عَلَىٰ وَادِ النَّمْلِ قَالَتْ نَمْلَةٌ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّمْلُ ادْخُلُوا مَسَاكِنَكُمْ لَا يَحْطِمَنَّكُمْ سُلَيْمَانُ وَجُنُودُهُ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
27.translation: Until, when they came upon the valley of the ants, an ant said, "O ants, enter your dwellings that you not be crushed by Solomon and his soldiers while they perceive not."
27.transliteration: hattaaa izaaa ataw 'alaa waadin namli qaalat namlatuny yaaa aiyuhan namlud khuloo masaakinakum laa yahtimannakum Sulaimaanu wa junooduhoo wa hum laa yash'uroon

27.text: فَتَبَسَّمَ ضَاحِكًا مِنْ قَوْلِهَا وَقَالَ رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِي أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ الَّتِي أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَالِدَيَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَالِحًا تَرْضَاهُ وَأَدْخِلْنِي بِرَحْمَتِكَ فِي عِبَادِكَ الصَّالِحِينَ
27.translation: So [Solomon] smiled, amused at her speech, and said, "My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to do righteousness of which You approve. And admit me by Your mercy into [the ranks of] Your righteous servants."
27.transliteration: Fatabassama daahikam min qawlihaa wa qaala Rabbi awzi'nee an ashkura ni'mata kal lateee an'amta 'alaiya wa 'alaa waalidaiya wa an a'mala saalihan tardaahu wa adkhilnee birahmatika fee 'ibaadikas saaliheen

27.text: وَتَفَقَّدَ الطَّيْرَ فَقَالَ مَا لِيَ لَا أَرَى الْهُدْهُدَ أَمْ كَانَ مِنَ الْغَائِبِينَ
27.translation: And he took attendance of the birds and said, "Why do I not see the hoopoe - or is he among the absent?
27.transliteration: Wa tafaqqadat taira faqaala maa liya laaa aral hud hud, am kaana minal ghaaa'ibeen

27.text: لَأُعَذِّبَنَّهُ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا أَوْ لَأَذْبَحَنَّهُ أَوْ لَيَأْتِيَنِّي بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ
27.translation: I will surely punish him with a severe punishment or slaughter him unless he brings me clear authorization."
27.transliteration: La-u'azzibanahoo 'azaaban shadeedan aw la azbahannahoo aw layaatiyannee bisultaanim mubeen

27.text: فَمَكَثَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ فَقَالَ أَحَطْتُ بِمَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِ وَجِئْتُكَ مِنْ سَبَإٍ بِنَبَإٍ يَقِينٍ
27.translation: But the hoopoe stayed not long and said, "I have encompassed [in knowledge] that which you have not encompassed, and I have come to you from Sheba with certain news.
27.transliteration: Famakasa ghaira ba'eedin faqaala ahattu bimaa lam tuhit bihee wa ji'tuka min Sabaim binaba iny-yaqeen

27.text: إِنِّي وَجَدْتُ امْرَأَةً تَمْلِكُهُمْ وَأُوتِيَتْ مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَلَهَا عَرْشٌ عَظِيمٌ
27.translation: Indeed, I found [there] a woman ruling them, and she has been given of all things, and she has a great throne.
27.transliteration: Innee wajattum ra atan tamlikuhum wa ootiyat min kulli shai'inw wa lahaa 'arshun 'azeem

27.text: وَجَدْتُهَا وَقَوْمَهَا يَسْجُدُونَ لِلشَّمْسِ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الشَّيْطَانُ أَعْمَالَهُمْ فَصَدَّهُمْ عَنِ السَّبِيلِ فَهُمْ لَا يَهْتَدُونَ
27.translation: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allah, and Satan has made their deeds pleasing to them and averted them from [His] way, so they are not guided,
27.transliteration: Wajattuhaa wa qawmahaa yasjudoona lishshamsi min doonil laahi wa zaiyana lahumush Shaitaanu a'maalahum fasaddahum 'anis sabeeli fahum laa yahtadoon

27.text: أَلَّا يَسْجُدُوا لِلَّهِ الَّذِي يُخْرِجُ الْخَبْءَ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُخْفُونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ
27.translation: [And] so they do not prostrate to Allah, who brings forth what is hidden within the heavens and the earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare -
27.transliteration: Allaa yasjudoo lillaahil lazee yukhrijul khab'a fis samaawaati wal ardi wa ya'lamu maa tukhfoona wa maa tu'linoon

27.text: اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ ۩
27.translation: Allah - there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Great Throne."
27.transliteration: Allaahu laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa Rabbul 'Arshil Azeem

27.text: ۞ قَالَ سَنَنْظُرُ أَصَدَقْتَ أَمْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
27.translation: [Solomon] said, "We will see whether you were truthful or were of the liars.
27.transliteration: Qaala sananzuru asadaqta am kunta minal kaazibeen

27.text: اذْهَبْ بِكِتَابِي هَٰذَا فَأَلْقِهْ إِلَيْهِمْ ثُمَّ تَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَانْظُرْ مَاذَا يَرْجِعُونَ
27.translation: Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them. Then leave them and see what [answer] they will return."
27.transliteration: Izhab bikitaabee haaza fa alqih ilaihim summma tawalla 'anhum fanzur maazaa yarji'oon

27.text: قَالَتْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ إِنِّي أُلْقِيَ إِلَيَّ كِتَابٌ كَرِيمٌ
27.translation: She said, "O eminent ones, indeed, to me has been delivered a noble letter.
27.transliteration: Qaalat yaaa aiyuhal mala'u innee ulqiya ilaiya kitaabun kareem

27.text: إِنَّهُ مِنْ سُلَيْمَانَ وَإِنَّهُ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
27.translation: Indeed, it is from Solomon, and indeed, it reads: 'In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful,
27.transliteration: Innahoo min Sulaimaana wa innahoo bismil laahir Rahmaanir Raheem

27.text: أَلَّا تَعْلُوا عَلَيَّ وَأْتُونِي مُسْلِمِينَ
27.translation: Be not haughty with me but come to me in submission [as Muslims].' "
27.transliteration: Allaa ta'loo 'alaiya waa toonee muslimeen

27.text: قَالَتْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ أَفْتُونِي فِي أَمْرِي مَا كُنْتُ قَاطِعَةً أَمْرًا حَتَّىٰ تَشْهَدُونِ
27.translation: She said, "O eminent ones, advise me in my affair. I would not decide a matter until you witness [for] me."
27.transliteration: Qaalat yaaa aiyuhal mala'u aftoonee fee amree maa kuntu qaati'atan amran hattaa tashhhaddon

27.text: قَالُوا نَحْنُ أُولُو قُوَّةٍ وَأُولُو بَأْسٍ شَدِيدٍ وَالْأَمْرُ إِلَيْكِ فَانْظُرِي مَاذَا تَأْمُرِينَ
27.translation: They said, "We are men of strength and of great military might, but the command is yours, so see what you will command."
27.transliteration: Qaaloo nahnu uloo quwwatinw wa uloo baasin shadeed; wal amru ilaiki fanzuree maazaa taamureen

27.text: قَالَتْ إِنَّ الْمُلُوكَ إِذَا دَخَلُوا قَرْيَةً أَفْسَدُوهَا وَجَعَلُوا أَعِزَّةَ أَهْلِهَا أَذِلَّةً ۖ وَكَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
27.translation: She said, "Indeed kings - when they enter a city, they ruin it and render the honored of its people humbled. And thus do they do.
27.transliteration: Qaalat innal mulooka izaa dakhaloo qaryatan afsadoohaa wa ja'alooo a'izzata ahlihaaa azillah; wa kazaalika yaf'aloon

27.text: وَإِنِّي مُرْسِلَةٌ إِلَيْهِمْ بِهَدِيَّةٍ فَنَاظِرَةٌ بِمَ يَرْجِعُ الْمُرْسَلُونَ
27.translation: But indeed, I will send to them a gift and see with what [reply] the messengers will return."
27.transliteration: Wa innee mursilatun ilaihim bihadiyyatin fanaaziratum bima yarji'ul mursaloon

27.text: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ سُلَيْمَانَ قَالَ أَتُمِدُّونَنِ بِمَالٍ فَمَا آتَانِيَ اللَّهُ خَيْرٌ مِمَّا آتَاكُمْ بَلْ أَنْتُمْ بِهَدِيَّتِكُمْ تَفْرَحُونَ
