50.translation: We know what the earth diminishes of them, and with Us is a retaining record.
50.transliteration: Qad 'alimnaa maa tanqu-sul-ardu minhum wa 'indanaa Kitaabun Hafeez

50.text: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا بِالْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَاءَهُمْ فَهُمْ فِي أَمْرٍ مَرِيجٍ
50.translation: But they denied the truth when it came to them, so they are in a confused condition.
50.transliteration: Bal kazzaboo bilhaqqi lammaa jaaa'ahum fahum feee amrim mareej

50.text: أَفَلَمْ يَنْظُرُوا إِلَى السَّمَاءِ فَوْقَهُمْ كَيْفَ بَنَيْنَاهَا وَزَيَّنَّاهَا وَمَا لَهَا مِنْ فُرُوجٍ
50.translation: Have they not looked at the heaven above them - how We structured it and adorned it and [how] it has no rifts?
50.transliteration: Afalam yanzurooo ilas samaaa'i fawqahum kaifa banainaahaa wa zaiyannaahaa wa maa lahaa min furooj

50.text: وَالْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَاهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ وَأَنْبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِنْ كُلِّ زَوْجٍ بَهِيجٍ
50.translation: And the earth - We spread it out and cast therein firmly set mountains and made grow therein [something] of every beautiful kind,
50.transliteration: Wal arda madadnaahaa wa alqainaa feehaa rawaasiya wa ambatnaa feehaa min kulli zawjim baheej

50.text: تَبْصِرَةً وَذِكْرَىٰ لِكُلِّ عَبْدٍ مُنِيبٍ
50.translation: Giving insight and a reminder for every servant who turns [to Allah].
50.transliteration: Tabsiratanw wa zikraa likulli 'abdim muneeb

50.text: وَنَزَّلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً مُبَارَكًا فَأَنْبَتْنَا بِهِ جَنَّاتٍ وَحَبَّ الْحَصِيدِ
50.translation: And We have sent down blessed rain from the sky and made grow thereby gardens and grain from the harvest
50.transliteration: Wa nazzalnaa minas samaaa'i maaa'am mubaarakan fa ambatnaa bihee jannaatinw wa habbal haseed

50.text: وَالنَّخْلَ بَاسِقَاتٍ لَهَا طَلْعٌ نَضِيدٌ
50.translation: And lofty palm trees having fruit arranged in layers -
50.transliteration: Wannakhla baasiqaatil laha tal'un nadeed

50.text: رِزْقًا لِلْعِبَادِ ۖ وَأَحْيَيْنَا بِهِ بَلْدَةً مَيْتًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ الْخُرُوجُ
50.translation: As provision for the servants, and We have given life thereby to a dead land. Thus is the resurrection.
50.transliteration: Rizqal lil'ibaad, wa ahyainaa bihee baldatam maitaa; kazaalikal khurooj

50.text: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَأَصْحَابُ الرَّسِّ وَثَمُودُ
50.translation: The people of Noah denied before them, and the companions of the well and Thamud
50.transliteration: Kazzabat qablahum qawmu Noohinw wa Ashaabur Rassi wa Samood

50.text: وَعَادٌ وَفِرْعَوْنُ وَإِخْوَانُ لُوطٍ
50.translation: And 'Aad and Pharaoh and the brothers of Lot
50.transliteration: Wa 'Aadunw wa Fir'awnu wikhwaanu loot

50.text: وَأَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ وَقَوْمُ تُبَّعٍ ۚ كُلٌّ كَذَّبَ الرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ وَعِيدِ
50.translation: And the companions of the thicket and the people of Tubba'. All denied the messengers, so My threat was justly fulfilled.
50.transliteration: Wa Ashaabul Aykati wa qawmu Tubba'; kullun kazzabar Rusula fahaqqa wa'eed

50.text: أَفَعَيِينَا بِالْخَلْقِ الْأَوَّلِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِي لَبْسٍ مِنْ خَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ
50.translation: Did We fail in the first creation? But they are in confusion over a new creation.
50.transliteration: Afa'a yeenaa bilkhalqil awwal; bal hum fee labsim min khalqin jadeed

50.text: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ وَنَعْلَمُ مَا تُوَسْوِسُ بِهِ نَفْسُهُ ۖ وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ حَبْلِ الْوَرِيدِ
50.translation: And We have already created man and know what his soul whispers to him, and We are closer to him than [his] jugular vein
50.transliteration: Wa laqad khalaqnal insaana wa na'lamu maa tuwaswisu bihee nafsuhoo wa Nahnu aqrabu ilaihi min hablil wareed

50.text: إِذْ يَتَلَقَّى الْمُتَلَقِّيَانِ عَنِ الْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ الشِّمَالِ قَعِيدٌ
50.translation: When the two receivers receive, seated on the right and on the left.
50.transliteration: 'Iz yatalaqqal mutalaqqi yaani 'anil yameeni wa 'anish shimaali qa'eed

50.text: مَا يَلْفِظُ مِنْ قَوْلٍ إِلَّا لَدَيْهِ رَقِيبٌ عَتِيدٌ
50.translation: Man does not utter any word except that with him is an observer prepared [to record].
50.transliteration: Maa yalfizu min qawlin illaa ladaihi raqeebun 'ateed

50.text: وَجَاءَتْ سَكْرَةُ الْمَوْتِ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنْتَ مِنْهُ تَحِيدُ
50.translation: And the intoxication of death will bring the truth; that is what you were trying to avoid.
50.transliteration: Wa jaaa'at kullu nafsim ma'ahaa saaa'iqunw wa shaheed

50.text: وَنُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْوَعِيدِ
50.translation: And the Horn will be blown. That is the Day of [carrying out] the threat.
50.transliteration: Wa nufikha fis Soor; zaalika yawmul wa'eed

50.text: وَجَاءَتْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَعَهَا سَائِقٌ وَشَهِيدٌ
50.translation: And every soul will come, with it a driver and a witness.
50.transliteration: Wa jaaa'at kullu nafsim ma'ahaa saaa'iqunw wa shaheed

50.text: لَقَدْ كُنْتَ فِي غَفْلَةٍ مِنْ هَٰذَا فَكَشَفْنَا عَنْكَ غِطَاءَكَ فَبَصَرُكَ الْيَوْمَ حَدِيدٌ
50.translation: [It will be said], "You were certainly in unmindfulness of this, and We have removed from you your cover, so your sight, this Day, is sharp."
50.transliteration: Laqad kunta fee ghaf latim min haazaa fakashafnaa 'anka ghitaaa'aka fabasarukal yawma hadeed

50.text: وَقَالَ قَرِينُهُ هَٰذَا مَا لَدَيَّ عَتِيدٌ
50.translation: And his companion, [the angel], will say, "This [record] is what is with me, prepared."
50.transliteration: Wa qaala qareenuhoo haazaa maa ladaiya 'ateed

50.text: أَلْقِيَا فِي جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ عَنِيدٍ
50.translation: [Allah will say], "Throw into Hell every obstinate disbeliever,
50.transliteration: Alqiyaa fee Jahannama kulla kaffaarin 'aneed

50.text: مَنَّاعٍ لِلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ مُرِيبٍ
50.translation: Preventer of good, aggressor, and doubter,
50.transliteration: Mannaa'il lilkhayri mu'tadim mureeb

50.text: الَّذِي جَعَلَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ فَأَلْقِيَاهُ فِي الْعَذَابِ الشَّدِيدِ
50.translation: Who made [as equal] with Allah another deity; then throw him into the severe punishment."
50.transliteration: Allazee ja'ala ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhara fa alqiyaahu fil'azaabish shadeed

50.text: ۞ قَالَ قَرِينُهُ رَبَّنَا مَا أَطْغَيْتُهُ وَلَٰكِنْ كَانَ فِي ضَلَالٍ بَعِيدٍ
50.translation: His [devil] companion will say, "Our Lord, I did not make him transgress, but he [himself] was in extreme error."
50.transliteration: Qaala qareenuhoo Rabbanaa maaa atghaituhoo wa laakin kaana fee dalaahim ba'eed

50.text: قَالَ لَا تَخْتَصِمُوا لَدَيَّ وَقَدْ قَدَّمْتُ إِلَيْكُمْ بِالْوَعِيدِ
50.translation: [Allah] will say, "Do not dispute before Me, while I had already presented to you the warning.
50.transliteration: Qaala laa takhtasimoo ladaayya wa qad qaddamtu ilaikum bilwa'eed

50.text: مَا يُبَدَّلُ الْقَوْلُ لَدَيَّ وَمَا أَنَا بِظَلَّامٍ لِلْعَبِيدِ
50.translation: The word will not be changed with Me, and never will I be unjust to the servants."
50.transliteration: Maa yubaddalul qawlu ladaiya wa maaa ana bizal laamil lil'abeed

50.text: يَوْمَ نَقُولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ امْتَلَأْتِ وَتَقُولُ هَلْ مِنْ مَزِيدٍ
50.translation: On the Day We will say to Hell, "Have you been filled?" and it will say, "Are there some more,"
50.transliteration: Yawma naqoolu li'jahannama halim talaati wa taqoolu hal mim mazeed

50.text: وَأُزْلِفَتِ الْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ
50.translation: And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous, not far,
50.transliteration: Wa uzlifatil jannatu lil muttaqeena ghaira ba'eed

50.text: هَٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِكُلِّ أَوَّابٍ حَفِيظٍ
50.translation: [It will be said], "This is what you were promised - for every returner [to Allah] and keeper [of His covenant]
50.transliteration: Haaza maa too'adoona likulli awwaabin hafeez

50.text: مَنْ خَشِيَ الرَّحْمَٰنَ بِالْغَيْبِ وَجَاءَ بِقَلْبٍ مُنِيبٍ
50.translation: Who feared the Most Merciful unseen and came with a heart returning [in repentance].
50.transliteration: Man khashiyar Rahmaana bilghaibi wa jaaa'a biqalbim muneeb

50.text: ادْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَامٍ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْخُلُودِ
50.translation: Enter it in peace. This is the Day of Eternity."
50.transliteration: Udkhuloohaa bisalaamin zaalika yawmul khulood

50.text: لَهُمْ مَا يَشَاءُونَ فِيهَا وَلَدَيْنَا مَزِيدٌ
50.translation: They will have whatever they wish therein, and with Us is more.
50.transliteration: Lahum maa yashaaa'oona feehaa wa ladainaa mazeed

50.text: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُمْ مِنْ قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُمْ بَطْشًا فَنَقَّبُوا فِي الْبِلَادِ هَلْ مِنْ مَحِيصٍ
50.translation: And how many a generation before them did We destroy who were greater than them in [striking] power and had explored throughout the lands. Is there any place of escape?
50.transliteration: Wa kam ahlaknaa qablahum min qarnin hum ashaddu minhum batshan fanaqqaboo fil bilaad, hal mim mahees

50.text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِمَنْ كَانَ لَهُ قَلْبٌ أَوْ أَلْقَى السَّمْعَ وَهُوَ شَهِيدٌ
50.translation: Indeed in that is a reminder for whoever has a heart or who listens while he is present [in mind].
50.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika lazikraa liman kaana lahoo qalbun aw alqas sam'a wa huwa shaheed

50.text: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ وَمَا مَسَّنَا مِنْ لُغُوبٍ
50.translation: And We did certainly create the heavens and earth and what is between them in six days, and there touched Us no weariness.
50.transliteration: Wa laqad khalaqnas samaawaati wal arda wa maa bainahumaa fee sittati ayyaamin wa maa massanaa mil lughoob

50.text: فَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ الشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ الْغُرُوبِ
50.translation: So be patient, [O Muhammad], over what they say and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting,
50.transliteration: Fasbir 'alaa maa yaqooloona wa sabbih bihamdi Rabbika qabla tuloo'ish shamsi wa qablal ghuroob

50.text: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَأَدْبَارَ السُّجُودِ
50.translation: And [in part] of the night exalt Him and after prostration.
50.transliteration: Wa minal laili fasabbih hu wa adbaaras sujood

50.text: وَاسْتَمِعْ يَوْمَ يُنَادِ الْمُنَادِ مِنْ مَكَانٍ قَرِيبٍ
50.translation: And listen on the Day when the Caller will call out from a place that is near -
50.transliteration: Wastami' yawma yunaa dil munaadi mim makaanin qareeb

50.text: يَوْمَ يَسْمَعُونَ الصَّيْحَةَ بِالْحَقِّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْخُرُوجِ
50.translation: The Day they will hear the blast [of the Horn] in truth. That is the Day of Emergence [from the graves].
50.transliteration: Yawma yasmaoonas sai hata bilhaqq zaalika yawmul khurooj

50.text: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْيِي وَنُمِيتُ وَإِلَيْنَا الْمَصِيرُ
50.translation: Indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and to Us is the destination
50.transliteration: Innaa Nahnu nuhyee wa numeetu wa ilainal maseer

50.text: يَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ الْأَرْضُ عَنْهُمْ سِرَاعًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ حَشْرٌ عَلَيْنَا يَسِيرٌ
50.translation: On the Day the earth breaks away from them [and they emerge] rapidly; that is a gathering easy for Us.
50.transliteration: Yawma tashaqqaqul ardu 'anhum siraa'aa; zaalika hashrun 'alainaa yaseer

50.text: نَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ ۖ وَمَا أَنْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ بِجَبَّارٍ ۖ فَذَكِّرْ بِالْقُرْآنِ مَنْ يَخَافُ وَعِيدِ
50.translation: We are most knowing of what they say, and you are not over them a tyrant. But remind by the Qur'an whoever fears My threat.
50.transliteration: Nahnu a'lamu bimaa yaqooloona wa maaa anta 'alihim bijabbaarin fazakkir bil quraani many yakhaafu wa'eed

51.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالذَّارِيَاتِ ذَرْوًا
51.translation: By those [winds] scattering [dust] dispersing
51.transliteration: Waz-zaariyaati zarwaa

51.text: فَالْحَامِلَاتِ وِقْرًا
51.translation: And those [clouds] carrying a load [of water]
51.transliteration: Falhaamilaati wiqraa

51.text: فَالْجَارِيَاتِ يُسْرًا
51.translation: And those [ships] sailing with ease
51.transliteration: Faljaariyaati yusraa

51.text: فَالْمُقَسِّمَاتِ أَمْرًا
51.translation: And those [angels] apportioning [each] matter,
51.transliteration: Falmuqassimaati amraa

51.text: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٌ
51.translation: Indeed, what you are promised is true.
51.transliteration: Innamaa too'adoona la-saadiq

51.text: وَإِنَّ الدِّينَ لَوَاقِعٌ
51.translation: And indeed, the recompense is to occur.
51.transliteration: Wa innad deena la waaqi'

51.text: وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْحُبُكِ
51.translation: By the heaven containing pathways,
51.transliteration: Wassamaaa'i zaatil hubuk

51.text: إِنَّكُمْ لَفِي قَوْلٍ مُخْتَلِفٍ
51.translation: Indeed, you are in differing speech.
51.transliteration: Innakum lafee qawlim mukhtalif

51.text: يُؤْفَكُ عَنْهُ مَنْ أُفِكَ
51.translation: Deluded away from the Qur'an is he who is deluded.
51.transliteration: Yu'faku 'anhu man ufik

51.text: قُتِلَ الْخَرَّاصُونَ
51.translation: Destroyed are the falsifiers
51.transliteration: Qutilal kharraasoon

51.text: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي غَمْرَةٍ سَاهُونَ
51.translation: Who are within a flood [of confusion] and heedless.
51.transliteration: Allazeena hum fee ghamratin saahoon

51.text: يَسْأَلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ الدِّينِ
51.translation: They ask, "When is the Day of Recompense?"
51.transliteration: Yas'aloona ayyaana yawmud Deen

51.text: يَوْمَ هُمْ عَلَى النَّارِ يُفْتَنُونَ
51.translation: [It is] the Day they will be tormented over the Fire
51.transliteration: Yawma hum 'alan naari yuftanoon

51.text: ذُوقُوا فِتْنَتَكُمْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
51.translation: [And will be told], "Taste your torment. This is that for which you were impatient."
51.transliteration: Zooqoo fitnatakum haa zal lazee kuntum bihee tas ta'jiloon

51.text: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
51.translation: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and springs,
51.transliteration: Innal muttaqeena fee jannaatinw wa 'uyoon

51.text: آخِذِينَ مَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِينَ
51.translation: Accepting what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were before that doers of good.
51.transliteration: Aakhizeena maaa aataahum Rabbuhum; innahum kaanoo qabla zaalika muhsineen

51.text: كَانُوا قَلِيلًا مِنَ اللَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ
51.translation: They used to sleep but little of the night,
51.transliteration: kaanoo qaleelam minal laili maa yahja'oon

51.text: وَبِالْأَسْحَارِ هُمْ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ
51.translation: And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness,
51.transliteration: Wa bilashaari hum yastaghfiroon

51.text: وَفِي أَمْوَالِهِمْ حَقٌّ لِلسَّائِلِ وَالْمَحْرُومِ
51.translation: And from their properties was [given] the right of the [needy] petitioner and the deprived.
51.transliteration: Wa feee amwaalihim haqqul lissaaa'ili walmahroom

51.text: وَفِي الْأَرْضِ آيَاتٌ لِلْمُوقِنِينَ
51.translation: And on the earth are signs for the certain [in faith]
51.transliteration: Wa fil ardi aayaatul lilmooqineen

51.text: وَفِي أَنْفُسِكُمْ ۚ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ
51.translation: And in yourselves. Then will you not see?
51.transliteration: Wa feee anfusikum; afalaa tubsiroon

51.text: وَفِي السَّمَاءِ رِزْقُكُمْ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ
51.translation: And in the heaven is your provision and whatever you are promised.
51.transliteration: Wa fissamaaa'i rizqukum wa maa too'adoon

51.text: فَوَرَبِّ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ إِنَّهُ لَحَقٌّ مِثْلَ مَا أَنَّكُمْ تَنْطِقُونَ
51.translation: Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth, indeed, it is truth - just as [sure as] it is that you are speaking.
51.transliteration: Fawa Rabbis samaaa'i wal ardi innahoo lahaqqum misla maa annakum tantiqoon

51.text: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيْفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْمُكْرَمِينَ
51.translation: Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham? -
51.transliteration: Hal ataaka hadeesu daifi Ibraaheemal mukrameen

51.text: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا سَلَامًا ۖ قَالَ سَلَامٌ قَوْمٌ مُنْكَرُونَ
51.translation: When they entered upon him and said, "[We greet you with] peace." He answered, "[And upon you] peace, [you are] a people unknown.
51.transliteration: Iz dakhaloo 'alaihi faqaaloo salaaman qaala salaamun qawmum munkaroon

51.text: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ فَجَاءَ بِعِجْلٍ سَمِينٍ
51.translation: Then he went to his family and came with a fat [roasted] calf
51.transliteration: Faraagha ilaaa ahlihee fajaaa'a bi'ijlin sameen

51.text: فَقَرَّبَهُ إِلَيْهِمْ قَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
51.translation: And placed it near them; he said, "Will you not eat?"
51.transliteration: Faqarrabahooo ilaihim qaala alaa taakuloon

51.text: فَأَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيفَةً ۖ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ ۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَامٍ عَلِيمٍ
51.translation: And he felt from them apprehension. They said, "Fear not," and gave him good tidings of a learned boy.
51.transliteration: Fa awjasa minhm khee fatan qaaloo laa takhaf wa bashsharoohu bighulaamin 'aleem

51.text: فَأَقْبَلَتِ امْرَأَتُهُ فِي صَرَّةٍ فَصَكَّتْ وَجْهَهَا وَقَالَتْ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٌ
51.translation: And his wife approached with a cry [of alarm] and struck her face and said, "[I am] a barren old woman!"
51.transliteration: Fa aqbalatim ra-atuhoo fee sarratin fasakkat wajhahaa wa qaalat 'ajoozun 'aqeem

51.text: قَالُوا كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْحَكِيمُ الْعَلِيمُ
51.translation: They said, "Thus has said your Lord; indeed, He is the Wise, the Knowing."
51.transliteration: Qaaloo kazaaliki qaala Rabbuki innahoo huwal hakeemul 'aleem

51.text: ۞ قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا الْمُرْسَلُونَ
51.translation: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"
51.transliteration: Qaala famaa khatbukum ayyuhal mursaloon

51.text: قَالُوا إِنَّا أُرْسِلْنَا إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُجْرِمِينَ
51.translation: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals
51.transliteration: Qaalooo innaaa ursilnaaa ilaa qawmim mujrimeen

51.text: لِنُرْسِلَ عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِنْ طِينٍ
51.translation: To send down upon them stones of clay,
51.transliteration: Linursila 'alaihim hijaa ratam min teen

51.text: مُسَوَّمَةً عِنْدَ رَبِّكَ لِلْمُسْرِفِينَ
51.translation: Marked in the presence of your Lord for the transgressors."
51.transliteration: Musawwamatan 'inda rabbika lilmusrifeen

51.text: فَأَخْرَجْنَا مَنْ كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
51.translation: So We brought out whoever was in the cities of the believers.
51.transliteration: Fa akhrajnaa man kaana feehaa minal mu'mineen

51.text: فَمَا وَجَدْنَا فِيهَا غَيْرَ بَيْتٍ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
51.translation: And We found not within them other than a [single] house of Muslims.
51.transliteration: Famaa wajadnaa feehaa ghaira baitim minal muslimeen

51.text: وَتَرَكْنَا فِيهَا آيَةً لِلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ
51.translation: And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.
51.transliteration: Wa taraknaa feehaaa aayatal lillazeena yakhaafoonal 'azaabal aleem

51.text: وَفِي مُوسَىٰ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ
51.translation: And in Moses [was a sign], when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.
51.transliteration: Wa fee Moosaaa iz arsalnaahu ilaa Fir'wna bisultaa nim mubeen

51.text: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكْنِهِ وَقَالَ سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ
51.translation: But he turned away with his supporters and said," A magician or a madman."
51.transliteration: Fatawalla biruknihee wa qaala saahirun aw majnoon

51.text: فَأَخَذْنَاهُ وَجُنُودَهُ فَنَبَذْنَاهُمْ فِي الْيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ
51.translation: So We took him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea, and he was blameworthy.
51.transliteration: Fa akhaznaahu wa junoo dahoo fanabaznaahum fil yammi wa huwa muleem

51.text: وَفِي عَادٍ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الرِّيحَ الْعَقِيمَ
51.translation: And in 'Aad [was a sign], when We sent against them the barren wind.
51.transliteration: Wa fee 'Aadin iz arsalnaa 'alaihimur reehal'aqeem

51.text: مَا تَذَرُ مِنْ شَيْءٍ أَتَتْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتْهُ كَالرَّمِيمِ
51.translation: It left nothing of what it came upon but that it made it like disintegrated ruins.
51.transliteration: Maa tazaru min shai'in atat 'alaihi illaa ja'alat hu karrameem

51.text: وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَمَتَّعُوا حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
51.translation: And in Thamud, when it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a time."
51.transliteration: Wa fee Samooda iz qeela lahum tamatta''oo hattaa heen

51.text: فَعَتَوْا عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّاعِقَةُ وَهُمْ يَنْظُرُونَ
51.translation: But they were insolent toward the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on.
51.transliteration: Fa'ataw 'an amri Rabbihim fa akhazal humus saa'iqatu wa hum yanzuroon

51.text: فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا مِنْ قِيَامٍ وَمَا كَانُوا مُنْتَصِرِينَ
51.translation: And they were unable to arise, nor could they defend themselves.
51.transliteration: Famas tataa'oo min qiyaaminw wa maa kaanoo muntasireen

51.text: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ
51.translation: And [We destroyed] the people of Noah before; indeed, they were a people defiantly disobedient.
51.transliteration: Wa qawma Noohim min qablu innahum kaano qawman faasiqeen

51.text: وَالسَّمَاءَ بَنَيْنَاهَا بِأَيْدٍ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ
51.translation: And the heaven We constructed with strength, and indeed, We are [its] expander.
51.transliteration: Wassamaaa'a banainaa haa bi aydinw wa innaa lamoosi'oon

51.text: وَالْأَرْضَ فَرَشْنَاهَا فَنِعْمَ الْمَاهِدُونَ
51.translation: And the earth We have spread out, and excellent is the preparer.
51.transliteration: Wal arda farashnaahaa fani'mal maahidoon

51.text: وَمِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَا زَوْجَيْنِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
51.translation: And of all things We created two mates; perhaps you will remember.
51.transliteration: Wa min kulli shai'in khalaqnaa zawjaini la'allakum tazakkaroon

51.text: فَفِرُّوا إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُمْ مِنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ
51.translation: So flee to Allah. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
51.transliteration: Fafirrooo ilal laahi innee lakum minhu nazeerum mubeen

51.text: وَلَا تَجْعَلُوا مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُمْ مِنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ
51.translation: And do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
51.transliteration: Wa laa taj'aloo ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhara innee lakum minhu nazeerum mubeen

51.text: كَذَٰلِكَ مَا أَتَى الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ مِنْ رَسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُوا سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ
51.translation: Similarly, there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said, "A magician or a madman."
51.transliteration: Kazaalika maaa atal lazeena min qablihim mir Rasoolin illaa qaaloo saahirun aw majnoon

51.text: أَتَوَاصَوْا بِهِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ
51.translation: Did they suggest it to them? Rather, they [themselves] are a transgressing people.
51.transliteration: Atawaasaw bih; bal hum qawmun taaghoon

51.text: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَمَا أَنْتَ بِمَلُومٍ
51.translation: So leave them, [O Muhammad], for you are not to be blamed.
51.transliteration: Fatawalla 'anhum famaaa anta bimaloom

51.text: وَذَكِّرْ فَإِنَّ الذِّكْرَىٰ تَنْفَعُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
51.translation: And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers.
51.transliteration: Wa zakkir fa innaz zikraa tanfa'ul mu'mineen

51.text: وَمَا خَلَقْتُ الْجِنَّ وَالْإِنْسَ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُونِ
51.translation: And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.
51.transliteration: Wa maa khalaqtul jinna wal insa illaa liya'budoon

51.text: مَا أُرِيدُ مِنْهُمْ مِنْ رِزْقٍ وَمَا أُرِيدُ أَنْ يُطْعِمُونِ
51.translation: I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.
51.transliteration: Maaa ureedu minhum mir rizqinw wa maaa ureedu anyyut'imoon

51.text: إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الرَّزَّاقُ ذُو الْقُوَّةِ الْمَتِينُ
51.translation: Indeed, it is Allah who is the [continual] Provider, the firm possessor of strength.
51.transliteration: Innal laaha Huwar Razzaaqu Zul Quwwatil Mateen

51.text: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا ذَنُوبًا مِثْلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصْحَابِهِمْ فَلَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونِ
51.translation: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a portion [of punishment] like the portion of their predecessors, so let them not impatiently urge Me.
51.transliteration: Fa inna lillazeena zalamoo zanoobam misla zanoobi ashaabihim falaa yasta'jiloon

51.text: فَوَيْلٌ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ يَوْمِهِمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
51.translation: And woe to those who have disbelieved from their Day which they are promised.
51.transliteration: Fawailul lillazeena kafaroo miny yawmihimul lazee yoo'adoon

52.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالطُّورِ
52.translation: By the mount
52.transliteration: Wat-Toor

52.text: وَكِتَابٍ مَسْطُورٍ
52.translation: And [by] a Book inscribed
52.transliteration: Wa kitaabim mastoor

52.text: فِي رَقٍّ مَنْشُورٍ
52.translation: In parchment spread open
52.transliteration: Fee raqqim manshoor

52.text: وَالْبَيْتِ الْمَعْمُورِ
52.translation: And [by] the frequented House
52.transliteration: Wal baitil ma'moor

52.text: وَالسَّقْفِ الْمَرْفُوعِ
52.translation: And [by] the heaven raised high
52.transliteration: Wassaqfil marfoo'

52.text: وَالْبَحْرِ الْمَسْجُورِ
52.translation: And [by] the sea filled [with fire],
52.transliteration: Wal bahril masjoor

52.text: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَاقِعٌ
52.translation: Indeed, the punishment of your Lord will occur.
52.transliteration: Inna 'azaaba Rabbika lawaaqi'

52.text: مَا لَهُ مِنْ دَافِعٍ
52.translation: Of it there is no preventer.
52.transliteration: Maa lahoo min daafi'

52.text: يَوْمَ تَمُورُ السَّمَاءُ مَوْرًا
52.translation: On the Day the heaven will sway with circular motion
52.transliteration: Yawma tamoorus samaaa'u mawraa

52.text: وَتَسِيرُ الْجِبَالُ سَيْرًا
52.translation: And the mountains will pass on, departing -
52.transliteration: Wa taseerul jibaalu sairaa

52.text: فَوَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
52.translation: Then woe, that Day, to the deniers,
52.transliteration: Fawailuny yawma 'izil lil mukaazzibeen

52.text: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي خَوْضٍ يَلْعَبُونَ
52.translation: Who are in [empty] discourse amusing themselves.
52.transliteration: Allazeena hum fee khawdiny yal'aboon

52.text: يَوْمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا
52.translation: The Day they are thrust toward the fire of Hell with a [violent] thrust, [its angels will say],
52.transliteration: Yawma yuda'-'oona ilaa naari jahannama da'-'aa

52.text: هَٰذِهِ النَّارُ الَّتِي كُنْتُمْ بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
52.translation: "This is the Fire which you used to deny.
52.transliteration: Haazihin naarul latee kuntum bihaa tukazziboon

52.text: أَفَسِحْرٌ هَٰذَا أَمْ أَنْتُمْ لَا تُبْصِرُونَ
52.translation: Then is this magic, or do you not see?
52.transliteration: Afasihrun haazaaaa am antum laa tubsiroon

52.text: اصْلَوْهَا فَاصْبِرُوا أَوْ لَا تَصْبِرُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
52.translation: [Enter to] burn therein; then be patient or impatient - it is all the same for you. You are only being recompensed [for] what you used to do."
52.transliteration: Islawhaa fasbirooo aw laa tasbiroo sawaaa'un 'alaikum innamaa tujzawna maa kuntum ta'maloon

52.text: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَنَعِيمٍ
52.translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and pleasure,
52.transliteration: Innal muttaqeena fee jannaatinw wa na'eem

52.text: فَاكِهِينَ بِمَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ وَوَقَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيمِ
52.translation: Enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord protected them from the punishment of Hellfire.
52.transliteration: Faakiheena bimaaa aataahum rabbuhum wa waqaahum rabbuhum 'azaabal jaheem

52.text: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
52.translation: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."
52.transliteration: Kuloo washraboo haneee 'am bimaa kuntum ta'maloon

52.text: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَصْفُوفَةٍ ۖ وَزَوَّجْنَاهُمْ بِحُورٍ عِينٍ
52.translation: They will be reclining on thrones lined up, and We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.
52.transliteration: Muttaki'eena 'alaa sururim masfoofatinw wa zawwaj naahum bihoorin 'een

52.text: وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَاتَّبَعَتْهُمْ ذُرِّيَّتُهُمْ بِإِيمَانٍ أَلْحَقْنَا بِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ وَمَا أَلَتْنَاهُمْ مِنْ عَمَلِهِمْ مِنْ شَيْءٍ ۚ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٌ
52.translation: And those who believed and whose descendants followed them in faith - We will join with them their descendants, and We will not deprive them of anything of their deeds. Every person, for what he earned, is retained.
52.transliteration: Wallazeena aamanoo wattaba'at hum zurriyyatuhum bieemaanin alhaqnaa bihim zurriyyatahum wa maaa alatnaahum min 'amalihim min shai'; kullum ri'im bimaa kasaba raheen

52.text: وَأَمْدَدْنَاهُمْ بِفَاكِهَةٍ وَلَحْمٍ مِمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
52.translation: And We will provide them with fruit and meat from whatever they desire.
52.transliteration: Wa amdadnaahum bifaa kihatinw wa lahmim mimmaa yashtahoon

52.text: يَتَنَازَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا لَا لَغْوٌ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأْثِيمٌ
52.translation: They will exchange with one another a cup [of wine] wherein [results] no ill speech or commission of sin.
52.transliteration: Yatanaaza'oona feehaa kaasal laa laghwun feehaa wa laa taaseem

52.text: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ غِلْمَانٌ لَهُمْ كَأَنَّهُمْ لُؤْلُؤٌ مَكْنُونٌ
52.translation: There will circulate among them [servant] boys [especially] for them, as if they were pearls well-protected.
52.transliteration: Wa yatoofu 'alaihim ghilmaanul lahum ka annahum lu'lu'um maknoon

52.text: وَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
52.translation: And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.
52.transliteration: Wa aqbala ba'duhum 'alaa ba'diny yatasaaa'aloon

52.text: قَالُوا إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبْلُ فِي أَهْلِنَا مُشْفِقِينَ
52.translation: They will say, "Indeed, we were previously among our people fearful [of displeasing Allah].
52.transliteration: Qaalooo innaa kunnaa qablu feee ahlinaa mushfiqeen

52.text: فَمَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَوَقَانَا عَذَابَ السَّمُومِ
52.translation: So Allah conferred favor upon us and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.
52.transliteration: Famannnal laahu 'alainaa wa waqaanaa 'azaabas samoom

52.text: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِنْ قَبْلُ نَدْعُوهُ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْبَرُّ الرَّحِيمُ
52.translation: Indeed, we used to supplicate Him before. Indeed, it is He who is the Beneficent, the Merciful."
52.transliteration: Innaa kunnaa min qablu nad'oohu innahoo huwal barrur raheem

52.text: فَذَكِّرْ فَمَا أَنْتَ بِنِعْمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٍ وَلَا مَجْنُونٍ
52.translation: So remind [O Muhammad], for you are not, by the favor of your Lord, a soothsayer or a madman.
52.transliteration: Fazakkir famaaa anta bini'mati rabbika bikaahininw wa laa majnoon

52.text: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٌ نَتَرَبَّصُ بِهِ رَيْبَ الْمَنُونِ
52.translation: Or do they say [of you], "A poet for whom we await a misfortune of time?"
52.transliteration: Am yaqooloona shaa'irun natarabbasu bihee raibal manoon

52.text: قُلْ تَرَبَّصُوا فَإِنِّي مَعَكُمْ مِنَ الْمُتَرَبِّصِينَ
52.translation: Say, "Wait, for indeed I am, with you, among the waiters."
52.transliteration: Qul tarabbasoo fa innee ma'akum minal mutarabbiseen

52.text: أَمْ تَأْمُرُهُمْ أَحْلَامُهُمْ بِهَٰذَا ۚ أَمْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ
52.translation: Or do their minds command them to [say] this, or are they a transgressing people?
52.transliteration: Am taamuruhum ahlaamuhum bihaazaaa am hum qawmun taaghoon

52.text: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُ ۚ بَلْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
52.translation: Or do they say, "He has made it up"? Rather, they do not believe.
52.transliteration: Am yaqooloona taqawwalah; bal laa yu'minoon

52.text: فَلْيَأْتُوا بِحَدِيثٍ مِثْلِهِ إِنْ كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ
52.translation: Then let them produce a statement like it, if they should be truthful.
52.transliteration: Falyaatoo bihadeesim misliheee in kaanoo saadiqeen

52.text: أَمْ خُلِقُوا مِنْ غَيْرِ شَيْءٍ أَمْ هُمُ الْخَالِقُونَ
52.translation: Or were they created by nothing, or were they the creators [of themselves]?
52.transliteration: Am khuliqoo min ghairi shai'in am humul khaaliqoon

52.text: أَمْ خَلَقُوا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۚ بَلْ لَا يُوقِنُونَ
52.translation: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Rather, they are not certain.
52.transliteration: Am khalaqus samaawaati wal ard; bal laa yooqinoon

52.text: أَمْ عِنْدَهُمْ خَزَائِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمْ هُمُ الْمُصَيْطِرُونَ
52.translation: Or have they the depositories [containing the provision] of your Lord? Or are they the controllers [of them]?
52.transliteration: Am'indahum khazaaa'inu rabbika am humul musaitiroon

52.text: أَمْ لَهُمْ سُلَّمٌ يَسْتَمِعُونَ فِيهِ ۖ فَلْيَأْتِ مُسْتَمِعُهُمْ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ
52.translation: Or have they a stairway [into the heaven] upon which they listen? Then let their listener produce a clear authority.
52.transliteration: Am lahum sullamuny yastami'oona feehi falyaati mustami'uhum bisultaanim mubeen

52.text: أَمْ لَهُ الْبَنَاتُ وَلَكُمُ الْبَنُونَ
52.translation: Or has He daughters while you have sons?
52.transliteration: Am lahul banaatu wa lakumul banoon

52.text: أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُمْ مِنْ مَغْرَمٍ مُثْقَلُونَ
52.translation: Or do you, [O Muhammad], ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
52.transliteration: Am tas'aluhum ajran fahum mim maghramim musqaloon

52.text: أَمْ عِنْدَهُمُ الْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ
52.translation: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?
52.transliteration: Am 'indahumul ghaibu fahum yaktuboon

52.text: أَمْ يُرِيدُونَ كَيْدًا ۖ فَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا هُمُ الْمَكِيدُونَ
52.translation: Or do they intend a plan? But those who disbelieve - they are the object of a plan.
52.transliteration: Am yureedoona kaidan fallazeena kafaroo humul makeedoon

52.text: أَمْ لَهُمْ إِلَٰهٌ غَيْرُ اللَّهِ ۚ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
52.translation: Or have they a deity other than Allah? Exalted is Allah above whatever they associate with Him.
52.transliteration: Am lahum ilaahun ghairul laa; subhaanal laahi 'ammaa yushrikoon

52.text: وَإِنْ يَرَوْا كِسْفًا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ سَاقِطًا يَقُولُوا سَحَابٌ مَرْكُومٌ
52.translation: And if they were to see a fragment from the sky falling, they would say, "[It is merely] clouds heaped up."
52.transliteration: Wa iny yaraw kisfam minas samaaa'i saaqitany yaqooloo sahaabum markoom

52.text: فَذَرْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي فِيهِ يُصْعَقُونَ
52.translation: So leave them until they meet their Day in which they will be struck insensible -
52.transliteration: Fazarhum hatta yulaaqoo yawmahumul lazee feehi yus'aqoon

52.text: يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا هُمْ يُنْصَرُونَ
52.translation: The Day their plan will not avail them at all, nor will they be helped.
52.transliteration: Yawma laa yughnee 'anhum kaidumhum shai'anw wa laa hum yunsaroon

52.text: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا عَذَابًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
52.translation: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a punishment before that, but most of them do not know.
52.transliteration: Wa inna lillazeena zalamoo 'azaaban doona zalika wa laakinna aksarahum laa ya'lamoon

52.text: وَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا ۖ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
52.translation: And be patient, [O Muhammad], for the decision of your Lord, for indeed, you are in Our eyes. And exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord when you arise.
52.transliteration: Wasbir lihukmi rabbika fa innaka bi-a'yuninaa wa sabbih bihamdi rabbika heena taqoom

52.text: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَإِدْبَارَ النُّجُومِ
52.translation: And in a part of the night exalt Him and after [the setting of] the stars.
52.transliteration: Wa minal laili fasabbihhu wa idbaaran nujoom

53.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالنَّجْمِ إِذَا هَوَىٰ
53.translation: By the star when it descends,
Your companion [Muhammad] has not strayed, nor has he erred,
53.transliteration: Maa dalla saahibukum wa maa ghawaa

53.translation: Nor does he speak from [his own] inclination.
It is not but a revelation revealed,
Taught to him by one intense in strength -
One of soundness. And he rose to [his] true form
While he was in the higher [part of the] horizon.
Then he approached and descended
And was at a distance of two bow lengths or nearer.
And he revealed to His Servant what he revealed.
The heart did not lie [about] what it saw.
53.transliteration: Maa kazabal fu'aadu maa ra aa

53.translation: So will you dispute with him over what he saw?
And he certainly saw him in another descent
53.transliteration: Wa laqad ra aahu nazlatan ukhraa

53.translation: At the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary -
Near it is the Garden of Refuge -
When there covered the Lote Tree that which covered [it].
The sight [of the Prophet] did not swerve, nor did it transgress [its limit].
53.transliteration: Maa zaaghal basaru wa maa taghaa

53.text: لَقَدْ رَأَىٰ مِنْ آيَاتِ رَبِّهِ الْكُبْرَىٰ
53.translation: He certainly saw of the greatest signs of his Lord.
53.transliteration: Laqad ra aa min aayaati Rabbihil kubraaa

53.translation: So have you considered al-Lat and al-'Uzza?
And Manat, the third - the other one?
Is the male for you and for Him the female?
That, then, is an unjust division.

53.text: إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا أَسْمَاءٌ سَمَّيْتُمُوهَا أَنْتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُمْ مَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ بِهَا مِنْ سُلْطَانٍ ۚ إِنْ يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهْوَى الْأَنْفُسُ ۖ وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُمْ مِنْ رَبِّهِمُ الْهُدَىٰ
53.translation: They are not but [mere] names you have named them - you and your forefathers - for which Allah has sent down no authority. They follow not except assumption and what [their] souls desire, and there has already come to them from their Lord guidance.
53.transliteration: In hiya illaaa asmaaa'un sammaitumoohaaa antum wa aabaaa'ukum maaa anzalal laahu bihaa min sultaan; inyyattabi'oona illaz zanna wa maa tahwal anfusu wa laqad jaaa'ahum mir Rabbihimul hudaa

53.translation: Or is there for man whatever he wishes?
53.transliteration: Am lil insaani maa taman naa

53.translation: Rather, to Allah belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].

53.text: ۞ وَكَمْ مِنْ مَلَكٍ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ لَا تُغْنِي شَفَاعَتُهُمْ شَيْئًا إِلَّا مِنْ بَعْدِ أَنْ يَأْذَنَ اللَّهُ لِمَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيَرْضَىٰ
53.translation: And how many angels there are in the heavens whose intercession will not avail at all except [only] after Allah has permitted [it] to whom He wills and approves.
53.transliteration: Wa kam mim malakin fissamaawaati laa tughnee shafaa'atuhum shai'an illaa mim ba'di anyyaazanal laahu limany yashaaa'u wa yardaa

53.text: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ لَيُسَمُّونَ الْمَلَائِكَةَ تَسْمِيَةَ الْأُنْثَىٰ
53.translation: Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter name the angels female names,
53.transliteration: innal lazeena laa yu'minoona bil aakhirati la yusammoonal malaaa'ikata tasmiyatal unsaa

53.text: وَمَا لَهُمْ بِهِ مِنْ عِلْمٍ ۖ إِنْ يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ ۖ وَإِنَّ الظَّنَّ لَا يُغْنِي مِنَ الْحَقِّ شَيْئًا
53.translation: And they have thereof no knowledge. They follow not except assumption, and indeed, assumption avails not against the truth at all.
53.transliteration: Wa maa lahum bihee min 'ilmin iny yattabi'oona illaz zanna wa innaz zanna laa yughnee minal haqqi shai'aa

53.text: فَأَعْرِضْ عَنْ مَنْ تَوَلَّىٰ عَنْ ذِكْرِنَا وَلَمْ يُرِدْ إِلَّا الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا
53.translation: So turn away from whoever turns his back on Our message and desires not except the worldly life.
53.transliteration: Fa a'rid 'am man tawallaa 'an zikrinaa wa lam yurid illal hayaatad dunyaa

53.text: ذَٰلِكَ مَبْلَغُهُمْ مِنَ الْعِلْمِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنْ ضَلَّ عَنْ سَبِيلِهِ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ اهْتَدَىٰ
53.translation: That is their sum of knowledge. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who strays from His way, and He is most knowing of who is guided.
53.transliteration: Zalika mablaghuhum minal 'ilm; inna rabbaka huwa a'lamu biman dalla 'an sabee lihee wa huwa a'lamu bimanih tadaa

53.text: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ لِيَجْزِيَ الَّذِينَ أَسَاءُوا بِمَا عَمِلُوا وَيَجْزِيَ الَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا بِالْحُسْنَى
53.translation: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth - that He may recompense those who do evil with [the penalty of] what they have done and recompense those who do good with the best [reward] -
53.transliteration: Wa lillaahi maa fis samaawaati wa maa fil ardi liyajziyal lazeena asaaa'oo bimaa 'amiloo wa yajziyal lazeena ahsanoo bilhusnaa

53.text: الَّذِينَ يَجْتَنِبُونَ كَبَائِرَ الْإِثْمِ وَالْفَوَاحِشَ إِلَّا اللَّمَمَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَاسِعُ الْمَغْفِرَةِ ۚ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِكُمْ إِذْ أَنْشَأَكُمْ مِنَ الْأَرْضِ وَإِذْ أَنْتُمْ أَجِنَّةٌ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَاتِكُمْ ۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ ۖ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ اتَّقَىٰ
53.translation: Those who avoid the major sins and immoralities, only [committing] slight ones. Indeed, your Lord is vast in forgiveness. He was most knowing of you when He produced you from the earth and when you were fetuses in the wombs of your mothers. So do not claim yourselves to be pure; He is most knowing of who fears Him.
53.transliteration: Allazeena yajtaniboona kabaaa'iral ismi walfawaa hisha illal lamam; inna rabbaka waasi'ul maghfirah; huwa a'lamu bikum iz ansha akum minal ardi wa iz antum ajinnatun fee butooni umma haatikum falaa tuzakkooo anfusakum huwa a'lamu bimanit taqaa

53.translation: Have you seen the one who turned away
And gave a little and [then] refrained?
Does he have knowledge of the unseen, so he sees?

53.text: أَمْ لَمْ يُنَبَّأْ بِمَا فِي صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ
53.translation: Or has he not been informed of what was in the scriptures of Moses
53.transliteration: Am lam yunabbaa bimaa fee suhuhfi Moosa

53.translation: And [of] Abraham, who fulfilled [his obligations] -
That no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another

53.text: وَأَنْ لَيْسَ لِلْإِنْسَانِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ
53.translation: And that there is not for man except that [good] for which he strives
53.transliteration: Wa al laisa lil insaani illaa maa sa'aa

53.translation: And that his effort is going to be seen -
Then he will be recompensed for it with the fullest recompense
And that to your Lord is the finality
And that it is He who makes [one] laugh and weep
53.transliteration: Wa annahoo huwa adhaka wa abkaa

53.translation: And that it is He who causes death and gives life
53.transliteration: Wa annahoo huwa amaata wa ahyaa

53.translation: And that He creates the two mates - the male and female -
53.transliteration: Wa annahoo khalaqaz zawjainiz zakara wal unsaa

53.translation: From a sperm-drop when it is emitted
And that [incumbent] upon Him is the next creation
And that it is He who enriches and suffices
53.transliteration: Wa annahoo huwa aghnaa wa aqnaa

53.translation: And that it is He who is the Lord of Sirius
And that He destroyed the first [people of] 'Aad
And Thamud - and He did not spare [them] -

53.text: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا هُمْ أَظْلَمَ وَأَطْغَىٰ
53.translation: And the people of Noah before. Indeed, it was they who were [even] more unjust and oppressing.
53.transliteration: Wa qawma Noohim min qablu innahum kaanoo hum azlama wa atghaa

53.translation: And the overturned towns He hurled down
And covered them by that which He covered.
Then which of the favors of your Lord do you doubt?
This [Prophet] is a warner like the former warners.
The Approaching Day has approached.

53.text: لَيْسَ لَهَا مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ
53.translation: Of it, [from those] besides Allah, there is no remover.
53.transliteration: Laisa lahaa min doonil laahi kaashifah

53.translation: Then at this statement do you wonder?
And you laugh and do not weep
While you are proudly sporting?
So prostrate to Allah and worship [Him].

54.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ اقْتَرَبَتِ السَّاعَةُ وَانْشَقَّ الْقَمَرُ
54.translation: The Hour has come near, and the moon has split [in two].
54.transliteration: Iqtarabatis Saa'atu wsan shaqqal qamar

54.text: وَإِنْ يَرَوْا آيَةً يُعْرِضُوا وَيَقُولُوا سِحْرٌ مُسْتَمِرٌّ
54.translation: And if they see a miracle, they turn away and say, "Passing magic."
54.transliteration: Wa iny yaraw aayatany yu'ridoo wa yaqooloo sihrum mustamirr

54.text: وَكَذَّبُوا وَاتَّبَعُوا أَهْوَاءَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلُّ أَمْرٍ مُسْتَقِرٌّ
54.translation: And they denied and followed their inclinations. But for every matter is a [time of] settlement.
54.transliteration: Wa kazzaboo wattaba'ooo ahwaaa'ahum; wa kullu amrim mustaqirr

54.text: وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُمْ مِنَ الْأَنْبَاءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزْدَجَرٌ
54.translation: And there has already come to them of information that in which there is deterrence -
54.transliteration: Wa laqad jaaa'ahum minal ambaaa'i maa feehi muzdajar

54.text: حِكْمَةٌ بَالِغَةٌ ۖ فَمَا تُغْنِ النُّذُرُ
54.translation: Extensive wisdom - but warning does not avail [them].
54.transliteration: Hikmatum baalighatun famaa tughnin nuzur

54.text: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ ۘ يَوْمَ يَدْعُ الدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَيْءٍ نُكُرٍ
54.translation: So leave them, [O Muhammad]. The Day the Caller calls to something forbidding,
54.transliteration: Fatawalla 'anhum; yawma yad'ud daa'i ilaa shai 'in nukur

54.text: خُشَّعًا أَبْصَارُهُمْ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمْ جَرَادٌ مُنْتَشِرٌ
54.translation: Their eyes humbled, they will emerge from the graves as if they were locusts spreading,
54.transliteration: khushsha'an absaaruhum yakrujoona minal ajdaasi ka annahum jaraadum muntashir

54.text: مُهْطِعِينَ إِلَى الدَّاعِ ۖ يَقُولُ الْكَافِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَسِرٌ
54.translation: Racing ahead toward the Caller. The disbelievers will say, "This is a difficult Day."
54.transliteration: Muhti'eena ilad daa'i yaqoolul kafiroona haazaa yawmun 'asir

54.text: ۞ كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ فَكَذَّبُوا عَبْدَنَا وَقَالُوا مَجْنُونٌ وَازْدُجِرَ
54.translation: The people of Noah denied before them, and they denied Our servant and said, "A madman," and he was repelled.
54.transliteration: Kazzabat qablahum qawmu Noohin fakazzaboo 'abdanaa wa qaaloo majnoo nunw wazdujir

54.text: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُ أَنِّي مَغْلُوبٌ فَانْتَصِرْ
54.translation: So he invoked his Lord, "Indeed, I am overpowered, so help."
54.transliteration: Fada'aa Rabbahooo annee maghloobun fantasir

54.text: فَفَتَحْنَا أَبْوَابَ السَّمَاءِ بِمَاءٍ مُنْهَمِرٍ
54.translation: Then We opened the gates of the heaven with rain pouring down
54.transliteration: Fafatahnaaa abwaabas sa maaa'i bimaa'im munhamir

54.text: وَفَجَّرْنَا الْأَرْضَ عُيُونًا فَالْتَقَى الْمَاءُ عَلَىٰ أَمْرٍ قَدْ قُدِرَ
54.translation: And caused the earth to burst with springs, and the waters met for a matter already predestined.
54.transliteration: Wa fajjamal arda 'uyoonan faltaqal maaa'u 'alaaa amrin qad qudir

54.text: وَحَمَلْنَاهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلْوَاحٍ وَدُسُرٍ
54.translation: And We carried him on a [construction of] planks and nails,
54.transliteration: Wa hamalnaahu 'alaa zaati alwaahinw wa dusur

54.text: تَجْرِي بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَاءً لِمَنْ كَانَ كُفِرَ
54.translation: Sailing under Our observation as reward for he who had been denied.
54.transliteration: Tajree bi a'yuninaa jazaaa 'al liman kaana kufir

54.text: وَلَقَدْ تَرَكْنَاهَا آيَةً فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ
54.translation: And We left it as a sign, so is there any who will remember?
54.transliteration: Wa laqat taraknaahaad aayatan fahal mim muddakir

54.text: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
54.translation: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.
54.transliteration: Fakaifa kaana 'azaabee wa nuzur

54.text: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ
54.translation: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
54.transliteration: Wa laqad yassamal Quraana liz zikri fahal mimmuddakir

54.text: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
54.translation: 'Aad denied; and how [severe] were My punishment and warning.
54.transliteration: Kazzabat 'Aadun fakaifa kaana 'azaabee wa nuzur

54.text: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًا صَرْصَرًا فِي يَوْمِ نَحْسٍ مُسْتَمِرٍّ
54.translation: Indeed, We sent upon them a screaming wind on a day of continuous misfortune,
54.transliteration: Innaa arsalnaa 'alaihim reehan sarsaran fee Yawmi nahsim mustamirr

54.text: تَنْزِعُ النَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ مُنْقَعِرٍ
54.translation: Extracting the people as if they were trunks of palm trees uprooted.
54.transliteration: Tanzi;un naasa ka anna huma'jaazu nakhlim munqa'ir

54.text: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
54.translation: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.
54.transliteration: 'Fakaifa kaana 'azaabee wa nuzur

54.text: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ
54.translation: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
54.transliteration: Wa laqad yassamal Quraana liz zikri fahal mim muddakir

54.text: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِالنُّذُرِ
54.translation: Thamud denied the warning
54.transliteration: Kazzabat Samoodu binnuzur

54.text: فَقَالُوا أَبَشَرًا مِنَّا وَاحِدًا نَتَّبِعُهُ إِنَّا إِذًا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ وَسُعُرٍ
54.translation: And said, "Is it one human being among us that we should follow? Indeed, we would then be in error and madness.
54.transliteration: Faqaalooo a-basharam minnaa waahidan nattabi'uhooo innaa izal lafee dalaalinw wa su'ur

54.text: أَأُلْقِيَ الذِّكْرُ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٌ
54.translation: Has the message been sent down upon him from among us? Rather, he is an insolent liar."
54.transliteration: 'A-ulqiyaz zikru 'alaihi mim baininaa bal huwa kazzaabun ashir

54.text: سَيَعْلَمُونَ غَدًا مَنِ الْكَذَّابُ الْأَشِرُ
54.translation: They will know tomorrow who is the insolent liar.
54.transliteration: Sa-ya'lamoona ghadam manil kazzaabul ashir

54.text: إِنَّا مُرْسِلُو النَّاقَةِ فِتْنَةً لَهُمْ فَارْتَقِبْهُمْ وَاصْطَبِرْ
54.translation: Indeed, We are sending the she-camel as trial for them, so watch them and be patient.
54.transliteration: Innaa mursilun naaqati fitnatal lahum fartaqibhum wastabir

54.text: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ أَنَّ الْمَاءَ قِسْمَةٌ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلُّ شِرْبٍ مُحْتَضَرٌ
54.translation: And inform them that the water is shared between them, each [day of] drink attended [by turn].
54.transliteration: Wa nabbi'hum annal maaa'a qismatum bainahum kullu shirbim muhtadar

54.text: فَنَادَوْا صَاحِبَهُمْ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ
54.translation: But they called their companion, and he dared and hamstrung [her].
54.transliteration: Fanaadaw saahibahum fata'aataa fa'aqar

54.text: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
54.translation: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.
54.transliteration: Fakaifa kaana 'azaabee wa nuzur

54.text: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَكَانُوا كَهَشِيمِ الْمُحْتَظِرِ
54.translation: Indeed, We sent upon them one blast from the sky, and they became like the dry twig fragments of an [animal] pen.
54.transliteration: Innaaa arsalnaa 'alaihim saihatanw waahidatan fakaano kahasheemil muhtazir

54.text: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ
54.translation: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
54.transliteration: Wa laqad yassarnal quraana liz zikri fahal mim muddakir

54.text: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ بِالنُّذُرِ
54.translation: The people of Lot denied the warning.
54.transliteration: Kazzabat qawmu lootim binnuzur

54.text: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حَاصِبًا إِلَّا آلَ لُوطٍ ۖ نَجَّيْنَاهُمْ بِسَحَرٍ
54.translation: Indeed, We sent upon them a storm of stones, except the family of Lot - We saved them before dawn
54.transliteration: Innaa arsalnaa 'alaihim haasiban illaaa aala Loot najjainaahum bisahar

54.text: نِعْمَةً مِنْ عِنْدِنَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي مَنْ شَكَرَ
54.translation: As favor from us. Thus do We reward he who is grateful.
54.transliteration: Ni'matam min 'indinaa; kazaalika najzee man shakar

54.text: وَلَقَدْ أَنْذَرَهُمْ بَطْشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوْا بِالنُّذُرِ
54.translation: And he had already warned them of Our assault, but they disputed the warning.
54.transliteration: Wa laqad anzarahum batshatanaa fatamaaraw binnuzur

54.text: وَلَقَدْ رَاوَدُوهُ عَنْ ضَيْفِهِ فَطَمَسْنَا أَعْيُنَهُمْ فَذُوقُوا عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
54.translation: And they had demanded from him his guests, but We obliterated their eyes, [saying], "Taste My punishment and warning."
54.transliteration: Wa laqad raawadoohu 'andaifee fatamasnaaa a'yunahum fazooqoo 'azaabee wa nuzur

54.text: وَلَقَدْ صَبَّحَهُمْ بُكْرَةً عَذَابٌ مُسْتَقِرٌّ
54.translation: And there came upon them by morning an abiding punishment.
54.transliteration: Wa laqad sabbahahum bukratan 'azaabum mustaqirr

54.text: فَذُوقُوا عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
54.translation: So taste My punishment and warning.
54.transliteration: Fazooqoo 'azaabee wa nuzur

54.text: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ
54.translation: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
54.transliteration: Wa laqad yassarnal Quraana liz zikri fahal mim muddakir

54.text: وَلَقَدْ جَاءَ آلَ فِرْعَوْنَ النُّذُرُ
54.translation: And there certainly came to the people of Pharaoh warning.
54.transliteration: Wa laqad jaaa'a Aala Fir'awnan nuzur

54.text: كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذْنَاهُمْ أَخْذَ عَزِيزٍ مُقْتَدِرٍ
54.translation: They denied Our signs, all of them, so We seized them with a seizure of one Exalted in Might and Perfect in Ability.
54.transliteration: Kazzaboo bi Aayaatinaa kullihaa fa akhaznaahum akhza 'azeezim muqtadir

54.text: أَكُفَّارُكُمْ خَيْرٌ مِنْ أُولَٰئِكُمْ أَمْ لَكُمْ بَرَاءَةٌ فِي الزُّبُرِ
54.translation: Are your disbelievers better than those [former ones], or have you immunity in the scripture?
54.transliteration: Akuffaarukum khairum min ulaaa'ikum am lakum baraaa'atun fiz Zubur

54.text: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ نَحْنُ جَمِيعٌ مُنْتَصِرٌ
54.translation: Or do they say, "We are an assembly supporting [each other]"?
54.transliteration: Am yaqooloona nahnu jamee'um muntasir

54.text: سَيُهْزَمُ الْجَمْعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ الدُّبُرَ
54.translation: [Their] assembly will be defeated, and they will turn their backs [in retreat].
54.transliteration: Sa yuhzamul jam'u wa yuwalloonad dubur

54.text: بَلِ السَّاعَةُ مَوْعِدُهُمْ وَالسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ
54.translation: But the Hour is their appointment [for due punishment], and the Hour is more disastrous and more bitter.
54.transliteration: Balis Saa'atu maw'iduhum was Saa'atu adhaa wa amarr

54.text: إِنَّ الْمُجْرِمِينَ فِي ضَلَالٍ وَسُعُرٍ
54.translation: Indeed, the criminals are in error and madness.
54.transliteration: Innal mujrimeena fee dalaalinw wa su'ur

54.text: يَوْمَ يُسْحَبُونَ فِي النَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ ذُوقُوا مَسَّ سَقَرَ
54.translation: The Day they are dragged into the Fire on their faces [it will be said], "Taste the touch of Saqar."
54.transliteration: Yawma yushaboona fin Naari'alaa wujoohimim zooqoo massa saqar

54.text: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَاهُ بِقَدَرٍ
54.translation: Indeed, all things We created with predestination.
54.transliteration: Innaa kulla shai'in khalaqnaahu biqadar

54.text: وَمَا أَمْرُنَا إِلَّا وَاحِدَةٌ كَلَمْحٍ بِالْبَصَرِ
54.translation: And Our command is but one, like a glance of the eye.
54.transliteration: Wa maaa amrunaaa illaa waahidatun kalamhim bilbasar

54.text: وَلَقَدْ أَهْلَكْنَا أَشْيَاعَكُمْ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ
54.translation: And We have already destroyed your kinds, so is there any who will remember?
54.transliteration: Wa laqad ahlaknaaa ashyaa'akum fahal mim muddakir

54.text: وَكُلُّ شَيْءٍ فَعَلُوهُ فِي الزُّبُرِ
54.translation: And everything they did is in written records.
54.transliteration: Wa kullu shai'in fa'aloohu fiz Zubur

54.text: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٍ وَكَبِيرٍ مُسْتَطَرٌ
54.translation: And every small and great [thing] is inscribed.
54.transliteration: Wa kullu sagheerinw wa kabeerim mustatar

54.text: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَنَهَرٍ
54.translation: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and rivers,
54.transliteration: Innal muttaqeena fee jannaatinw wa nahar

54.text: فِي مَقْعَدِ صِدْقٍ عِنْدَ مَلِيكٍ مُقْتَدِرٍ
54.translation: In a seat of honor near a Sovereign, Perfect in Ability.
54.transliteration: Fee maq'adi sidqin 'inda Maleekim Muqtadir

55.translation: The Most Merciful
Taught the Qur'an,
Created man,
[And] taught him eloquence.
The sun and the moon [move] by precise calculation,
And the stars and trees prostrate.
And the heaven He raised and imposed the balance
That you not transgress within the balance.

55.text: وَأَقِيمُوا الْوَزْنَ بِالْقِسْطِ وَلَا تُخْسِرُوا الْمِيزَانَ
55.translation: And establish weight in justice and do not make deficient the balance.
55.transliteration: Wa aqeemul wazna bilqisti wa laa tukhsirul meezaan

55.translation: And the earth He laid [out] for the creatures.
Therein is fruit and palm trees having sheaths [of dates]
55.transliteration: Feehaa faakihatunw wan nakhlu zaatul akmaam

55.translation: And grain having husks and scented plants.
So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
He created man from clay like [that of] pottery.

55.text: وَخَلَقَ الْجَانَّ مِنْ مَارِجٍ مِنْ نَارٍ
55.translation: And He created the jinn from a smokeless flame of fire.
55.transliteration: Wa khalaqal jaaan mim maarijim min naar

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
[He is] Lord of the two sunrises and Lord of the two sunsets.
So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
He released the two seas, meeting [side by side];
Between them is a barrier [so] neither of them transgresses.
So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
From both of them emerge pearl and coral.
55.transliteration: Yakhruju minhumal lu 'lu u wal marjaanu

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

55.text: وَلَهُ الْجَوَارِ الْمُنْشَآتُ فِي الْبَحْرِ كَالْأَعْلَامِ
55.translation: And to Him belong the ships [with sails] elevated in the sea like mountains.
55.transliteration: Wa lahul jawaaril mun sha'aatu fil bahri kal a'laam

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
Everyone upon the earth will perish,

55.text: وَيَبْقَىٰ وَجْهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ
55.translation: And there will remain the Face of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor.
55.transliteration: Wa yabqaa wajhu rabbika zul jalaali wal ikraam

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

55.text: يَسْأَلُهُ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ هُوَ فِي شَأْنٍ
55.translation: Whoever is within the heavens and earth asks Him; every day He is bringing about a matter.
55.transliteration: Yas'aluhoo man fissamaawaati walard; kulla ywmin huwa fee shaan

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
We will attend to you, O prominent beings.
So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

55.text: يَا مَعْشَرَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنْسِ إِنِ اسْتَطَعْتُمْ أَنْ تَنْفُذُوا مِنْ أَقْطَارِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ فَانْفُذُوا ۚ لَا تَنْفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلْطَانٍ
55.translation: O company of jinn and mankind, if you are able to pass beyond the regions of the heavens and the earth, then pass. You will not pass except by authority [from Allah].
55.transliteration: Yaa ma'sharal jinni wal insi inis tata'tum an tanfuzoo min aqtaaris samaawaati wal ardi fanfuzoo; laa tanfuzoona illaa bisultaan

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

55.text: يُرْسَلُ عَلَيْكُمَا شُوَاظٌ مِنْ نَارٍ وَنُحَاسٌ فَلَا تَنْتَصِرَانِ
55.translation: There will be sent upon you a flame of fire and smoke, and you will not defend yourselves.
55.transliteration: Yursalu 'alaikumaa shuwaazum min naarifiw-wa nuhaasun falaa tantasiraan

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

55.text: فَإِذَا انْشَقَّتِ السَّمَاءُ فَكَانَتْ وَرْدَةً كَالدِّهَانِ
55.translation: And when the heaven is split open and becomes rose-colored like oil -
55.transliteration: Fa-izan shaqqatis samaaa'u fakaanat wardatan kaddihaan

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

55.text: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَا يُسْأَلُ عَنْ ذَنْبِهِ إِنْسٌ وَلَا جَانٌّ
55.translation: Then on that Day none will be asked about his sin among men or jinn.
55.transliteration: Fa-yawma'izil laa yus'alu 'an zambiheee insunw wa laa jaann

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

55.text: يُعْرَفُ الْمُجْرِمُونَ بِسِيمَاهُمْ فَيُؤْخَذُ بِالنَّوَاصِي وَالْأَقْدَامِ
55.translation: The criminals will be known by their marks, and they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet.
55.transliteration: Yu'raful mujrimoona biseemaahum fa'yu'khazu binna waasi wal aqdaam

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

55.text: هَٰذِهِ جَهَنَّمُ الَّتِي يُكَذِّبُ بِهَا الْمُجْرِمُونَ
55.translation: This is Hell, which the criminals deny.
55.transliteration: Haazihee jahannamul latee yukazzibu bihal mujrimoon

55.translation: They will go around between it and scalding water, heated [to the utmost degree].
55.transliteration: Yatoofoona bainahaa wa baina hameemim aan

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
But for he who has feared the position of his Lord are two gardens -
55.transliteration: Wa liman khaafa maqaama rabbihee jannataan

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
Having [spreading] branches.
So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
In both of them are two springs, flowing.
So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
In both of them are of every fruit, two kinds.
So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

55.text: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشٍ بَطَائِنُهَا مِنْ إِسْتَبْرَقٍ ۚ وَجَنَى الْجَنَّتَيْنِ دَانٍ
55.translation: [They are] reclining on beds whose linings are of silk brocade, and the fruit of the two gardens is hanging low.
55.transliteration: Muttaki'eena 'alaa furushim bataaa'inuhaa min istabraq; wajanal jannataini daan

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

55.text: فِيهِنَّ قَاصِرَاتُ الطَّرْفِ لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنْسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَانٌّ
55.translation: In them are women limiting [their] glances, untouched before them by man or jinni -
55.transliteration: Feehinna qaasiratut tarfi lam yatmishunna insun qablahum wa laa jaaann

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
As if they were rubies and coral.
So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
Is the reward for good [anything] but good?
So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
And below them both [in excellence] are two [other] gardens -
So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
Dark green [in color].
So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
In both of them are two springs, spouting.
So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
In both of them are fruit and palm trees and pomegranates.
55.transliteration: Feehimaa faakihatunw wa nakhlunw wa rummaan

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
In them are good and beautiful women -
So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
Fair ones reserved in pavilions -
So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

55.text: لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنْسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَانٌّ
55.translation: Untouched before them by man or jinni -
55.transliteration: Lam yatmis hunna insun qablahum wa laa jaaann

55.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

55.text: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ رَفْرَفٍ خُضْرٍ وَعَبْقَرِيٍّ حِسَانٍ
55.translation: Reclining on green cushions and beautiful fine carpets.
So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

55.text: تَبَارَكَ اسْمُ رَبِّكَ ذِي الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ
55.translation: Blessed is the name of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor.

56.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا وَقَعَتِ الْوَاقِعَةُ
56.translation: When the Occurrence occurs,
There is, at its occurrence, no denial.
It will bring down [some] and raise up [others].
When the earth is shaken with convulsion
And the mountains are broken down, crumbling
And become dust dispersing.
And you become [of] three kinds:
Then the companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?
56.transliteration: Fa as haabul maimanati maaa as haabul maimanah

56.translation: And the companions of the left - what are the companions of the left?
56.transliteration: Wa as haabul mash'amati maaa as haabul mash'amah

56.translation: And the forerunners, the forerunners -
Those are the ones brought near [to Allah]
In the Gardens of Pleasure,
A [large] company of the former peoples
And a few of the later peoples,
On thrones woven [with ornament],
Reclining on them, facing each other.
There will circulate among them young boys made eternal
With vessels, pitchers and a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring -
56.transliteration: Bi akwaabinw wa abaareeq, wa kaasim mim ma'een

56.translation: No headache will they have therefrom, nor will they be intoxicated -
And fruit of what they select
And the meat of fowl, from whatever they desire.
And [for them are] fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes,
The likenesses of pearls well-protected,
As reward for what they used to do.

56.text: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا تَأْثِيمًا
56.translation: They will not hear therein ill speech or commission of sin -
56.transliteration: Laa yasma'oona feehaa laghwanw wa laa taaseemaa

56.translation: Only a saying: "Peace, peace."
The companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?
56.transliteration: Wa as haabul yameeni maaa as haabul Yameen

56.translation: [They will be] among lote trees with thorns removed
And [banana] trees layered [with fruit]
And shade extended
And water poured out
And fruit, abundant [and varied],
Neither limited [to season] nor forbidden,
And [upon] beds raised high.
Indeed, We have produced the women of Paradise in a [new] creation
And made them virgins,
Devoted [to their husbands] and of equal age,
For the companions of the right [who are]
A company of the former peoples
And a company of the later peoples.
And the companions of the left - what are the companions of the left?
56.transliteration: Wa as haabush shimaali maaa as haabush shimaal

56.translation: [They will be] in scorching fire and scalding water
And a shade of black smoke,
Neither cool nor beneficial.
Indeed they were, before that, indulging in affluence,
And they used to persist in the great violation,

56.text: وَكَانُوا يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
56.translation: And they used to say, "When we die and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
56.transliteration: Wa kaanoo yaqooloona a'izaa mitnaa wa kunnaa turaabanw wa izaaman'ainnaa lamab'oosoon

56.translation: And our forefathers [as well]?"
Say, [O Muhammad], "Indeed, the former and the later peoples
Are to be gathered together for the appointment of a known Day."
Then indeed you, O those astray [who are] deniers,
Will be eating from trees of zaqqum
56.transliteration: La aakiloona min shaja rim min zaqqoom

56.translation: And filling with it your bellies
And drinking on top of it from scalding water
And will drink as the drinking of thirsty camels.
That is their accommodation on the Day of Recompense.
We have created you, so why do you not believe?
Have you seen that which you emit?
Is it you who creates it, or are We the Creator?

56.text: نَحْنُ قَدَّرْنَا بَيْنَكُمُ الْمَوْتَ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
56.translation: We have decreed death among you, and We are not to be outdone
56.transliteration: Nahnu qaddarnaa baina kumul mawta wa maa nahnu bimasbooqeen

56.text: عَلَىٰ أَنْ نُبَدِّلَ أَمْثَالَكُمْ وَنُنْشِئَكُمْ فِي مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
56.translation: In that We will change your likenesses and produce you in that [form] which you do not know.
56.transliteration: 'Alaaa an nubaddila amsaalakum wa nunshi'akum fee maa laa ta'lamoon

56.text: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْتُمُ النَّشْأَةَ الْأُولَىٰ فَلَوْلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
56.translation: And you have already known the first creation, so will you not remember?
56.transliteration: Wa laqad 'alimtumun nash atal oolaa falaw laa tazakkaroon

56.translation: And have you seen that [seed] which you sow?
Is it you who makes it grow, or are We the grower?

56.text: لَوْ نَشَاءُ لَجَعَلْنَاهُ حُطَامًا فَظَلْتُمْ تَفَكَّهُونَ
56.translation: If We willed, We could make it [dry] debris, and you would remain in wonder,
56.transliteration: Law nashaaa'u laja'al naahu hutaaman fazaltum tafakkahoon

56.translation: [Saying], "Indeed, we are [now] in debt;
Rather, we have been deprived."
And have you seen the water that you drink?

56.text: أَأَنْتُمْ أَنْزَلْتُمُوهُ مِنَ الْمُزْنِ أَمْ نَحْنُ الْمُنْزِلُونَ
56.translation: Is it you who brought it down from the clouds, or is it We who bring it down?
56.transliteration: 'A-antum anzaltumoohu minal muzni am nahnul munziloon

56.text: لَوْ نَشَاءُ جَعَلْنَاهُ أُجَاجًا فَلَوْلَا تَشْكُرُونَ
56.translation: If We willed, We could make it bitter, so why are you not grateful?
56.transliteration: Law nashaaa'u ja'alnaahu ujaajan falaw laa tashkuroon

56.translation: And have you seen the fire that you ignite?

56.text: أَأَنْتُمْ أَنْشَأْتُمْ شَجَرَتَهَا أَمْ نَحْنُ الْمُنْشِئُونَ
56.translation: Is it you who produced its tree, or are We the producer?
We have made it a reminder and provision for the travelers,
56.transliteration: Nahnu ja'alnaahaa tazkira tanw wa mataa'al lilmuqween

56.translation: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
Then I swear by the setting of the stars,
And indeed, it is an oath - if you could know - [most] great.
Indeed, it is a noble Qur'an
In a Register well-protected;
None touch it except the purified.
[It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
Then is it to this statement that you are indifferent
And make [the thanks for] your provision that you deny [the Provider]?
Then why, when the soul at death reaches the throat
And you are at that time looking on -

56.text: وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْكُمْ وَلَٰكِنْ لَا تُبْصِرُونَ
56.translation: And Our angels are nearer to him than you, but you do not see -
56.transliteration: Wa nahnu aqrabu ilaihi minkum wa laakil laa tubsiroon

56.translation: Then why do you not, if you are not to be recompensed,
56.transliteration: Falaw laaa in kuntum ghira madeeneen

56.translation: Bring it back, if you should be truthful?
And if the deceased was of those brought near to Allah,
56.transliteration: Fa ammaaa in kaana minal muqarrabeen

56.translation: Then [for him is] rest and bounty and a garden of pleasure.
56.transliteration: Farawhunw wa raihaa nunw wa jannatu na'eem

56.text: وَأَمَّا إِنْ كَانَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ الْيَمِينِ
56.translation: And if he was of the companions of the right,
56.transliteration: Wa ammaaa in kaana min as haabil yameen

56.translation: Then [the angels will say], "Peace for you; [you are] from the companions of the right."
56.transliteration: Fasalaamul laka min as haabil yameen

56.text: وَأَمَّا إِنْ كَانَ مِنَ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ الضَّالِّينَ
56.translation: But if he was of the deniers [who were] astray,
56.transliteration: Wa ammaaa in kaana minal mukazzibeenad daaalleen

56.translation: Then [for him is] accommodation of scalding water
And burning in Hellfire
Indeed, this is the true certainty,
So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

57.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
57.translation: Whatever is in the heavens and earth exalts Allah, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
57.transliteration: Sabbaha lillaahi maa fissamaawaati wal ardi wa Huwal 'Azeezul Hakeem

57.text: لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
57.translation: His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. He gives life and causes death, and He is over all things competent.
57.transliteration: Lahoo mulkus samaawaati wal ardi yuhyee wa yumeetu wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shai'in Qadeer

57.text: هُوَ الْأَوَّلُ وَالْآخِرُ وَالظَّاهِرُ وَالْبَاطِنُ ۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
57.translation: He is the First and the Last, the Ascendant and the Intimate, and He is, of all things, Knowing.
57.transliteration: Huwal Awwalu wal'Aakhiru waz Zaahiru wal Baatinu wa huwa bikulli shai'in Aleem

57.text: هُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ اسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ ۚ يَعْلَمُ مَا يَلِجُ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْهَا وَمَا يَنْزِلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ وَمَا يَعْرُجُ فِيهَا ۖ وَهُوَ مَعَكُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
57.translation: It is He who created the heavens and earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne. He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein; and He is with you wherever you are. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.
57.transliteration: Huwal lazee khalaqas samaawaati wal arda fee sittati ayyaamin summas tawaa 'alal 'Arsh; ya'lamu maa yaliju filardi wa maa yakhruju minhaa wa maa yanzilu minas samaaa'i wa maa ya'ruju feeha wa Huwa ma'akum ayna maa kuntum; wallaahu bimaa ta'maloona Baseer

57.text: لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ تُرْجَعُ الْأُمُورُ
57.translation: His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. And to Allah are returned [all] matters.
57.transliteration: Lahoo mulkus samaawaati wal ard; wa ilal laahi turja'ul umoor

57.text: يُولِجُ اللَّيْلَ فِي النَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ النَّهَارَ فِي اللَّيْلِ ۚ وَهُوَ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ
57.translation: He causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night, and he is Knowing of that within the breasts.
57.transliteration: Yoolijul laila fin nahaari wa yoolijun nahaara fil lail; wa Huwa 'Aleemum bizaatis sudoor

57.text: آمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ وَأَنْفِقُوا مِمَّا جَعَلَكُمْ مُسْتَخْلَفِينَ فِيهِ ۖ فَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنْكُمْ وَأَنْفَقُوا لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ كَبِيرٌ
57.translation: Believe in Allah and His Messenger and spend out of that in which He has made you successors. For those who have believed among you and spent, there will be a great reward.
57.transliteration: Aaaminoo billaahi wa Rasoolihee wa anfiqoo mimmaa ja'alakum mustakh lafeena feehi fallazeena aamanoo minkum wa anfaqoo lahum ajrun kabeer

57.text: وَمَا لَكُمْ لَا تُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ ۙ وَالرَّسُولُ يَدْعُوكُمْ لِتُؤْمِنُوا بِرَبِّكُمْ وَقَدْ أَخَذَ مِيثَاقَكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
57.translation: And why do you not believe in Allah while the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord and He has taken your covenant, if you should [truly] be believers?
57.transliteration: Wa maa lakum laa tu'minoona billaahi war Rasoolu yad'ookum lituu'minoo bi Rabbikum wa qad akhaza meesaaqakum in kuntum mu'mineen

57.text: هُوَ الَّذِي يُنَزِّلُ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ آيَاتٍ بَيِّنَاتٍ لِيُخْرِجَكُمْ مِنَ الظُّلُمَاتِ إِلَى النُّورِ ۚ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ بِكُمْ لَرَءُوفٌ رَحِيمٌ
57.translation: It is He who sends down upon His Servant [Muhammad] verses of clear evidence that He may bring you out from darknesses into the light. And indeed, Allah is to you Kind and Merciful.
57.transliteration: Huwal lazee yunazzilu 'alaa 'abdiheee Aayaatim baiyinaatil liyukhrijakum minaz zulumaati ilan noor; wa innal laaha bikum la Ra'oofur Raheem

57.text: وَمَا لَكُمْ أَلَّا تُنْفِقُوا فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ وَلِلَّهِ مِيرَاثُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ لَا يَسْتَوِي مِنْكُمْ مَنْ أَنْفَقَ مِنْ قَبْلِ الْفَتْحِ وَقَاتَلَ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ أَعْظَمُ دَرَجَةً مِنَ الَّذِينَ أَنْفَقُوا مِنْ بَعْدُ وَقَاتَلُوا ۚ وَكُلًّا وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الْحُسْنَىٰ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌ
57.translation: And why do you not spend in the cause of Allah while to Allah belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth? Not equal among you are those who spent before the conquest [of Makkah] and fought [and those who did so after it]. Those are greater in degree than they who spent afterwards and fought. But to all Allah has promised the best [reward]. And Allah, with what you do, is Acquainted.
57.transliteration: Wa maa lakum allaa tunfiqoo fee sabeelil laahi wa lillaahi meeraasus samaawaati wal-ard; laa yastawee minkum man anfaqa min qablil fat-hi wa qaatal; ulaaaika a'zamu darajatam minal lazeena anfaqoo mim ba'du wa qaataloo; wa kullanw wa'adallaahul husnaa; wallaahu bimaa ta'maloona Khabeer

57.text: مَنْ ذَا الَّذِي يُقْرِضُ اللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا فَيُضَاعِفَهُ لَهُ وَلَهُ أَجْرٌ كَرِيمٌ
57.translation: Who is it that would loan Allah a goodly loan so He will multiply it for him and he will have a noble reward?
57.transliteration: man zal lazee yuqridul laaha qardan hasanan fa yudaa'ifahoo lahoo wa lahooo ajrun kareem

57.text: يَوْمَ تَرَى الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ يَسْعَىٰ نُورُهُمْ بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَبِأَيْمَانِهِمْ بُشْرَاكُمُ الْيَوْمَ جَنَّاتٌ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ
57.translation: On the Day you see the believing men and believing women, their light proceeding before them and on their right, [it will be said], "Your good tidings today are [of] gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein you will abide eternally." That is what is the great attainment.
57.transliteration: Yawma taral mu'mineena walmu'minaati yas'aa nooruhum baina aydeehim wa biaymaanihim bushraakumul yawma jannaatun tajree min tahtihal anhaaru khaalideena feeha; zaalika huwal fawzul 'azeem

57.text: يَوْمَ يَقُولُ الْمُنَافِقُونَ وَالْمُنَافِقَاتُ لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا انْظُرُونَا نَقْتَبِسْ مِنْ نُورِكُمْ قِيلَ ارْجِعُوا وَرَاءَكُمْ فَالْتَمِسُوا نُورًا فَضُرِبَ بَيْنَهُمْ بِسُورٍ لَهُ بَابٌ بَاطِنُهُ فِيهِ الرَّحْمَةُ وَظَاهِرُهُ مِنْ قِبَلِهِ الْعَذَابُ
57.translation: On the [same] Day the hypocrite men and hypocrite women will say to those who believed, "Wait for us that we may acquire some of your light." It will be said, "Go back behind you and seek light." And a wall will be placed between them with a door, its interior containing mercy, but on the outside of it is torment.
57.transliteration: Yawma yaqoolul munaa fiqoona walmunaafiqaatu lillazeena aamanun zuroonaa naqtabis min noorikum qeelarji'oo waraaa'akum faltamisoo nooran faduriba bainahum bisooril lahoo baab, baatinuhoo feehir rahmatu wa zaahiruhoo min qibalihi-'azaab

57.text: يُنَادُونَهُمْ أَلَمْ نَكُنْ مَعَكُمْ ۖ قَالُوا بَلَىٰ وَلَٰكِنَّكُمْ فَتَنْتُمْ أَنْفُسَكُمْ وَتَرَبَّصْتُمْ وَارْتَبْتُمْ وَغَرَّتْكُمُ الْأَمَانِيُّ حَتَّىٰ جَاءَ أَمْرُ اللَّهِ وَغَرَّكُمْ بِاللَّهِ الْغَرُورُ
57.translation: The hypocrites will call to the believers, "Were we not with you?" They will say, "Yes, but you afflicted yourselves and awaited [misfortune for us] and doubted, and wishful thinking deluded you until there came the command of Allah. And the Deceiver deceived you concerning Allah.
57.transliteration: Yunaadoonahum alam nakum ma'akum qaaloo balaa wa laakinnakum fatantum anfusakum wa tarabbastum wartabtum wa gharratkumul amaaniyyu hatta jaaa'a amrul laahi wa gharrakum billaahil gharoor

57.text: فَالْيَوْمَ لَا يُؤْخَذُ مِنْكُمْ فِدْيَةٌ وَلَا مِنَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا ۚ مَأْوَاكُمُ النَّارُ ۖ هِيَ مَوْلَاكُمْ ۖ وَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ
57.translation: So today no ransom will be taken from you or from those who disbelieved. Your refuge is the Fire. It is most worthy of you, and wretched is the destination.
57.transliteration: Fal Yawma laa yu'khazu minkum fidyatunw wa laa minal lazeena kafaroo; maawaakumun Naaru hiya maw laakum wa bi'sal maseer
