65.transliteration: Askinoohunna min haisu sakantum minw wujdikum wa laa tudaaarroohunna litudaiyiqoo 'alaihinn; wa in kunna ulaati hamlin fa anfiqoo 'alihinna hattaa yada'na hamlahunn; fain arda'na lakum fa aatoo hunna ujoorahunna waatamiroo bainakum bima'roofinw wa in ta'aasartum fasaturdi'u lahooo ukhraa

65.text: لِيُنْفِقْ ذُو سَعَةٍ مِنْ سَعَتِهِ ۖ وَمَنْ قُدِرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقُهُ فَلْيُنْفِقْ مِمَّا آتَاهُ اللَّهُ ۚ لَا يُكَلِّفُ اللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا مَا آتَاهَا ۚ سَيَجْعَلُ اللَّهُ بَعْدَ عُسْرٍ يُسْرًا
65.translation: Let a man of wealth spend from his wealth, and he whose provision is restricted - let him spend from what Allah has given him. Allah does not charge a soul except [according to] what He has given it. Allah will bring about, after hardship, ease.
65.transliteration: Liyuntiq zoo sa'atim min sa'atihee wa man qudira 'alaihi riquhoo falyunfiq mimmaaa aataahul laah; laa yukalliful laahu nafsan illaa maaa aataahaa; sa yaj'alul laahu ba'da'usriny yusraa

65.text: وَكَأَيِّنْ مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ عَتَتْ عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهَا وَرُسُلِهِ فَحَاسَبْنَاهَا حِسَابًا شَدِيدًا وَعَذَّبْنَاهَا عَذَابًا نُكْرًا
65.translation: And how many a city was insolent toward the command of its Lord and His messengers, so We took it to severe account and punished it with a terrible punishment.
65.transliteration: Wa ka ayyim min qaryatin 'atat 'an amri Rabbihaa wa Rusulihee fahaasabnaahaa hisaaban shadeedanw wa 'azzabnaahaa 'azaaban nukraa

65.text: فَذَاقَتْ وَبَالَ أَمْرِهَا وَكَانَ عَاقِبَةُ أَمْرِهَا خُسْرًا
65.translation: And it tasted the bad consequence of its affair, and the outcome of its affair was loss.
65.transliteration: Fazaaqat wabbala amrihaa wa kaana 'aaqibatu amrihaa khusraa

65.text: أَعَدَّ اللَّهُ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا ۖ فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ يَا أُولِي الْأَلْبَابِ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا ۚ قَدْ أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ إِلَيْكُمْ ذِكْرًا
65.translation: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment; so fear Allah, O you of understanding who have believed. Allah has sent down to you the Qur'an.
65.transliteration: A'addal laahu lahum 'azaaban shadeedan fattaqul laaha yaaa ulil albaab, allazeena aammanoo; qad anzalal laahu ilaikum zikraa

65.text: رَسُولًا يَتْلُو عَلَيْكُمْ آيَاتِ اللَّهِ مُبَيِّنَاتٍ لِيُخْرِجَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ مِنَ الظُّلُمَاتِ إِلَى النُّورِ ۚ وَمَنْ يُؤْمِنْ بِاللَّهِ وَيَعْمَلْ صَالِحًا يُدْخِلْهُ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا ۖ قَدْ أَحْسَنَ اللَّهُ لَهُ رِزْقًا
65.translation: [He sent] a Messenger [Muhammad] reciting to you the distinct verses of Allah that He may bring out those who believe and do righteous deeds from darknesses into the light. And whoever believes in Allah and does righteousness - He will admit him into gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide therein forever. Allah will have perfected for him a provision.
65.transliteration: Rasoolany yatloo 'alaikum aayaatil laahi mubaiyinaatil liyukhrijal lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati minaz zulumaati ilan noor; wa many yu'mim billaahi wa ya;mal saalihany yudkhilhu jannaatin tajree min tahtihal anhaaru khaalideena feehaa abadan qad ahsanal laahu lahoo rizqqq

65.text: اللَّهُ الَّذِي خَلَقَ سَبْعَ سَمَاوَاتٍ وَمِنَ الْأَرْضِ مِثْلَهُنَّ يَتَنَزَّلُ الْأَمْرُ بَيْنَهُنَّ لِتَعْلَمُوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ قَدْ أَحَاطَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عِلْمًا
65.translation: It is Allah who has created seven heavens and of the earth, the like of them. [His] command descends among them so you may know that Allah is over all things competent and that Allah has encompassed all things in knowledge.
65.transliteration: Allaahul lazee khalaq Sab'a Samaawaatinw wa minal ardi mislahunna yatanazzalul amru bainahunna lita'lamooo annal laaha 'alaa kulli shai'in Qadeerunw wa annal laaha qad ahaata bikulli shai'in ilmaa

66.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ لِمَ تُحَرِّمُ مَا أَحَلَّ اللَّهُ لَكَ ۖ تَبْتَغِي مَرْضَاتَ أَزْوَاجِكَ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ
66.translation: O Prophet, why do you prohibit [yourself from] what Allah has made lawful for you, seeking the approval of your wives? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
66.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhan nabiyyu lima tuharrimu maaa ahallal laahu laka tabtaghee mardaata azwaajik; wallaahu ghafoorur raheem

66.text: قَدْ فَرَضَ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ تَحِلَّةَ أَيْمَانِكُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ مَوْلَاكُمْ ۖ وَهُوَ الْعَلِيمُ الْحَكِيمُ
66.translation: Allah has already ordained for you [Muslims] the dissolution of your oaths. And Allah is your protector, and He is the Knowing, the Wise.
66.transliteration: Qad faradal laahu lakum tahillata aymaanikum; wallaahu mawlaakum wa huwal'aleemul hakeem

66.text: وَإِذْ أَسَرَّ النَّبِيُّ إِلَىٰ بَعْضِ أَزْوَاجِهِ حَدِيثًا فَلَمَّا نَبَّأَتْ بِهِ وَأَظْهَرَهُ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ عَرَّفَ بَعْضَهُ وَأَعْرَضَ عَنْ بَعْضٍ ۖ فَلَمَّا نَبَّأَهَا بِهِ قَالَتْ مَنْ أَنْبَأَكَ هَٰذَا ۖ قَالَ نَبَّأَنِيَ الْعَلِيمُ الْخَبِيرُ
66.translation: And [remember] when the Prophet confided to one of his wives a statement; and when she informed [another] of it and Allah showed it to him, he made known part of it and ignored a part. And when he informed her about it, she said, "Who told you this?" He said, "I was informed by the Knowing, the Acquainted."
66.transliteration: Wa iz asarran nabiyyu ilaa ba'di azwaajihee hadeesan falammaa nabba at bihee wa azharahul laahu 'alaihi 'arrafa ba'dahoo wa a'rada 'am ba'din falammaa nabba ahaa bihee qaalat man amba aka haaza qaala nabba aniyal 'aleemul khabeer

66.text: إِنْ تَتُوبَا إِلَى اللَّهِ فَقَدْ صَغَتْ قُلُوبُكُمَا ۖ وَإِنْ تَظَاهَرَا عَلَيْهِ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ مَوْلَاهُ وَجِبْرِيلُ وَصَالِحُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ۖ وَالْمَلَائِكَةُ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ ظَهِيرٌ
66.translation: If you two [wives] repent to Allah, [it is best], for your hearts have deviated. But if you cooperate against him - then indeed Allah is his protector, and Gabriel and the righteous of the believers and the angels, moreover, are [his] assistants.
66.transliteration: In tatoobaaa ilal laahi faqad saghat quloobukumaa wa in tazaaharaa 'alihi fa innal laaha huwa mawlaahu wa jibreelu wa saalihul mu'mineen; walma laaa'ikatu ba'dazaalika zaheer

66.text: عَسَىٰ رَبُّهُ إِنْ طَلَّقَكُنَّ أَنْ يُبْدِلَهُ أَزْوَاجًا خَيْرًا مِنْكُنَّ مُسْلِمَاتٍ مُؤْمِنَاتٍ قَانِتَاتٍ تَائِبَاتٍ عَابِدَاتٍ سَائِحَاتٍ ثَيِّبَاتٍ وَأَبْكَارًا
66.translation: Perhaps his Lord, if he divorced you [all], would substitute for him wives better than you - submitting [to Allah], believing, devoutly obedient, repentant, worshipping, and traveling - [ones] previously married and virgins.
66.transliteration: 'Asaa rabbuhooo in tallaqakunna anyyubdilahooo azwaajan khairam mnkunna muslimaatim mu'minaatin qaanitaatin taaa'ibaatin 'aabidaatin saaa'ihaatin saiyibaatinw wa abkaaraa

66.text: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا قُوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ وَأَهْلِيكُمْ نَارًا وَقُودُهَا النَّاسُ وَالْحِجَارَةُ عَلَيْهَا مَلَائِكَةٌ غِلَاظٌ شِدَادٌ لَا يَعْصُونَ اللَّهَ مَا أَمَرَهُمْ وَيَفْعَلُونَ مَا يُؤْمَرُونَ
66.translation: O you who have believed, protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones, over which are [appointed] angels, harsh and severe; they do not disobey Allah in what He commands them but do what they are commanded.
66.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena samanoo qooo anfusakum wa ahleekum naaranw waqoodu han naasu wal hijaaratu 'alaihaa malaaa'ikatun ghilaazun shidaadul laa ya'soonal laaha maa amarahum wa yaf'aloona maa yu'maroon

66.text: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَا تَعْتَذِرُوا الْيَوْمَ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
66.translation: O you who have disbelieved, make no excuses that Day. You will only be recompensed for what you used to do.
66.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena kafaroo la ta'tazinul yawma innamaa tujzawna maa kuntum ta'maloon

66.text: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا تُوبُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ تَوْبَةً نَصُوحًا عَسَىٰ رَبُّكُمْ أَنْ يُكَفِّرَ عَنْكُمْ سَيِّئَاتِكُمْ وَيُدْخِلَكُمْ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ يَوْمَ لَا يُخْزِي اللَّهُ النَّبِيَّ وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مَعَهُ ۖ نُورُهُمْ يَسْعَىٰ بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَبِأَيْمَانِهِمْ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا أَتْمِمْ لَنَا نُورَنَا وَاغْفِرْ لَنَا ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
66.translation: O you who have believed, repent to Allah with sincere repentance. Perhaps your Lord will remove from you your misdeeds and admit you into gardens beneath which rivers flow [on] the Day when Allah will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believed with him. Their light will proceed before them and on their right; they will say, "Our Lord, perfect for us our light and forgive us. Indeed, You are over all things competent."
66.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aammano toobooo ilal laahi tawbatan nasoohan 'asaa rabbukum any-yukaffira 'ankum sayyi aatikum wa yudkhilakum jannaatin tajree min tahtihal anhaaru yawma laa yukhzil laahun nabiyya wallazeena aamanoo ma'ahoo nooruhum yas'aa baina aydeehim wa bi aymaanihim yaqooloona rabbanaaa atmim lanaa nooranaa waghfir lana innaka 'alaa kulli shai'in qadeer

66.text: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ جَاهِدِ الْكُفَّارَ وَالْمُنَافِقِينَ وَاغْلُظْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ وَمَأْوَاهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ
66.translation: O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be harsh upon them. And their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the destination.
66.transliteration: yaaa ayyuuhan nabiyyu jaahidil kuffaara walmunaa-fiqeena waghluz 'alaihim; wa maawaahum jahannamu wa bi'sal maseer

66.text: ضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا امْرَأَتَ نُوحٍ وَامْرَأَتَ لُوطٍ ۖ كَانَتَا تَحْتَ عَبْدَيْنِ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا صَالِحَيْنِ فَخَانَتَاهُمَا فَلَمْ يُغْنِيَا عَنْهُمَا مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيْئًا وَقِيلَ ادْخُلَا النَّارَ مَعَ الدَّاخِلِينَ
66.translation: Allah presents an example of those who disbelieved: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under two of Our righteous servants but betrayed them, so those prophets did not avail them from Allah at all, and it was said, "Enter the Fire with those who enter."
66.transliteration: Darabal laahu masalal lillazeena kafarum ra ata Noobinw wamra ata Loot, kaanataa tahta 'abdaini min 'ibaadinaa saalihaini fakhaanataahumaa falam yughniyaa 'anhumaa minal laahi shai anw-wa qeelad khulan naara ma'ad Daakhileen

66.text: وَضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا امْرَأَتَ فِرْعَوْنَ إِذْ قَالَتْ رَبِّ ابْنِ لِي عِنْدَكَ بَيْتًا فِي الْجَنَّةِ وَنَجِّنِي مِنْ فِرْعَوْنَ وَعَمَلِهِ وَنَجِّنِي مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
66.translation: And Allah presents an example of those who believed: the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, "My Lord, build for me near You a house in Paradise and save me from Pharaoh and his deeds and save me from the wrongdoing people."
66.transliteration: Wa darabal laahu masa lal-lillazeena aamanumra ata Fir'awn; iz qaalat rabbibni lee 'indaka baitan fil jannati wa najjinee min Fir'awna wa 'amalihii wa najjinee minal qawmiz zaalimeen

66.text: وَمَرْيَمَ ابْنَتَ عِمْرَانَ الَّتِي أَحْصَنَتْ فَرْجَهَا فَنَفَخْنَا فِيهِ مِنْ رُوحِنَا وَصَدَّقَتْ بِكَلِمَاتِ رَبِّهَا وَكُتُبِهِ وَكَانَتْ مِنَ الْقَانِتِينَ
66.translation: And [the example of] Mary, the daughter of 'Imran, who guarded her chastity, so We blew into [her garment] through Our angel, and she believed in the words of her Lord and His scriptures and was of the devoutly obedient.
66.transliteration: Wa Maryamab nata 'Imraanal lateee ahsanat farjahaa fanafakhnaa feehi mir roobinaa wa saddaqat bikali maati Rabbihaa wa Kutubihee wakaanat minal qaaniteen

67.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي بِيَدِهِ الْمُلْكُ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
67.translation: Blessed is He in whose hand is dominion, and He is over all things competent -
67.transliteration: Tabaarakal lazee biyadihil mulku wa huwa 'alaa kulli shai-in qadeer

67.text: الَّذِي خَلَقَ الْمَوْتَ وَالْحَيَاةَ لِيَبْلُوَكُمْ أَيُّكُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًا ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفُورُ
67.translation: [He] who created death and life to test you [as to] which of you is best in deed - and He is the Exalted in Might, the Forgiving -
67.transliteration: Allazee khalaqal mawta walhayaata liyabluwakum ayyukum ahsanu 'amalaa; wa huwal 'azeezul ghafoor

67.text: الَّذِي خَلَقَ سَبْعَ سَمَاوَاتٍ طِبَاقًا ۖ مَا تَرَىٰ فِي خَلْقِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ مِنْ تَفَاوُتٍ ۖ فَارْجِعِ الْبَصَرَ هَلْ تَرَىٰ مِنْ فُطُورٍ
67.translation: [And] who created seven heavens in layers. You do not see in the creation of the Most Merciful any inconsistency. So return [your] vision [to the sky]; do you see any breaks?
67.transliteration: Allazee khalaqa sab'a samaawaatin tibaaqam maa taraa fee khalqir rahmaani min tafaawutin farji'il basara hal taraa min futoor

67.text: ثُمَّ ارْجِعِ الْبَصَرَ كَرَّتَيْنِ يَنْقَلِبْ إِلَيْكَ الْبَصَرُ خَاسِئًا وَهُوَ حَسِيرٌ
67.translation: Then return [your] vision twice again. [Your] vision will return to you humbled while it is fatigued.
67.transliteration: Summar ji'il basara karrataini yanqalib ilaikal basaru khaasi'anw wa huwa haseer

67.text: وَلَقَدْ زَيَّنَّا السَّمَاءَ الدُّنْيَا بِمَصَابِيحَ وَجَعَلْنَاهَا رُجُومًا لِلشَّيَاطِينِ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لَهُمْ عَذَابَ السَّعِيرِ
67.translation: And We have certainly beautified the nearest heaven with stars and have made [from] them what is thrown at the devils and have prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze.
67.transliteration: Wa laqad zaiyannas samaaa'ad dunyaa bimasaa beeha wa ja'alnaahaa rujoomal lish shayaateeni wa a'tadnaa lahum 'azaabas sa'eer

67.text: وَلِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِرَبِّهِمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ وَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ
67.translation: And for those who disbelieved in their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and wretched is the destination.
67.transliteration: Wa lillazeena kafaroo bi rabbihim 'azaabu jahannama wa bi'sal maseer

67.text: إِذَا أُلْقُوا فِيهَا سَمِعُوا لَهَا شَهِيقًا وَهِيَ تَفُورُ
67.translation: When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a [dreadful] inhaling while it boils up.
67.transliteration: Izaaa ulqoo feehaa sami'oo lahaa shaheeqanw wa hiya tafoor

67.text: تَكَادُ تَمَيَّزُ مِنَ الْغَيْظِ ۖ كُلَّمَا أُلْقِيَ فِيهَا فَوْجٌ سَأَلَهُمْ خَزَنَتُهَا أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَذِيرٌ
67.translation: It almost bursts with rage. Every time a company is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, "Did there not come to you a warner?"
67.transliteration: Takaadu tamayyazu minal ghaizi kullamaaa uliqya feehaa fawjun sa alahum khazanatuhaaa alam yaatikum nazeer

67.text: قَالُوا بَلَىٰ قَدْ جَاءَنَا نَذِيرٌ فَكَذَّبْنَا وَقُلْنَا مَا نَزَّلَ اللَّهُ مِنْ شَيْءٍ إِنْ أَنْتُمْ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَالٍ كَبِيرٍ
67.translation: They will say," Yes, a warner had come to us, but we denied and said, 'Allah has not sent down anything. You are not but in great error.'"
67.transliteration: Qaaloo balaa qad jaaa'anaa nazeerun fakazzabnaa wa qulnaa maa nazzalal laahu min shai in in antum illaa fee dalaalin kabeer

67.text: وَقَالُوا لَوْ كُنَّا نَسْمَعُ أَوْ نَعْقِلُ مَا كُنَّا فِي أَصْحَابِ السَّعِيرِ
67.translation: And they will say, "If only we had been listening or reasoning, we would not be among the companions of the Blaze."
67.transliteration: Wa qaaloo law kunnaa nasma'u awna'qilu maa kunnaa feee as haabis sa'eer

67.text: فَاعْتَرَفُوا بِذَنْبِهِمْ فَسُحْقًا لِأَصْحَابِ السَّعِيرِ
67.translation: And they will admit their sin, so [it is] alienation for the companions of the Blaze.
67.transliteration: Fa'tarafoo bizambihim fasuhqal li as haabis sa'eer

67.text: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُمْ بِالْغَيْبِ لَهُمْ مَغْفِرَةٌ وَأَجْرٌ كَبِيرٌ
67.translation: Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen will have forgiveness and great reward.
67.transliteration: Innal lazeena yakhshawna rabbahum bilghaibi lahum maghfiratunw wa ajrun kabeer

67.text: وَأَسِرُّوا قَوْلَكُمْ أَوِ اجْهَرُوا بِهِ ۖ إِنَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ
67.translation: And conceal your speech or publicize it; indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
67.transliteration: Wa asirroo qawlakum awijharoo bihee innahoo 'aleemum bizaatis sudoor

67.text: أَلَا يَعْلَمُ مَنْ خَلَقَ وَهُوَ اللَّطِيفُ الْخَبِيرُ
67.translation: Does He who created not know, while He is the Subtle, the Acquainted?
67.transliteration: Alaa ya'lamu man khalaq wa huwal lateeful khabeer

67.text: هُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ ذَلُولًا فَامْشُوا فِي مَنَاكِبِهَا وَكُلُوا مِنْ رِزْقِهِ ۖ وَإِلَيْهِ النُّشُورُ
67.translation: It is He who made the earth tame for you - so walk among its slopes and eat of His provision - and to Him is the resurrection.
67.transliteration: Huwal lazee ja'ala lakumul arda zaloolan famshoo fee manaakibihaa wa kuloo mir rizqihee wa ilaihin nushoor

67.text: أَأَمِنْتُمْ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاءِ أَنْ يَخْسِفَ بِكُمُ الْأَرْضَ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَمُورُ
67.translation: Do you feel secure that He who [holds authority] in the heaven would not cause the earth to swallow you and suddenly it would sway?
67.transliteration: 'A-amintum man fissamaaa'i aiyakhsifa bi kumul arda fa izaa hiya tamoor

67.text: أَمْ أَمِنْتُمْ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاءِ أَنْ يُرْسِلَ عَلَيْكُمْ حَاصِبًا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ كَيْفَ نَذِيرِ
67.translation: Or do you feel secure that He who [holds authority] in the heaven would not send against you a storm of stones? Then you would know how [severe] was My warning.
67.transliteration: Am amintum man fissamaaa'i ai yursila 'alaikum haasiban fasata'lamoona kaifa nazeer

67.text: وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ
67.translation: And already had those before them denied, and how [terrible] was My reproach.
67.transliteration: Wa laqad kazzabal lazeena min qablihim fakaifa kaana nakeer

67.text: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا إِلَى الطَّيْرِ فَوْقَهُمْ صَافَّاتٍ وَيَقْبِضْنَ ۚ مَا يُمْسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا الرَّحْمَٰنُ ۚ إِنَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ بَصِيرٌ
67.translation: Do they not see the birds above them with wings outspread and [sometimes] folded in? None holds them [aloft] except the Most Merciful. Indeed He is, of all things, Seeing.
67.transliteration: Awalam yaraw ilat tairi fawqahum saaaffaatinw wa yaqbidn; maa yumsikuhunna illaar rahmaan; innahoo bikulli shai im baseer

67.text: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي هُوَ جُنْدٌ لَكُمْ يَنْصُرُكُمْ مِنْ دُونِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ ۚ إِنِ الْكَافِرُونَ إِلَّا فِي غُرُورٍ
67.translation: Or who is it that could be an army for you to aid you other than the Most Merciful? The disbelievers are not but in delusion.
67.transliteration: Amman haazal lazee huwa jundul lakum yansurukum min doonir rahmaan; inilkaafiroona illaa fee ghuroor

67.text: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي يَرْزُقُكُمْ إِنْ أَمْسَكَ رِزْقَهُ ۚ بَلْ لَجُّوا فِي عُتُوٍّ وَنُفُورٍ
67.translation: Or who is it that could provide for you if He withheld His provision? But they have persisted in insolence and aversion.
67.transliteration: Amman haazal lazee yarzuqukum in amsaka rizqah; bal lajjoo fee 'utuwwinw wa nufoor

67.text: أَفَمَنْ يَمْشِي مُكِبًّا عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهِ أَهْدَىٰ أَمَّنْ يَمْشِي سَوِيًّا عَلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ
67.translation: Then is one who walks fallen on his face better guided or one who walks erect on a straight path?
67.transliteration: Afamai yamshee mukibban 'alaa wajhihee ahdaaa ammany yamshee sawiyyan 'alaa siratim mustaqeem

67.text: قُلْ هُوَ الَّذِي أَنْشَأَكُمْ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ السَّمْعَ وَالْأَبْصَارَ وَالْأَفْئِدَةَ ۖ قَلِيلًا مَا تَشْكُرُونَ
67.translation: Say, "It is He who has produced you and made for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful."
67.transliteration: Qul huwal lazee ansha akum wa ja'ala lakumus sam'a wal absaara wal af'idata qaleelam maa tashkuroon

67.text: قُلْ هُوَ الَّذِي ذَرَأَكُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
67.translation: Say, "It is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered."
67.transliteration: Qul huwal lazee zara akum fil ardi wa ilaihi tuhsharoon

67.text: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
67.translation: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
67.transliteration: Wa yaqooloona mataa haazal wa'du in kuntum saadiqeen

67.text: قُلْ إِنَّمَا الْعِلْمُ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَا أَنَا نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ
67.translation: Say, "The knowledge is only with Allah, and I am only a clear warner."
67.transliteration: Qul innamal 'ilmu 'indallaahi wa innamaaa ana nazeerum mubeen

67.text: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهُ زُلْفَةً سِيئَتْ وُجُوهُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَقِيلَ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تَدَّعُونَ
67.translation: But when they see it approaching, the faces of those who disbelieve will be distressed, and it will be said, "This is that for which you used to call."
67.transliteration: Falaammaa ra-awhu zulfatan seee'at wujoohul lazeena kafaroo wa qeela haazal lazee kuntum bihee tadda'oon

67.text: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَهْلَكَنِيَ اللَّهُ وَمَنْ مَعِيَ أَوْ رَحِمَنَا فَمَنْ يُجِيرُ الْكَافِرِينَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
67.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "Have you considered: whether Allah should cause my death and those with me or have mercy upon us, who can protect the disbelievers from a painful punishment?"
67.transliteration: Qul ara'aytum in ahlaka niyal laahu wa mam ma'iya aw rahimanaa famai-yujeerul kaafireena min 'azaabin aleem

67.text: قُلْ هُوَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ آمَنَّا بِهِ وَعَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُبِينٍ
67.translation: Say, "He is the Most Merciful; we have believed in Him, and upon Him we have relied. And you will [come to] know who it is that is in clear error."
67.transliteration: Qul huwar rahmaanu aamannaa bihee wa 'alaihi tawakkalnaa fasata'lamoona man huwa fee dalaalim mubeen

67.text: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَصْبَحَ مَاؤُكُمْ غَوْرًا فَمَنْ يَأْتِيكُمْ بِمَاءٍ مَعِينٍ
67.translation: Say, "Have you considered: if your water was to become sunken [into the earth], then who could bring you flowing water?"
67.transliteration: Qul ara'aytum in asbaha maaa'ukum ghawran famai yaateekum bimaaa'im ma'een

68.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ ن ۚ وَالْقَلَمِ وَمَا يَسْطُرُونَ
68.translation: Nun. By the pen and what they inscribe,
You are not, [O Muhammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.
And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.
68.transliteration: Wa inna laka la ajran ghaira mamnoon

68.translation: And indeed, you are of a great moral character.
So you will see and they will see
Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].

68.text: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنْ ضَلَّ عَنْ سَبِيلِهِ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِالْمُهْتَدِينَ
68.translation: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
68.transliteration: Innaa Rabbaka Huwa a'lamu biman dalla 'an sabeelihee wa Huwa a'lamu bilmuhtadeen

68.translation: Then do not obey the deniers.
They wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [toward you].
And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer
68.transliteration: Wa laa tuti' kulla hallaa fim maheen

68.translation: [And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -
A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,
Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.
Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,

68.text: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ آيَاتُنَا قَالَ أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
68.translation: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
68.transliteration: Izaa tutlaa 'alaihi aayaatunaa qaala asaateerul awwaleen

68.translation: We will brand him upon the snout.

68.text: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَاهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَا أَصْحَابَ الْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
68.translation: Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning
68.transliteration: Innaa balawnaahum kamaa balawnaaa As-haabal jannati iz 'aqsamoo la-yasri munnahaa musbiheen

68.translation: Without making exception.

68.text: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَائِفٌ مِنْ رَبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَائِمُونَ
68.translation: So there came upon the garden an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep.
68.transliteration: Fataafa 'alaihaa taaa'i fum mir rabbika wa hum naaa'imoon

68.translation: And it became as though reaped.
And they called one another at morning,

68.text: أَنِ اغْدُوا عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَارِمِينَ
68.translation: [Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."
So they set out, while lowering their voices,

68.text: أَنْ لَا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا الْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُمْ مِسْكِينٌ
68.translation: [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."
And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.
But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;
68.transliteration: Falammaa ra awhaa qaalooo innaa ladaaalloon

68.translation: Rather, we have been deprived."

68.text: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُلْ لَكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
68.translation: The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [Allah]?' "
68.transliteration: Qaala awsatuhum alam aqul lakum law laa tusabbihoon

68.text: قَالُوا سُبْحَانَ رَبِّنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ
68.translation: They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
68.transliteration: Qaaloo subhaana rabbinaaa innaa kunnaa zaalimeen

68.translation: Then they approached one another, blaming each other.

68.text: قَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا طَاغِينَ
68.translation: They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.
68.transliteration: Qaaloo yaa wailanaaa innaa kunnaa taagheen

68.text: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَا أَنْ يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِنْهَا إِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَاغِبُونَ
68.translation: Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."
68.transliteration: 'Asaa rabbunaaa any yubdilanaa khairam minhaaa innaaa ilaa rabbinaa raaghiboon

68.text: كَذَٰلِكَ الْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ الْآخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا يَعْلَمُونَ
68.translation: Such is the punishment [of this world]. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
68.transliteration: Kazaalikal azaab, wa la'azaabul aakhirati akbar; law kaanoo ya'lamoon

68.text: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ
68.translation: Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the Gardens of Pleasure.
Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?
What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?
Or do you have a scripture in which you learn
That indeed for you is whatever you choose?

68.text: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَانٌ عَلَيْنَا بَالِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
68.translation: Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us, extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you is whatever you judge?
68.transliteration: Am lakum aymaanun 'alainaa baalighatun ilaa yawmil qiyaamati inna lakum lamaa tahkumoon

68.translation: Ask them which of them, for that [claim], is responsible.

68.text: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَاءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا بِشُرَكَائِهِمْ إِنْ كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ
68.translation: Or do they have partners? Then let them bring their partners, if they should be truthful.
68.transliteration: Am lahum shurakaaa'u falyaatoo bishurakaaa 'ihim in kaanoo saadiqeen

68.text: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَنْ سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى السُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
68.translation: The Day the shin will be uncovered and they are invited to prostration but the disbelievers will not be able,
68.transliteration: Yawma yukshafu 'am saaqinw wa yud'awna ilas sujoodi falaa yastatee'oon

68.text: خَاشِعَةً أَبْصَارُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى السُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَالِمُونَ
68.translation: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.
68.transliteration: Khaashi'atan absaaruhum tarhaquhum zillatunw wa qad kaanoo yud'awna ilassujoodi wa hum saalimoon

68.text: فَذَرْنِي وَمَنْ يُكَذِّبُ بِهَٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُمْ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
68.translation: So leave Me, [O Muhammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies the Qur'an. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.
68.transliteration: Fazarnee wa many yukazzibu bihaazal hadeesi sanastad rijuhum min haisu laa ya'lamoon

68.translation: And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.
68.transliteration: Wa umlee lahum; inna kaidee mateen

68.text: أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُمْ مِنْ مَغْرَمٍ مُثْقَلُونَ
68.translation: Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
68.transliteration: Am tas'aluhum ajran fahum mim maghramim musqaloon

68.translation: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?

68.text: فَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُنْ كَصَاحِبِ الْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
68.translation: Then be patient for the decision of your Lord, [O Muhammad], and be not like the companion of the fish when he called out while he was distressed.
68.transliteration: Fasbir lihkmi rabbika wa laa takun kasaahibil boot; iz naadaa wa huwa makzoom

68.text: لَوْلَا أَنْ تَدَارَكَهُ نِعْمَةٌ مِنْ رَبِّهِ لَنُبِذَ بِالْعَرَاءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
68.translation: If not that a favor from his Lord overtook him, he would have been thrown onto the naked shore while he was censured.
68.transliteration: Law laaa an tadaara kahoo ni'matum mir rabbihee lanubiza bil'araaa'i wa huwa mazmoom

68.translation: And his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.

68.text: وَإِنْ يَكَادُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَارِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا الذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُ لَمَجْنُونٌ
68.translation: And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."
68.transliteration: Wa iny-yakaadul lazeena kafaroo la-yuzliqoonaka biabsaarihim lammaa saml'uz-Zikra wa yaqooloona innahoo lamajnoon

68.translation: But it is not except a reminder to the worlds.
68.transliteration: Wa maa huwa illaa zikrul lil'aalameen

69.translation: The Inevitable Reality -
What is the Inevitable Reality?
And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?
Thamud and 'Aad denied the Striking Calamity.
So as for Thamud, they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].

69.text: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ
69.translation: And as for 'Aad, they were destroyed by a screaming, violent wind
69.transliteration: Wa ammaa 'Aadun fa uhlikoo bireehin sarsarin 'aatiyah

69.text: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَانِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى الْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ
69.translation: Which Allah imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
69.transliteration: Sakhkharahaa 'alaihim sab'a la yaalinw wa samaaniyata ayyaamin husooman fataral qawma feehaa sar'aa ka annahum a'jaazu nakhlin khaawiyah

69.translation: Then do you see of them any remains?

69.text: وَجَاءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَنْ قَبْلَهُ وَالْمُؤْتَفِكَاتُ بِالْخَاطِئَةِ
69.translation: And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities with sin.
69.transliteration: Wa jaaa'a Firawnu wa man qablahoo wal mu'tafikaatu bilhaati'ah

69.text: فَعَصَوْا رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَابِيَةً
69.translation: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].
69.transliteration: Fa'ansaw Rasoola Rabbihim fa akhazahum akhzatar raabiyah

69.text: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَى الْمَاءُ حَمَلْنَاكُمْ فِي الْجَارِيَةِ
69.translation: Indeed, when the water overflowed, We carried your ancestors in the sailing ship
69.transliteration: Innaa lammaa taghal maaa'u hamalnaakum fil jaariyah

69.text: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَا أُذُنٌ وَاعِيَةٌ
69.translation: That We might make it for you a reminder and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.
69.transliteration: Linaj'alahaa lakum tazki ratanw-wa ta'iyahaa unzununw waa'iyah

69.text: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ
69.translation: Then when the Horn is blown with one blast
69.transliteration: Fa izaa nufikha fis soori nafkhatunw waahidah

69.text: وَحُمِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَاحِدَةً
69.translation: And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow -
69.transliteration: Wa humilatil ardu wal jibaalu fadukkataa dakkatanw waahidah

69.translation: Then on that Day, the Resurrection will occur,
And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is infirm.

69.text: وَالْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰ أَرْجَائِهَا ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَانِيَةٌ
69.translation: And the angels are at its edges. And there will bear the Throne of your Lord above them, that Day, eight [of them].
69.transliteration: Wal malaku 'alaaa arjaaa'ihaa; wa yahmilu 'Arsha Rabbika fawqahum yawma'izin samaaniyah

69.text: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنْكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ
69.translation: That Day, you will be exhibited [for judgement]; not hidden among you is anything concealed.
69.transliteration: Yawma'izin tu'radoona laa takhfaa min kum khaafiyah

69.text: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِيَمِينِهِ فَيَقُولُ هَاؤُمُ اقْرَءُوا كِتَابِيَهْ
69.translation: So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!
69.transliteration: Fa ammaa man ootiya kitaabahoo biyameenihee fa yaqoolu haaa'umuq ra'oo kitaabiyah

69.translation: Indeed, I was certain that I would be meeting my account."
So he will be in a pleasant life -
In an elevated garden,
Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near.

69.text: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِي الْأَيَّامِ الْخَالِيَةِ
69.translation: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth in the days past."
69.transliteration: Kuloo washraboo haneee'am bimaaa aslaftum fil ayyaamil khaliyah

69.text: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِشِمَالِهِ فَيَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَابِيَهْ
69.translation: But as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record
69.transliteration: Wa ammaa man ootiya kitaabahoo bishimaalihee fa yaqoolu yaalaitanee lam oota kitaaabiyah

69.translation: And had not known what is my account.
I wish my death had been the decisive one.
My wealth has not availed me.
Gone from me is my authority."
[Allah will say], "Seize him and shackle him.
Then into Hellfire drive him.

69.text: ثُمَّ فِي سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَاسْلُكُوهُ
69.translation: Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him."
69.transliteration: Summa fee silsilatin zar'uhaa sab'oona ziraa'an faslukooh

69.text: إِنَّهُ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ
69.translation: Indeed, he did not used to believe in Allah, the Most Great,
Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.
So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend
Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;
69.transliteration: Wa laa ta'aamun illaa min ghisleen

69.translation: None will eat it except the sinners.
So I swear by what you see
And what you do not see
[That] indeed, the Qur'an is the word of a noble Messenger.

69.text: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَا تُؤْمِنُونَ
69.translation: And it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe.
69.transliteration: Wa ma huwa biqawli shaa'ir; qaleelam maa tu'minoon

69.text: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
69.translation: Nor the word of a soothsayer; little do you remember.
69.transliteration: Wa laa biqawli kaahin; qaleelam maa tazakkaroon

69.translation: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
And if Muhammad had made up about Us some [false] sayings,
We would have seized him by the right hand;
Then We would have cut from him the aorta.

69.text: فَمَا مِنْكُمْ مِنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَاجِزِينَ
69.translation: And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.
And indeed, the Qur'an is a reminder for the righteous.
And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.
69.transliteration: Wa inna lana'lamu anna minkum mukazzibeen

69.translation: And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.
And indeed, it is the truth of certainty.
So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

70.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ سَأَلَ سَائِلٌ بِعَذَابٍ وَاقِعٍ
70.translation: A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen
To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer.
[It is] from Allah, owner of the ways of ascent.

70.text: تَعْرُجُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَالرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِي يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ
70.translation: The angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.
70.transliteration: Ta'rujul malaaa'ikatu war Roohu ilaihi fee yawmin kaana miqdaaruhoo khamseena alfa sanah

70.translation: So be patient with gracious patience.
Indeed, they see it [as] distant,
But We see it [as] near.
On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,
And the mountains will be like wool,
And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,

70.text: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمْ ۚ يَوَدُّ الْمُجْرِمُ لَوْ يَفْتَدِي مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمِئِذٍ بِبَنِيهِ
70.translation: They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children
70.transliteration: Yubassaroonahum; ya waddul mujrimu law yaftadee min 'azaabi yawma'izim bibaneeh

70.translation: And his wife and his brother
And his nearest kindred who shelter him

70.text: وَمَنْ فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يُنْجِيهِ
70.translation: And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.
70.transliteration: Wa man fil ardi jamee'an summa yunjeeh

70.translation: No! Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],
A remover of exteriors.
It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]
And collected [wealth] and hoarded.
Indeed, mankind was created anxious:
When evil touches him, impatient,
And when good touches him, withholding [of it],
Except the observers of prayer -
Those who are constant in their prayer
And those within whose wealth is a known right
For the petitioner and the deprived -
And those who believe in the Day of Recompense

70.text: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ مِنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِمْ مُشْفِقُونَ
70.translation: And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord -
Indeed, the punishment of their Lord is not that from which one is safe -
And those who guard their private parts

70.text: إِلَّا عَلَىٰ أَزْوَاجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ
70.translation: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they are not to be blamed -
70.transliteration: Illaa 'alaaa azwaajihim aw maa malakat aymaanuhum fainnahum ghairu maloomeen

70.text: فَمَنِ ابْتَغَىٰ وَرَاءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْعَادُونَ
70.translation: But whoever seeks beyond that, then they are the transgressors -
70.transliteration: Famanib taghaa waraaa'a zaalika fa ulaaa'ika humul 'aadoon

70.translation: And those who are to their trusts and promises attentive
70.transliteration: Wallazeena hum li amaa naatihim wa 'ahdihim raa'oon

70.translation: And those who are in their testimonies upright
And those who [carefully] maintain their prayer:
They will be in gardens, honored.
So what is [the matter] with those who disbelieve, hastening [from] before you, [O Muhammad],
70.transliteration: Famaa lil lazeena kafaroo qibalaka muhti'een

70.translation: [To sit] on [your] right and [your] left in separate groups?

70.text: أَيَطْمَعُ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ مِنْهُمْ أَنْ يُدْخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٍ
70.translation: Does every person among them aspire to enter a garden of pleasure?
70.transliteration: Ayatma'u kullum ri'im minhum anyyudkhala jannata Na'eem

70.translation: No! Indeed, We have created them from that which they know.
70.transliteration: Kallaaa innaa khalaq nahum mimmaa ya'lamoon

70.text: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِرَبِّ الْمَشَارِقِ وَالْمَغَارِبِ إِنَّا لَقَادِرُونَ
70.translation: So I swear by the Lord of [all] risings and settings that indeed We are able
70.transliteration: Falaaa uqsimu bi Rabbil mashaariqi wal maghaaribi innaa laqaadiroon

70.text: عَلَىٰ أَنْ نُبَدِّلَ خَيْرًا مِنْهُمْ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
70.translation: To replace them with better than them; and We are not to be outdone.
70.transliteration: 'Alaaa an nubaddila khairam minhum wa maa Nahnu bimasbooqeen

70.text: فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا وَيَلْعَبُوا حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
70.translation: So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised -
70.transliteration: Fazarhum yakhoodoo wa yal'aboo hattaa yulaaqoo yaw mahumul lazee yoo'adoon

70.text: يَوْمَ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ سِرَاعًا كَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٍ يُوفِضُونَ
70.translation: The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.
70.transliteration: Yawma yakhrujoona minal ajdaasi siraa'an ka anna hum ilaa nusubiny yoofidoon

70.text: خَاشِعَةً أَبْصَارُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمُ الَّذِي كَانُوا يُوعَدُونَ
70.translation: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. That is the Day which they had been promised.
70.transliteration: Khaashi'atan absaaruhum tarhaquhum zillah; zaalikal yawmul lazee kaanoo yoo'adoon

71.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ أَنْ أَنْذِرْ قَوْمَكَ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ يَأْتِيَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
71.translation: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment."
71.transliteration: Innaaa arsalnaa Noohan ilaa qawmihee an anzir qawmaka min qabli any yaatiyahum 'azaabun aleem

71.text: قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ إِنِّي لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ
71.translation: He said, "O my people, indeed I am to you a clear warner,
71.transliteration: Qaala yaa qawmi innee lakum nazeerum mubeen

71.text: أَنِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ وَاتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ
71.translation: [Saying], 'Worship Allah, fear Him and obey me.
71.transliteration: Ani'udul laaha watta qoohu wa atee'oon

71.text: يَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ مِنْ ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرْكُمْ إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ اللَّهِ إِذَا جَاءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُ ۖ لَوْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
71.translation: Allah will forgive you of your sins and delay you for a specified term. Indeed, the time [set by] Allah, when it comes, will not be delayed, if you only knew.' "
71.transliteration: Yaghfir lakum min zunoobikum wa yu'akhkhirkum ilaaa ajalim musammaa; innaa ajalal laahi izaa jaaa'a laa yu'akhkhar; law kuntum ta'lamoon

71.text: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي دَعَوْتُ قَوْمِي لَيْلًا وَنَهَارًا
71.translation: He said, "My Lord, indeed I invited my people [to truth] night and day.
71.transliteration: Qaala rabbi innee da'awtu qawmee lailanw wa naharaa

71.text: فَلَمْ يَزِدْهُمْ دُعَائِي إِلَّا فِرَارًا
71.translation: But my invitation increased them not except in flight.
71.transliteration: Falam yazid hum du'aaa 'eee illaa firaaraa

71.text: وَإِنِّي كُلَّمَا دَعَوْتُهُمْ لِتَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ جَعَلُوا أَصَابِعَهُمْ فِي آذَانِهِمْ وَاسْتَغْشَوْا ثِيَابَهُمْ وَأَصَرُّوا وَاسْتَكْبَرُوا اسْتِكْبَارًا
71.translation: And indeed, every time I invited them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their garments, persisted, and were arrogant with [great] arrogance.
71.transliteration: Wa inee kullamaa da'awtuhum litaghfira lahum ja'alooo asaabi'ahum fee aazaanihim wastaghshaw siyaabahum wa asaarroo wastakbarus tikbaaraa

71.text: ثُمَّ إِنِّي دَعَوْتُهُمْ جِهَارًا
71.translation: Then I invited them publicly.
71.transliteration: Summa innee da'aw tuhum jihaara

71.text: ثُمَّ إِنِّي أَعْلَنْتُ لَهُمْ وَأَسْرَرْتُ لَهُمْ إِسْرَارًا
71.translation: Then I announced to them and [also] confided to them secretly
71.transliteration: Summaa inneee a'lantu lahum wa asrartu lahum israaraa

71.text: فَقُلْتُ اسْتَغْفِرُوا رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُ كَانَ غَفَّارًا
71.translation: And said, 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord. Indeed, He is ever a Perpetual Forgiver.
71.transliteration: Faqultus taghfiroo Rabakam innahoo kaana Ghaffaaraa

71.text: يُرْسِلِ السَّمَاءَ عَلَيْكُمْ مِدْرَارًا
71.translation: He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in [continuing] showers
71.transliteration: Yursilis samaaa'a 'alaikum midraaraa

71.text: وَيُمْدِدْكُمْ بِأَمْوَالٍ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجْعَلْ لَكُمْ جَنَّاتٍ وَيَجْعَلْ لَكُمْ أَنْهَارًا
71.translation: And give you increase in wealth and children and provide for you gardens and provide for you rivers.
71.transliteration: Wa yumdidkum bi am waalinw wa baneena wa yaj'al lakum Jannaatinw wa yaj'al lakum anhaaraa

71.text: مَا لَكُمْ لَا تَرْجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارًا
71.translation: What is [the matter] with you that you do not attribute to Allah [due] grandeur
71.transliteration: Maa lakum laa tarjoona lillaahi waqaaraa

71.text: وَقَدْ خَلَقَكُمْ أَطْوَارًا
71.translation: While He has created you in stages?
71.transliteration: Wa qad khalaqakum at waaraa

71.text: أَلَمْ تَرَوْا كَيْفَ خَلَقَ اللَّهُ سَبْعَ سَمَاوَاتٍ طِبَاقًا
71.translation: Do you not consider how Allah has created seven heavens in layers
71.transliteration: Alam taraw kaifa khalaqal laahu sab'a samaawaatin tibaaqaa

71.text: وَجَعَلَ الْقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورًا وَجَعَلَ الشَّمْسَ سِرَاجًا
71.translation: And made the moon therein a [reflected] light and made the sun a burning lamp?
71.transliteration: Wa ja'alal qamara feehinna nooranw wa ja'alash shamsa siraajaa

71.text: وَاللَّهُ أَنْبَتَكُمْ مِنَ الْأَرْضِ نَبَاتًا
71.translation: And Allah has caused you to grow from the earth a [progressive] growth.
71.transliteration: Wallaahu ambatakum minal ardi nabaataa

71.text: ثُمَّ يُعِيدُكُمْ فِيهَا وَيُخْرِجُكُمْ إِخْرَاجًا
71.translation: Then He will return you into it and extract you [another] extraction.
71.transliteration: Summa yu'eedukum feehaa wa ukhrijukum ikhraajaa

71.text: وَاللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ بِسَاطًا
71.translation: And Allah has made for you the earth an expanse
71.transliteration: Wallaahu ja'ala lakumul arda bisaataa

71.text: لِتَسْلُكُوا مِنْهَا سُبُلًا فِجَاجًا
71.translation: That you may follow therein roads of passage.' "
71.transliteration: Litaslukoo minhaa subulan fijaajaa

71.text: قَالَ نُوحٌ رَبِّ إِنَّهُمْ عَصَوْنِي وَاتَّبَعُوا مَنْ لَمْ يَزِدْهُ مَالُهُ وَوَلَدُهُ إِلَّا خَسَارًا
71.translation: Noah said, "My Lord, indeed they have disobeyed me and followed him whose wealth and children will not increase him except in loss.
71.transliteration: Qaala Noohur Robbi innahum 'asawnee wattaba'oo mal lam yazid hu maaluhoo wa waladuhooo illaa khasaara

71.text: وَمَكَرُوا مَكْرًا كُبَّارًا
71.translation: And they conspired an immense conspiracy.
71.transliteration: Wa makaroo makran kubbaaraa

71.text: وَقَالُوا لَا تَذَرُنَّ آلِهَتَكُمْ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدًّا وَلَا سُوَاعًا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسْرًا
71.translation: And said, 'Never leave your gods and never leave Wadd or Suwa' or Yaghuth and Ya'uq and Nasr.
71.transliteration: Wa qaaloo laa tazarunna aalihatakum wa laa tazarunna Waddanw wa laa Suwaa'anw wa laa Yaghoosa wa Ya'ooqa wa Nasraa

71.text: وَقَدْ أَضَلُّوا كَثِيرًا ۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ الظَّالِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَالًا
71.translation: And already they have misled many. And, [my Lord], do not increase the wrongdoers except in error."
71.transliteration: Wa qad adalloo kasee ranw wa laa tazidiz zaalimeena illaa dalaalaa

71.text: مِمَّا خَطِيئَاتِهِمْ أُغْرِقُوا فَأُدْخِلُوا نَارًا فَلَمْ يَجِدُوا لَهُمْ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ أَنْصَارًا
71.translation: Because of their sins they were drowned and put into the Fire, and they found not for themselves besides Allah [any] helpers.
71.transliteration: Mimmaa khateee' aatihim ughriqoo fa udkhiloo Naaran falam yajidoo lahum min doonil laahi ansaaraa

71.text: وَقَالَ نُوحٌ رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ دَيَّارًا
71.translation: And Noah said, "My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from among the disbelievers an inhabitant.
71.transliteration: Wa qaala Noohur Rabbi laa tazar 'alal ardi minal kaafireena daiyaaraa

71.text: إِنَّكَ إِنْ تَذَرْهُمْ يُضِلُّوا عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوا إِلَّا فَاجِرًا كَفَّارًا
71.translation: Indeed, if You leave them, they will mislead Your servants and not beget except [every] wicked one and [confirmed] disbeliever.
71.transliteration: Innaka in tazarhum yudil loo 'ibaadaka wa laa yalidooo illaa faajiran kaffaaraa

71.text: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِوَالِدَيَّ وَلِمَنْ دَخَلَ بَيْتِيَ مُؤْمِنًا وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ وَلَا تَزِدِ الظَّالِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارًا
71.translation: My Lord, forgive me and my parents and whoever enters my house a believer and the believing men and believing women. And do not increase the wrongdoers except in destruction."
71.transliteration: Rabbigh fir lee wa liwaa lidaiya wa liman dakhala baitiya mu'minanw wa lil mu'mineena wal mu'minaati wa laa tazidiz zaalimeena illaa tabaaraa

72.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ أَنَّهُ اسْتَمَعَ نَفَرٌ مِنَ الْجِنِّ فَقَالُوا إِنَّا سَمِعْنَا قُرْآنًا عَجَبًا
72.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "It has been revealed to me that a group of the jinn listened and said, 'Indeed, we have heard an amazing Qur'an.
72.transliteration: Qul oohiya ilaiya annna hustama'a nafarum minal jinnni faqaalooo innaa sami'naa quraanan 'ajabaa

72.text: يَهْدِي إِلَى الرُّشْدِ فَآمَنَّا بِهِ ۖ وَلَنْ نُشْرِكَ بِرَبِّنَا أَحَدًا
72.translation: It guides to the right course, and we have believed in it. And we will never associate with our Lord anyone.
72.transliteration: Yahdeee ilar rushdi fa aamannaa bihee wa lan nushrika bi rabbinaaa ahadaa

72.text: وَأَنَّهُ تَعَالَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا اتَّخَذَ صَاحِبَةً وَلَا وَلَدًا
72.translation: And [it teaches] that exalted is the nobleness of our Lord; He has not taken a wife or a son
72.transliteration: Wa annahoo Ta'aalaa jaddu Rabbinaa mat takhaza saahibatanw wa la waladaa

72.text: وَأَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى اللَّهِ شَطَطًا
72.translation: And that our foolish one has been saying about Allah an excessive transgression.
72.transliteration: Wa annahoo kaana yaqoolu safeehunaa 'alal laahi shatataa

72.text: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّا أَنْ لَنْ تَقُولَ الْإِنْسُ وَالْجِنُّ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا
72.translation: And we had thought that mankind and the jinn would never speak about Allah a lie.
72.transliteration: Wa annaa zanannaaa al lan taqoolal insu wal jinnu 'alal laahi kazibaa

72.text: وَأَنَّهُ كَانَ رِجَالٌ مِنَ الْإِنْسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٍ مِنَ الْجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمْ رَهَقًا
72.translation: And there were men from mankind who sought refuge in men from the jinn, so they [only] increased them in burden.
72.transliteration: Wa annahoo kaana rijaa lum minal insi ya'oozoona birijaalim minal jinni fazaa doohum rahaqaa

72.text: وَأَنَّهُمْ ظَنُّوا كَمَا ظَنَنْتُمْ أَنْ لَنْ يَبْعَثَ اللَّهُ أَحَدًا
72.translation: And they had thought, as you thought, that Allah would never send anyone [as a messenger].
72.transliteration: Wa annahum zannoo kamaa zanantum al lany yab'asal laahu ahadaa

72.text: وَأَنَّا لَمَسْنَا السَّمَاءَ فَوَجَدْنَاهَا مُلِئَتْ حَرَسًا شَدِيدًا وَشُهُبًا
72.translation: And we have sought [to reach] the heaven but found it filled with powerful guards and burning flames.
72.transliteration: Wa annaa lamasnas sa maaa'a fa wajadnaahaa muli'at harasan shadeedanw wa shuhubaa

72.text: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقْعُدُ مِنْهَا مَقَاعِدَ لِلسَّمْعِ ۖ فَمَنْ يَسْتَمِعِ الْآنَ يَجِدْ لَهُ شِهَابًا رَصَدًا
72.translation: And we used to sit therein in positions for hearing, but whoever listens now will find a burning flame lying in wait for him.
72.transliteration: Wa annaa kunnaa naq'udu minhaa maqaa'ida lis'sam'i famany yastami'il aana yajid lahoo shihaabar rasada

72.text: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدْرِي أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَنْ فِي الْأَرْضِ أَمْ أَرَادَ بِهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًا
72.translation: And we do not know [therefore] whether evil is intended for those on earth or whether their Lord intends for them a right course.
72.transliteration: Wa annaa laa nadreee asharrun ureeda biman fil ardi am araada bihim rabbuhum rashadaa

72.text: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا الصَّالِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ كُنَّا طَرَائِقَ قِدَدًا
72.translation: And among us are the righteous, and among us are [others] not so; we were [of] divided ways.
72.transliteration: Wa annaa minnas saalihoona wa minnaa doona zaalika kunnaa taraaa'ilqa qidadaa

72.text: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّا أَنْ لَنْ نُعْجِزَ اللَّهَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَنْ نُعْجِزَهُ هَرَبًا
72.translation: And we have become certain that we will never cause failure to Allah upon earth, nor can we escape Him by flight.
72.transliteration: Wa annaa zanannaaa al lan nu'jizal laaha fil ardi wa lan nu'jizahoo harabaa

72.text: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعْنَا الْهُدَىٰ آمَنَّا بِهِ ۖ فَمَنْ يُؤْمِنْ بِرَبِّهِ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخْسًا وَلَا رَهَقًا
72.translation: And when we heard the guidance, we believed in it. And whoever believes in his Lord will not fear deprivation or burden.
72.transliteration: Wa annaa lammaa sami'nal hudaaa aamannaa bihee famany yu'mim bi rabbihee falaa yakhaafu bakhsanw wa laa rahaqaa

72.text: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا الْمُسْلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا الْقَاسِطُونَ ۖ فَمَنْ أَسْلَمَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ تَحَرَّوْا رَشَدًا
72.translation: And among us are Muslims [in submission to Allah], and among us are the unjust. And whoever has become Muslim - those have sought out the right course.
72.transliteration: Wa annaa minnal muslimoona wa minnal qaasitoona faman aslama fa ulaaa'ika taharraw rashadaa

72.text: وَأَمَّا الْقَاسِطُونَ فَكَانُوا لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبًا
72.translation: But as for the unjust, they will be, for Hell, firewood.'
72.transliteration: Wa ammal qaasitoona fa kaanoo li jahannama hatabaa

72.text: وَأَنْ لَوِ اسْتَقَامُوا عَلَى الطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسْقَيْنَاهُمْ مَاءً غَدَقًا
72.translation: And [Allah revealed] that if they had remained straight on the way, We would have given them abundant provision
72.transliteration: Wa alla wis taqaamoo 'alat tareeqati la asqaynaahum maa'an ghadaqaa

72.text: لِنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ ۚ وَمَنْ يُعْرِضْ عَنْ ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِ يَسْلُكْهُ عَذَابًا صَعَدًا
72.translation: So We might test them therein. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord He will put into arduous punishment.
72.transliteration: Linaftinahum feeh; wa many yu'rid 'an zikri rabbihee yasluk hu 'azaaban sa'adaa

72.text: وَأَنَّ الْمَسَاجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدْعُوا مَعَ اللَّهِ أَحَدًا
72.translation: And [He revealed] that the masjids are for Allah, so do not invoke with Allah anyone.
72.transliteration: Wa annal masaajida lillaahi falaa tad'oo ma'al laahi ahadaa

72.text: وَأَنَّهُ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ يَدْعُوهُ كَادُوا يَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِ لِبَدًا
72.translation: And that when the Servant of Allah stood up supplicating Him, they almost became about him a compacted mass."
72.transliteration: Wa annahoo lammaa qaama 'adul laahi yad'oohu kaadoo yakoonoona 'alaihi libadaa

72.text: قُلْ إِنَّمَا أَدْعُو رَبِّي وَلَا أُشْرِكُ بِهِ أَحَدًا
72.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "I only invoke my Lord and do not associate with Him anyone."
72.transliteration: Qul innamaaa ad'oo rabbee wa laaa ushriku biheee ahadaa

72.text: قُلْ إِنِّي لَا أَمْلِكُ لَكُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا رَشَدًا
72.translation: Say, "Indeed, I do not possess for you [the power of] harm or right direction."
72.transliteration: Qul innee laaa amliku lakum darranw wa laa rashadaa

72.text: قُلْ إِنِّي لَنْ يُجِيرَنِي مِنَ اللَّهِ أَحَدٌ وَلَنْ أَجِدَ مِنْ دُونِهِ مُلْتَحَدًا
72.translation: Say, "Indeed, there will never protect me from Allah anyone [if I should disobey], nor will I find in other than Him a refuge.
72.transliteration: Qul innee lany yujeeranee minal laahi ahad, wa lan ajida min doonihee multahadaa

72.text: إِلَّا بَلَاغًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَرِسَالَاتِهِ ۚ وَمَنْ يَعْصِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ فَإِنَّ لَهُ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا
72.translation: But [I have for you] only notification from Allah, and His messages." And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger - then indeed, for him is the fire of Hell; they will abide therein forever.
72.transliteration: Illaa balaagham minal laahi wa risaalaatih; wa many ya'sil laaha wa rasoolahoo fa inna lahoo naara jahannama khaalideena feehaaa abadaa

72.text: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا رَأَوْا مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَضْعَفُ نَاصِرًا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدًا
72.translation: [The disbelievers continue] until, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who is weaker in helpers and less in number.
72.transliteration: Hattaaa izaa ra aw maa yoo'adoona fasaya'lamoona man ad'afu naasiranw wa aqallu 'adadaa

72.text: قُلْ إِنْ أَدْرِي أَقَرِيبٌ مَا تُوعَدُونَ أَمْ يَجْعَلُ لَهُ رَبِّي أَمَدًا
72.translation: Say, "I do not know if what you are promised is near or if my Lord will grant for it a [long] period."
72.transliteration: Qul in adreee a qareebum maa too'adoona am yaj'alu lahoo rabbeee amadaa

72.text: عَالِمُ الْغَيْبِ فَلَا يُظْهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيْبِهِ أَحَدًا
72.translation: [He is] Knower of the unseen, and He does not disclose His [knowledge of the] unseen to anyone
72.transliteration: 'Aalimul ghaibi falaa yuzhiru alaa ghaibiheee ahadaa

72.text: إِلَّا مَنِ ارْتَضَىٰ مِنْ رَسُولٍ فَإِنَّهُ يَسْلُكُ مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِ رَصَدًا
72.translation: Except whom He has approved of messengers, and indeed, He sends before each messenger and behind him observers
72.transliteration: Illaa manir tadaa mir rasoolin fa innahoo yasluku mim baini yadihi wa min khalfihee rasadaa

72.text: لِيَعْلَمَ أَنْ قَدْ أَبْلَغُوا رِسَالَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ وَأَحْصَىٰ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ عَدَدًا
72.translation: That he may know that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord; and He has encompassed whatever is with them and has enumerated all things in number.
72.transliteration: Liya'lama an qad ablaghoo risaalaati rabbihim wa ahaata bima ladihim wa ahsaa kulla shai'in 'adadaa

73.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمُزَّمِّلُ
73.translation: O you who wraps himself [in clothing],
73.transliteration: Yaw ayyuhal muzzammil

73.text: قُمِ اللَّيْلَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا
73.translation: Arise [to pray] the night, except for a little -
73.transliteration: Qumil laila illaa qaleelaa

73.text: نِصْفَهُ أَوِ انْقُصْ مِنْهُ قَلِيلًا
73.translation: Half of it - or subtract from it a little
73.transliteration: Nisfahooo awinqus minhu qaleelaa

73.text: أَوْ زِدْ عَلَيْهِ وَرَتِّلِ الْقُرْآنَ تَرْتِيلًا
73.translation: Or add to it, and recite the Qur'an with measured recitation.
73.transliteration: Aw zid 'alaihi wa rattilil Qur'aana tarteela

73.text: إِنَّا سَنُلْقِي عَلَيْكَ قَوْلًا ثَقِيلًا
73.translation: Indeed, We will cast upon you a heavy word.
73.transliteration: Innaa sanulqee 'alika qawalan saqeelaa

73.text: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ اللَّيْلِ هِيَ أَشَدُّ وَطْئًا وَأَقْوَمُ قِيلًا
73.translation: Indeed, the hours of the night are more effective for concurrence [of heart and tongue] and more suitable for words.
73.transliteration: Inn naashi'atal laili hiya ashadddu wat anw wa aqwamu qeelaa

73.text: إِنَّ لَكَ فِي النَّهَارِ سَبْحًا طَوِيلًا
73.translation: Indeed, for you by day is prolonged occupation.
73.transliteration: Inna laka fin nahaari sabhan taweelaa

73.text: وَاذْكُرِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلْ إِلَيْهِ تَبْتِيلًا
73.translation: And remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with [complete] devotion.
73.transliteration: Wazkuris ma rabbika wa tabattal ilaihi tabteelaa

73.text: رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَاتَّخِذْهُ وَكِيلًا
73.translation: [He is] the Lord of the East and the West; there is no deity except Him, so take Him as Disposer of [your] affairs.
73.transliteration: Rabbul mashriqi wal maghriibi laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa fattakhizhu wakeelaa

73.text: وَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَاهْجُرْهُمْ هَجْرًا جَمِيلًا
73.translation: And be patient over what they say and avoid them with gracious avoidance.
73.transliteration: Wasbir 'alaa maa yaqoo loona wahjurhum hajran jameelaa

73.text: وَذَرْنِي وَالْمُكَذِّبِينَ أُولِي النَّعْمَةِ وَمَهِّلْهُمْ قَلِيلًا
73.translation: And leave Me with [the matter of] the deniers, those of ease [in life], and allow them respite a little.
73.transliteration: Wa zarnee walmukaz zibeena ulin na'mati wa mahhilhum qaleelaa

73.text: إِنَّ لَدَيْنَا أَنْكَالًا وَجَحِيمًا
73.translation: Indeed, with Us [for them] are shackles and burning fire
73.transliteration: Inna ladainaaa ankaalanw wa jaheemaa

73.text: وَطَعَامًا ذَا غُصَّةٍ وَعَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
73.translation: And food that chokes and a painful punishment -
73.transliteration: Wa ta'aaman zaa ghussa tinw wa'azaaban aleemaa

73.text: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ الْجِبَالُ كَثِيبًا مَهِيلًا
73.translation: On the Day the earth and the mountains will convulse and the mountains will become a heap of sand pouring down.
73.transliteration: Yawma tarjuful ardu waljibaalu wa kaanatil jibaalu kaseebam maheelaa

73.text: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَيْكُمْ رَسُولًا شَاهِدًا عَلَيْكُمْ كَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ رَسُولًا
73.translation: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness upon you just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.
73.transliteration: Innaa arsalnaaa ilaikum rasoolan shahidan 'alikum kamaaa arsalnaaa ilaa Fir'awna Rasoolna

73.text: فَعَصَىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ الرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذْنَاهُ أَخْذًا وَبِيلًا
73.translation: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a ruinous seizure.
73.transliteration: Fa'asaa Fir'awnur Rasoola fa akhaznaahu akhzanw wabeelaa

73.text: فَكَيْفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِنْ كَفَرْتُمْ يَوْمًا يَجْعَلُ الْوِلْدَانَ شِيبًا
73.translation: Then how can you fear, if you disbelieve, a Day that will make the children white- haired?
73.transliteration: Fakaifa tattaqoona in kafartum yawmany yaj'alul wildaana sheeba

73.text: السَّمَاءُ مُنْفَطِرٌ بِهِ ۚ كَانَ وَعْدُهُ مَفْعُولًا
73.translation: The heaven will break apart therefrom; ever is His promise fulfilled.
73.transliteration: Assamaaa'u munfatirum bih; kaana wa'duhoo maf'oola

73.text: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِ تَذْكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَنْ شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا
73.translation: Indeed, this is a reminder, so whoever wills may take to his Lord a way.
73.transliteration: Inna haazihee tazkiratun fa man shaaa'at takhaza ilaa Rabbihee sabeelaa

73.text: ۞ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدْنَىٰ مِنْ ثُلُثَيِ اللَّيْلِ وَنِصْفَهُ وَثُلُثَهُ وَطَائِفَةٌ مِنَ الَّذِينَ مَعَكَ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ ۚ عَلِمَ أَنْ لَنْ تُحْصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَاقْرَءُوا مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ الْقُرْآنِ ۚ عَلِمَ أَنْ سَيَكُونُ مِنْكُمْ مَرْضَىٰ ۙ وَآخَرُونَ يَضْرِبُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ يَبْتَغُونَ مِنْ فَضْلِ اللَّهِ ۙ وَآخَرُونَ يُقَاتِلُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۖ فَاقْرَءُوا مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنْهُ ۚ وَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكَاةَ وَأَقْرِضُوا اللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا ۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُوا لِأَنْفُسِكُمْ مِنْ خَيْرٍ تَجِدُوهُ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ هُوَ خَيْرًا وَأَعْظَمَ أَجْرًا ۚ وَاسْتَغْفِرُوا اللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ
73.translation: Indeed, your Lord knows, [O Muhammad], that you stand [in prayer] almost two thirds of the night or half of it or a third of it, and [so do] a group of those with you. And Allah determines [the extent of] the night and the day. He has known that you [Muslims] will not be able to do it and has turned to you in forgiveness, so recite what is easy [for you] of the Qur'an. He has known that there will be among you those who are ill and others traveling throughout the land seeking [something] of the bounty of Allah and others fighting for the cause of Allah. So recite what is easy from it and establish prayer and give zakah and loan Allah a goodly loan. And whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allah. It is better and greater in reward. And seek forgiveness of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
73.transliteration: Inna Rabbaka ya'lamu annaka taqoomu adnaa min sulusa yil laili wa nisfahoo wa sulusahoo wa taaa'ifatum minal lazeena ma'ak; wal laahu yuqaddirul laila wanna haar; 'alima al lan tuhsoohu fataaba 'alaikum faqra'oo maa tayassara minal quraan; 'alima an sa yakoonu minkum mardaa wa aakharoona yadriboona fil ardi yabtaghoona min fadlil laahi wa aakharoona yuqaatiloona fee sabeelil laahi faqra'oo ma tayassara minhu wa aqeemus salaata wa aatuz zakaata wa aqridul laaha qardan hasanaa; wa maa tuqadimoo li anfusikum min khairin tajidoohu 'indal laahi huwa khayranw wa a'zama ajraa; wastaghfirul laahaa innal laaha ghafoorur raheem.

74.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمُدَّثِّرُ
74.translation: O you who covers himself [with a garment],
Arise and warn
And your Lord glorify
And your clothing purify
And uncleanliness avoid
And do not confer favor to acquire more
But for your Lord be patient.
And when the trumpet is blown,
That Day will be a difficult day
For the disbelievers - not easy.
Leave Me with the one I created alone
And to whom I granted extensive wealth
And children present [with him]
And spread [everything] before him, easing [his life].
Then he desires that I should add more.
No! Indeed, he has been toward Our verses obstinate.
I will cover him with arduous torment.
Indeed, he thought and deliberated.
So may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
Then may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
Then he considered [again];
Then he frowned and scowled;
Then he turned back and was arrogant

74.text: فَقَالَ إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ يُؤْثَرُ
74.translation: And said, "This is not but magic imitated [from others].
74.transliteration: Faqaala in haazaaa illaa sihruny yu'sar

74.translation: This is not but the word of a human being."
I will drive him into Saqar.
And what can make you know what is Saqar?
It lets nothing remain and leaves nothing [unburned],
Blackening the skins.
Over it are nineteen [angels].

74.text: وَمَا جَعَلْنَا أَصْحَابَ النَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَائِكَةً ۙ وَمَا جَعَلْنَا عِدَّتَهُمْ إِلَّا فِتْنَةً لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لِيَسْتَيْقِنَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ وَيَزْدَادَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِيمَانًا ۙ وَلَا يَرْتَابَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَ ۙ وَلِيَقُولَ الَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِمْ مَرَضٌ وَالْكَافِرُونَ مَاذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ اللَّهُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيَهْدِي مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۚ وَمَا يَعْلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَمَا هِيَ إِلَّا ذِكْرَىٰ لِلْبَشَرِ
74.translation: And We have not made the keepers of the Fire except angels. And We have not made their number except as a trial for those who disbelieve - that those who were given the Scripture will be convinced and those who have believed will increase in faith and those who were given the Scripture and the believers will not doubt and that those in whose hearts is hypocrisy and the disbelievers will say, "What does Allah intend by this as an example?" Thus does Allah leave astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And none knows the soldiers of your Lord except Him. And mention of the Fire is not but a reminder to humanity.
74.transliteration: Wa maaja''alnaaa As haaban naari illaa malaaa 'ikatanw wa maa ja'alnaa 'iddatahum illaa fitnatal lillazeena kafaroo liyastayqinal lazeena ootul kitaaba wa yazdaadal lazeena aamanooo eemaananw wa laa yartaabal lazeena ootul kitaaba walmu'minoona wa liyaqoolal lazeena fee quloo bihim maradunw walkaafiroona maazaaa araadal laahu bihaazaa masalaa; kazaalika yudillul laahu many yashaaa'u wa yahdee many yashaaa'; wa maa ya'lamu junooda rabbika illaa hoo; wa maa hiya illaa zikraa lil bashar

74.translation: No! By the moon
And [by] the night when it departs
And [by] the morning when it brightens,
Indeed, the Fire is of the greatest [afflictions]
As a warning to humanity -

74.text: لِمَنْ شَاءَ مِنْكُمْ أَنْ يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوْ يَتَأَخَّرَ
74.translation: To whoever wills among you to proceed or stay behind.
74.transliteration: Liman shaaa'a minkum any yataqaddama aw yata akhkhar

74.translation: Every soul, for what it has earned, will be retained
Except the companions of the right,
[Who will be] in gardens, questioning each other
About the criminals,
[And asking them], "What put you into Saqar?"
They will say, "We were not of those who prayed,
Nor did we used to feed the poor.
And we used to enter into vain discourse with those who engaged [in it],
And we used to deny the Day of Recompense
74.transliteration: Wa kunnaa nukazzibu bi yawmid Deen

74.translation: Until there came to us the certainty."
So there will not benefit them the intercession of [any] intercessors.
Then what is [the matter] with them that they are, from the reminder, turning away
As if they were alarmed donkeys
Fleeing from a lion?

74.text: بَلْ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ مِنْهُمْ أَنْ يُؤْتَىٰ صُحُفًا مُنَشَّرَةً
74.translation: Rather, every person among them desires that he would be given scriptures spread about.
74.transliteration: Bal yureedu kullum ri'im minhum any yu'taa suhufam munashsharah

74.translation: No! But they do not fear the Hereafter.
No! Indeed, the Qur'an is a reminder
Then whoever wills will remember it.

74.text: وَمَا يَذْكُرُونَ إِلَّا أَنْ يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ هُوَ أَهْلُ التَّقْوَىٰ وَأَهْلُ الْمَغْفِرَةِ
74.translation: And they will not remember except that Allah wills. He is worthy of fear and adequate for [granting] forgiveness.
74.transliteration: Wa maa yazkuroona illaaa any yashaaa'al laah; Huwa ahlut taqwaa wa ahlul maghfirah

75.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لَا أُقْسِمُ بِيَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ
75.translation: I swear by the Day of Resurrection
And I swear by the reproaching soul [to the certainty of resurrection].
75.transliteration: Wa laaa uqsimu bin nafsil lawwaamah

75.translation: Does man think that We will not assemble his bones?

75.text: بَلَىٰ قَادِرِينَ عَلَىٰ أَنْ نُسَوِّيَ بَنَانَهُ
75.translation: Yes. [We are] Able [even] to proportion his fingertips.
But man desires to continue in sin.
He asks, "When is the Day of Resurrection?"
So when vision is dazzled
And the moon darkens
And the sun and the moon are joined,
Man will say on that Day, "Where is the [place of] escape?"
75.transliteration: Yaqoolul insaanu yaw ma 'izin aynal mafarr

75.translation: No! There is no refuge.
To your Lord, that Day, is the [place of] permanence.

75.text: يُنَبَّأُ الْإِنْسَانُ يَوْمَئِذٍ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
75.translation: Man will be informed that Day of what he sent ahead and kept back.
75.transliteration: Yunabba 'ul insaanu yawma 'izim bimaa qaddama wa akhkhar

75.translation: Rather, man, against himself, will be a witness,
Even if he presents his excuses.

75.text: لَا تُحَرِّكْ بِهِ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعْجَلَ بِهِ
75.translation: Move not your tongue with it, [O Muhammad], to hasten with recitation of the Qur'an.
75.transliteration: Laa tuharrik bihee lisaa naka lita'jala bih

75.translation: Indeed, upon Us is its collection [in your heart] and [to make possible] its recitation.
So when We have recited it [through Gabriel], then follow its recitation.
75.transliteration: Fa izaa qaraanaahu fattabi' qur aanah

75.translation: Then upon Us is its clarification [to you].
No! But you love the immediate
And leave the Hereafter.
[Some] faces, that Day, will be radiant,
Looking at their Lord.
And [some] faces, that Day, will be contorted,
Expecting that there will be done to them [something] backbreaking.
No! When the soul has reached the collar bones
And it is said, "Who will cure [him]?"
And the dying one is certain that it is the [time of] separation
And the leg is wound about the leg,
To your Lord, that Day, will be the procession.
And the disbeliever had not believed, nor had he prayed.
But [instead], he denied and turned away.
And then he went to his people, swaggering [in pride].
Woe to you, and woe!
Then woe to you, and woe!
Does man think that he will be left neglected?

75.text: أَلَمْ يَكُ نُطْفَةً مِنْ مَنِيٍّ يُمْنَىٰ
75.translation: Had he not been a sperm from semen emitted?
75.transliteration: Alam yaku nutfatam mim maniyyiny yumnaa

75.translation: Then he was a clinging clot, and [Allah] created [his form] and proportioned [him]
And made of him two mates, the male and the female.
75.transliteration: Faja'ala minhuz zawjayniz zakara wal unsaa

75.text: أَلَيْسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَادِرٍ عَلَىٰ أَنْ يُحْيِيَ الْمَوْتَىٰ
75.translation: Is not that [Creator] Able to give life to the dead?
75.transliteration: Alaisa zaalika biqaadirin 'alaaa any yuhyiyal mawtaa

76.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى الْإِنْسَانِ حِينٌ مِنَ الدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُنْ شَيْئًا مَذْكُورًا
76.translation: Has there [not] come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing [even] mentioned?
76.transliteration: Hal ataa 'alal insaani heenum minad dahri lam yakun shai'am mazkooraa

76.text: إِنَّا خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ مِنْ نُطْفَةٍ أَمْشَاجٍ نَبْتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلْنَاهُ سَمِيعًا بَصِيرًا
76.translation: Indeed, We created man from a sperm-drop mixture that We may try him; and We made him hearing and seeing.
76.transliteration: Innaa khalaqnal insaana min nutfatin amshaajin nabta leehi faja'alnaahu samee'am baseeraa

76.text: إِنَّا هَدَيْنَاهُ السَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرًا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا
76.translation: Indeed, We guided him to the way, be he grateful or be he ungrateful.
76.transliteration: Innaa hadainaahus sabeela immaa shaakiranw wa immaa kafoora

76.text: إِنَّا أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَافِرِينَ سَلَاسِلَ وَأَغْلَالًا وَسَعِيرًا
76.translation: Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and shackles and a blaze.
76.transliteration: Innaaa a'tadnaa lilkaa fireena salaasila wa aghlaalanw wa sa'eeraa

76.text: إِنَّ الْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِنْ كَأْسٍ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
76.translation: Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of Kafur,
76.transliteration: innal abraara yashra boona min kaasin kaana mizaa juhaa kaafooraa

76.text: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ اللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفْجِيرًا
76.translation: A spring of which the [righteous] servants of Allah will drink; they will make it gush forth in force [and abundance].
76.transliteration: 'Aynany yashrabu bihaa 'ibaadul laahi yafajjiroonahaa tafjeeraa

76.text: يُوفُونَ بِالنَّذْرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا كَانَ شَرُّهُ مُسْتَطِيرًا
76.translation: They [are those who] fulfill [their] vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.
76.transliteration: Yoofoona binnazri wa yakhaafoona yawman kaana sharruhoo mustateeraa

76.text: وَيُطْعِمُونَ الطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِ مِسْكِينًا وَيَتِيمًا وَأَسِيرًا
76.translation: And they give food in spite of love for it to the needy, the orphan, and the captive,
76.transliteration: Wa yut''imoonat ta'aama 'alaa hubbihee miskeenanw wa yatemanw wa aseeraa

76.text: إِنَّمَا نُطْعِمُكُمْ لِوَجْهِ اللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنْكُمْ جَزَاءً وَلَا شُكُورًا
76.translation: [Saying], "We feed you only for the countenance of Allah. We wish not from you reward or gratitude.
76.transliteration: Innaamaa nut'imukum li wajhil laahi laa nureedu minkum jazaaa'anw wa laa shukooraa

76.text: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِنْ رَبِّنَا يَوْمًا عَبُوسًا قَمْطَرِيرًا
76.translation: Indeed, We fear from our Lord a Day austere and distressful."
76.transliteration: Innaa nakhaafu mir Rabbinna Yawman 'aboosan qamtareeraa

76.text: فَوَقَاهُمُ اللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمِ وَلَقَّاهُمْ نَضْرَةً وَسُرُورًا
76.translation: So Allah will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness
76.transliteration: Fa waqaahumul laahu sharra zaalikal yawmi wa laqqaahum nadratanw wa surooraa

76.text: وَجَزَاهُمْ بِمَا صَبَرُوا جَنَّةً وَحَرِيرًا
76.translation: And will reward them for what they patiently endured [with] a garden [in Paradise] and silk [garments].
76.transliteration: Wa jazaahum bimaa sabaroo janatanw wa hareeraa

76.text: مُتَّكِئِينَ فِيهَا عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ ۖ لَا يَرَوْنَ فِيهَا شَمْسًا وَلَا زَمْهَرِيرًا
76.translation: [They will be] reclining therein on adorned couches. They will not see therein any [burning] sun or [freezing] cold.
76.transliteration: muttaki'eena feeha 'alal araaa 'iki laa yarawna feehaa shamsanw wa laa zamhareeraa

76.text: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيْهِمْ ظِلَالُهَا وَذُلِّلَتْ قُطُوفُهَا تَذْلِيلًا
76.translation: And near above them are its shades, and its [fruit] to be picked will be lowered in compliance.
76.transliteration: Wa daaniyatan 'alaihim zilaaluhaa wa zullilat qutoofu haa tazleela

76.text: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيْهِمْ بِآنِيَةٍ مِنْ فِضَّةٍ وَأَكْوَابٍ كَانَتْ قَوَارِيرَا
76.translation: And there will be circulated among them vessels of silver and cups having been [created] clear [as glass],
76.transliteration: Wa yutaafu 'alaihim bi aaniyatim min fiddatinw wa akwaabin kaanat qawaareeraa

76.text: قَوَارِيرَ مِنْ فِضَّةٍ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقْدِيرًا
76.translation: Clear glasses [made] from silver of which they have determined the measure.
76.transliteration: Qawaareera min fiddatin qaddaroohaa taqdeeraa

76.text: وَيُسْقَوْنَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنْجَبِيلًا
76.translation: And they will be given to drink a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger
76.transliteration: Wa yusawna feehaa kaasan kaana mizaajuhaa zanjabeelaa

76.text: عَيْنًا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلْسَبِيلًا
76.translation: [From] a fountain within Paradise named Salsabeel.
76.transliteration: 'Aynan feeha tusammaa salsabeelaa

76.text: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَانٌ مُخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ حَسِبْتَهُمْ لُؤْلُؤًا مَنْثُورًا
76.translation: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal. When you see them, you would think them [as beautiful as] scattered pearls.
76.transliteration: Wa yatoofu 'alaihim wildaanum mukhalladoona izaa ra aytahum hasibtahum lu'lu 'am mansoora

76.text: وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيْتَ نَعِيمًا وَمُلْكًا كَبِيرًا
76.translation: And when you look there [in Paradise], you will see pleasure and great dominion.
76.transliteration: Wa izaa ra ayta summa ra ayta na'eemanw wa mulkan kabeera

76.text: عَالِيَهُمْ ثِيَابُ سُنْدُسٍ خُضْرٌ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٌ ۖ وَحُلُّوا أَسَاوِرَ مِنْ فِضَّةٍ وَسَقَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ شَرَابًا طَهُورًا
76.translation: Upon the inhabitants will be green garments of fine silk and brocade. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.
76.transliteration: 'Aaliyahum siyaabu sundusin khudrunw wa istabraq, wa hullooo asaawira min fiddatinw wa saqaahum Rabbuhum sharaaban tahooraa

76.text: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمْ جَزَاءً وَكَانَ سَعْيُكُمْ مَشْكُورًا
76.translation: [And it will be said], "Indeed, this is for you a reward, and your effort has been appreciated."
76.transliteration: Innaa haazaa kaana lakum jazz 'anw wa kaana sa'yukum mashkooraa

76.text: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ الْقُرْآنَ تَنْزِيلًا
76.translation: Indeed, it is We who have sent down to you, [O Muhammad], the Qur'an progressively.
76.transliteration: Innaa nahnu nazzalnaa 'alaikal quraana tanzeelaa

76.text: فَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعْ مِنْهُمْ آثِمًا أَوْ كَفُورًا
76.translation: So be patient for the decision of your Lord and do not obey from among them a sinner or ungrateful [disbeliever].
76.transliteration: Fasbir lihukmi Rabbika wa laa tuti' minhum aasiman aw kafooraa

76.text: وَاذْكُرِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا
76.translation: And mention the name of your Lord [in prayer] morning and evening
76.transliteration: Wazkuris ma Rabbika bukratanw wa aseelaa

76.text: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَاسْجُدْ لَهُ وَسَبِّحْهُ لَيْلًا طَوِيلًا
76.translation: And during the night prostrate to Him and exalt Him a long [part of the] night.
76.transliteration: Wa minal laili fasjud lahoo wa sabbihhu lailan taweelaa

76.text: إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ يُحِبُّونَ الْعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَاءَهُمْ يَوْمًا ثَقِيلًا
76.translation: Indeed, these [disbelievers] love the immediate and leave behind them a grave Day.
