76.transliteration: Inna haaa'ulaa'i yuhibboona 'aajilata wa yazaroona waraaa'ahum yawman saqeelaa

76.text: نَحْنُ خَلَقْنَاهُمْ وَشَدَدْنَا أَسْرَهُمْ ۖ وَإِذَا شِئْنَا بَدَّلْنَا أَمْثَالَهُمْ تَبْدِيلًا
76.translation: We have created them and strengthened their forms, and when We will, We can change their likenesses with [complete] alteration.
76.transliteration: Nahnu khalaqnaahum wa shadadnaaa asrahum wa izaa shi'naa baddalnaaa amsaala hum tabdeelaa

76.text: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِ تَذْكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَنْ شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا
76.translation: Indeed, this is a reminder, so he who wills may take to his Lord a way.
76.transliteration: Inna haazihee tazkiratun fa man shaaa'at takhaza ilaa rabbihee sabeela

76.text: وَمَا تَشَاءُونَ إِلَّا أَنْ يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا
76.translation: And you do not will except that Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
76.transliteration: Wa maa tashaaa'oona illaa anyyashaaa'al laah; innal laahaa kaana'Aleeman Hakeema

76.text: يُدْخِلُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ فِي رَحْمَتِهِ ۚ وَالظَّالِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
76.translation: He admits whom He wills into His mercy; but the wrongdoers - He has prepared for them a painful punishment.
76.transliteration: Yudkhilu mai yashaaa'u fee rahmatih; wazzaalimeena a'adda lahum 'azaaban aleemaa

77.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالْمُرْسَلَاتِ عُرْفًا
77.translation: By those [winds] sent forth in gusts
And the winds that blow violently
And [by] the winds that spread [clouds]
And those [angels] who bring criterion
And those [angels] who deliver a message
As justification or warning,
Indeed, what you are promised is to occur.
So when the stars are obliterated
And when the heaven is opened
And when the mountains are blown away
And when the messengers' time has come...
For what Day was it postponed?
For the Day of Judgement.
And what can make you know what is the Day of Judgement?
77.transliteration: Wa maaa adraaka maa yawmul fasl

77.translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Did We not destroy the former peoples?
Then We will follow them with the later ones.
Thus do We deal with the criminals.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Did We not create you from a liquid disdained?
And We placed it in a firm lodging
For a known extent.
And We determined [it], and excellent [are We] to determine.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Have We not made the earth a container
Of the living and the dead?

77.text: وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ شَامِخَاتٍ وَأَسْقَيْنَاكُمْ مَاءً فُرَاتًا
77.translation: And We placed therein lofty, firmly set mountains and have given you to drink sweet water.
77.transliteration: Wa ja'alnaa feehaa rawaasiya shaamikhaatinw wa asqainaakum maaa'an furaataa

77.translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

77.text: انْطَلِقُوا إِلَىٰ مَا كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ
77.translation: [They will be told], "Proceed to that which you used to deny.
77.transliteration: Intaliqooo ilaa maa kuntum bihee tukazziboon

77.text: انْطَلِقُوا إِلَىٰ ظِلٍّ ذِي ثَلَاثِ شُعَبٍ
77.translation: Proceed to a shadow [of smoke] having three columns
77.transliteration: Intaliqooo ilaa zillin zee salaasi shu'ab

77.text: لَا ظَلِيلٍ وَلَا يُغْنِي مِنَ اللَّهَبِ
77.translation: [But having] no cool shade and availing not against the flame."
77.transliteration: Laa zaleelinw wa laa yughnee minal lahab

77.translation: Indeed, it throws sparks [as huge] as a fortress,
As if they were yellowish [black] camels.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
This is a Day they will not speak,
Nor will it be permitted for them to make an excuse.
77.transliteration: Wa laa yu'zanu lahum fa ya'taziroon

77.translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
This is the Day of Judgement; We will have assembled you and the former peoples.
77.transliteration: Haaza yawmul fasli jama 'naakum wal awwaleen

77.translation: So if you have a plan, then plan against Me.
77.transliteration: Fa in kaana lakum kaidun fakeedoon

77.translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Indeed, the righteous will be among shades and springs
And fruits from whatever they desire,

77.text: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
77.translation: [Being told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."
77.transliteration: Kuloo washraboo haneee 'am bimaa kuntum ta'maloon

77.translation: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
[O disbelievers], eat and enjoy yourselves a little; indeed, you are criminals.
77.transliteration: Kuloo wa tamatta'oo qaleelan innakum mujrimoon

77.translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

77.text: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ارْكَعُوا لَا يَرْكَعُونَ
77.translation: And when it is said to them, "Bow [in prayer]," they do not bow.
77.transliteration: Wa izaa qeela lahumur ka'oo aa yarka'oon

77.translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Then in what statement after the Qur'an will they believe?

78.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ عَمَّ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
78.translation: About what are they asking one another?
About the great news -
That over which they are in disagreement.
No! They are going to know.
Then, no! They are going to know.
Have We not made the earth a resting place?
And the mountains as stakes?
And We created you in pairs
And made your sleep [a means for] rest
And made the night as clothing
And made the day for livelihood
And constructed above you seven strong [heavens]
78.transliteration: Wa banaina fauqakum sab 'an shi daada

78.translation: And made [therein] a burning lamp
And sent down, from the rain clouds, pouring water
78.transliteration: Wa anzalna minal m'usiraati maa-an saj-jaaja

78.translation: That We may bring forth thereby grain and vegetation
78.transliteration: Linukh rija bihee habbaw wana baata

78.translation: And gardens of entwined growth.
Indeed, the Day of Judgement is an appointed time -

78.text: يَوْمَ يُنْفَخُ فِي الصُّورِ فَتَأْتُونَ أَفْوَاجًا
78.translation: The Day the Horn is blown and you will come forth in multitudes
78.transliteration: Yauma yun fakhu fis-soori fataa toona afwaaja

78.translation: And the heaven is opened and will become gateways
78.transliteration: Wa futiha tis samaa-u fakaanat abwaaba

78.translation: And the mountains are removed and will be [but] a mirage.
78.transliteration: Wa suyyi raatil jibaalu fa kaanat saraaba

78.translation: Indeed, Hell has been lying in wait
For the transgressors, a place of return,
In which they will remain for ages [unending].

78.text: لَا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرْدًا وَلَا شَرَابًا
78.translation: They will not taste therein [any] coolness or drink
78.transliteration: Laa ya zooqoona feeha bar daw walaa sharaaba

78.translation: Except scalding water and [foul] purulence -
An appropriate recompense.
Indeed, they were not expecting an account
And denied Our verses with [emphatic] denial.
78.transliteration: Wa kazzabu bi aayaa tina kizzaba

78.translation: But all things We have enumerated in writing.
78.transliteration: Wa kulla shai-in ahsai naahu kitaa ba

78.translation: "So taste [the penalty], and never will We increase you except in torment."
78.transliteration: Fa zooqoo falan-nazee dakum ill-laa azaaba

78.translation: Indeed, for the righteous is attainment -
Gardens and grapevines
And full-breasted [companions] of equal age
And a full cup.

78.text: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا كِذَّابًا
78.translation: No ill speech will they hear therein or any falsehood -
78.transliteration: Laa yasma'oona fiha lagh waw walaa kizzaba

78.translation: [As] reward from your Lord, [a generous] gift [made due by] account,

78.text: رَبِّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا الرَّحْمَٰنِ ۖ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ مِنْهُ خِطَابًا
78.translation: [From] the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Most Merciful. They possess not from Him [authority for] speech.
78.transliteration: Rabbis samaa waati wal ardi wa maa baina humar rahmaani laa yam likoona minhu khi taaba

78.text: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ الرُّوحُ وَالْمَلَائِكَةُ صَفًّا ۖ لَا يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابًا
78.translation: The Day that the Spirit and the angels will stand in rows, they will not speak except for one whom the Most Merciful permits, and he will say what is correct.
78.transliteration: Yauma yaqoo mur roohu wal malaa-ikatu saf-fal laa yata kalla moona illa man azina lahur rahmaanu wa qaala sawaaba

78.text: ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمُ الْحَقُّ ۖ فَمَنْ شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ مَآبًا
78.translation: That is the True Day; so he who wills may take to his Lord a [way of] return.
78.transliteration: Zaalikal yaumul haqqu faman shaa-at ta khaaza ill-laa rabbihi ma-aaba

78.text: إِنَّا أَنْذَرْنَاكُمْ عَذَابًا قَرِيبًا يَوْمَ يَنْظُرُ الْمَرْءُ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ الْكَافِرُ يَا لَيْتَنِي كُنْتُ تُرَابًا
78.translation: Indeed, We have warned you of a near punishment on the Day when a man will observe what his hands have put forth and the disbeliever will say, "Oh, I wish that I were dust!"
78.transliteration: In naa anzar naakum azaaban qareebaiy-yauma yan zurul marr-u maa qaddamat yadaahu wa ya qoolul-kaafiru yaa lai tanee kuntu turaaba

79.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالنَّازِعَاتِ غَرْقًا
79.translation: By those [angels] who extract with violence
And [by] those who remove with ease
And [by] those who glide [as if] swimming
And those who race each other in a race
And those who arrange [each] matter,
On the Day the blast [of the Horn] will convulse [creation],
There will follow it the subsequent [one].
Hearts, that Day, will tremble,
Their eyes humbled.
They are [presently] saying, "Will we indeed be returned to [our] former state [of life]?
79.transliteration: Ya qoo loona a-inna lamar doo doona fil haafirah

79.translation: Even if we should be decayed bones?
They say, "That, then, would be a losing return."
Indeed, it will be but one shout,
And suddenly they will be [alert] upon the earth's surface.
Has there reached you the story of Moses? -

79.text: إِذْ نَادَاهُ رَبُّهُ بِالْوَادِ الْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
79.translation: When his Lord called to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa,
79.transliteration: Iz nadaahu rabbuhu bil waadil-muqad dasi tuwa

79.translation: "Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.

79.text: فَقُلْ هَلْ لَكَ إِلَىٰ أَنْ تَزَكَّىٰ
79.translation: And say to him, 'Would you [be willing to] purify yourself
And let me guide you to your Lord so you would fear [Him]?'"
79.transliteration: Wa ahdi yaka ila rabbika fatakh sha

79.translation: And he showed him the greatest sign,
But Pharaoh denied and disobeyed.
Then he turned his back, striving.
And he gathered [his people] and called out
And said, "I am your most exalted lord."
So Allah seized him in exemplary punishment for the last and the first [transgression].
79.transliteration: Fa-akha zahul laahu nakalal aakhirati wal-oola.

79.text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِمَنْ يَخْشَىٰ
79.translation: Indeed in that is a warning for whoever would fear [Allah].

79.text: أَأَنْتُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَمِ السَّمَاءُ ۚ بَنَاهَا
79.translation: Are you a more difficult creation or is the heaven? Allah constructed it.
79.transliteration: A-antum a shaddu khalqan amis samaa-u banaaha.

79.translation: He raised its ceiling and proportioned it.
And He darkened its night and extracted its brightness.
79.transliteration: Wa aghtasha lailaha wa akhraja duhaaha.

79.translation: And after that He spread the earth.
He extracted from it its water and its pasture,
And the mountains He set firmly
As provision for you and your grazing livestock.
But when there comes the greatest Overwhelming Calamity -
The Day when man will remember that for which he strove,
79.transliteration: Yauma Yata zakkarul insaanu ma sa'aa.

79.translation: And Hellfire will be exposed for [all] those who see -
So as for he who transgressed
And preferred the life of the world,
Then indeed, Hellfire will be [his] refuge.

79.text: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِ وَنَهَى النَّفْسَ عَنِ الْهَوَىٰ
79.translation: But as for he who feared the position of his Lord and prevented the soul from [unlawful] inclination,
79.transliteration: Wa ammaa man khaafa maqaama Rabbihee wa nahan nafsa 'anil hawaa

79.translation: Then indeed, Paradise will be [his] refuge.
They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival?
In what [position] are you that you should mention it?
To your Lord is its finality.
You are only a warner for those who fear it.

79.text: كَأَنَّهُمْ يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَهَا لَمْ يَلْبَثُوا إِلَّا عَشِيَّةً أَوْ ضُحَاهَا
79.translation: It will be, on the Day they see it, as though they had not remained [in the world] except for an afternoon or a morning thereof.
79.transliteration: Ka annahum Yawma yarawnahaa lam yalbasooo illaa 'ashiyyatan aw duhaahaa

80.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
80.translation: The Prophet frowned and turned away
Because there came to him the blind man, [interrupting].
But what would make you perceive, [O Muhammad], that perhaps he might be purified
80.transliteration: Wa maa yudreeka la'allahu yaz zakkaa.

80.translation: Or be reminded and the remembrance would benefit him?
80.transliteration: Au yaz zak karu fatanfa 'ahuz zikraa.

80.translation: As for he who thinks himself without need,
To him you give attention.
And not upon you [is any blame] if he will not be purified.
But as for he who came to you striving [for knowledge]
While he fears [Allah],
From him you are distracted.
No! Indeed, these verses are a reminder;
So whoever wills may remember it.
[It is recorded] in honored sheets,
Exalted and purified,
[Carried] by the hands of messenger-angels,
Noble and dutiful.
Cursed is man; how disbelieving is he.
From what substance did He create him?
From a sperm-drop He created him and destined for him;
Then He eased the way for him;
Then He causes his death and provides a grave for him.
Then when He wills, He will resurrect him.
No! Man has not yet accomplished what He commanded him.
Then let mankind look at his food -
How We poured down water in torrents,
Then We broke open the earth, splitting [it with sprouts],
And caused to grow within it grain
And grapes and herbage
And olive and palm trees
And gardens of dense shrubbery
And fruit and grass -
[As] enjoyment for you and your grazing livestock.
But when there comes the Deafening Blast
On the Day a man will flee from his brother
And his mother and his father
And his wife and his children,

80.text: لِكُلِّ امْرِئٍ مِنْهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ شَأْنٌ يُغْنِيهِ
80.translation: For every man, that Day, will be a matter adequate for him.
[Some] faces, that Day, will be bright -
Laughing, rejoicing at good news.
And [other] faces, that Day, will have upon them dust.
Blackness will cover them.
Those are the disbelievers, the wicked ones.

81.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا الشَّمْسُ كُوِّرَتْ
81.translation: When the sun is wrapped up [in darkness]
And when the stars fall, dispersing,
And when the mountains are removed
And when full-term she-camels are neglected
And when the wild beasts are gathered
And when the seas are filled with flame
And when the souls are paired
And when the girl [who was] buried alive is asked
For what sin she was killed
And when the pages are made public
And when the sky is stripped away
And when Hellfire is set ablaze
And when Paradise is brought near,
A soul will [then] know what it has brought [with it].
So I swear by the retreating stars -
Those that run [their courses] and disappear -
And by the night as it closes in
And by the dawn when it breathes
[That] indeed, the Qur'an is a word [conveyed by] a noble messenger

81.text: ذِي قُوَّةٍ عِنْدَ ذِي الْعَرْشِ مَكِينٍ
81.translation: [Who is] possessed of power and with the Owner of the Throne, secure [in position],
Obeyed there [in the heavens] and trustworthy.
And your companion is not [at all] mad.
And he has already seen Gabriel in the clear horizon.
81.transliteration: Wa laqad ra aahu bilufuqil mubeen

81.translation: And Muhammad is not a withholder of [knowledge of] the unseen.
And the Qur'an is not the word of a devil, expelled [from the heavens].
81.transliteration: Wa maa huwa biqawli shaitaanir rajeem

81.translation: So where are you going?
It is not except a reminder to the worlds
For whoever wills among you to take a right course.

81.text: وَمَا تَشَاءُونَ إِلَّا أَنْ يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ رَبُّ الْعَالَمِينَ
81.translation: And you do not will except that Allah wills - Lord of the worlds.
81.transliteration: Wa maa tashaaa'oona illaaa ai yashaaa 'al laahu Rabbul 'Aalameen

82.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا السَّمَاءُ انْفَطَرَتْ

82.translation: And when the stars fall, scattering,
And when the seas are erupted
And when the [contents of] graves are scattered,
A soul will [then] know what it has put forth and kept back.

82.text: يَا أَيُّهَا الْإِنْسَانُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ الْكَرِيمِ
82.translation: O mankind, what has deceived you concerning your Lord, the Generous,
82.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal insaaanu maa gharraka bi Rabbikal kareem

82.translation: Who created you, proportioned you, and balanced you?

82.text: فِي أَيِّ صُورَةٍ مَا شَاءَ رَكَّبَكَ
82.translation: In whatever form He willed has He assembled you.
82.transliteration: Feee ayye sooratim maa shaaa'a rakkabak

82.translation: No! But you deny the Recompense.
And indeed, [appointed] over you are keepers,
Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure,
And indeed, the wicked will be in Hellfire.
They will [enter to] burn therein on the Day of Recompense,
And never therefrom will they be absent.
And what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?
82.transliteration: Wa maaa adraaka maa Yawmud Deen

82.text: ثُمَّ مَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا يَوْمُ الدِّينِ
82.translation: Then, what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?
82.transliteration: Summa maaa adraaka maa Yawmud Deen

82.text: يَوْمَ لَا تَمْلِكُ نَفْسٌ لِنَفْسٍ شَيْئًا ۖ وَالْأَمْرُ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلَّهِ
82.translation: It is the Day when a soul will not possess for another soul [power to do] a thing; and the command, that Day, is [entirely] with Allah.
82.transliteration: Yawma laa tamliku nafsul linafsin shai'anw walamru yawma'izil lillaah

83.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَيْلٌ لِلْمُطَفِّفِينَ
83.translation: Woe to those who give less [than due],

83.text: الَّذِينَ إِذَا اكْتَالُوا عَلَى النَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ
83.translation: Who, when they take a measure from people, take in full.
But if they give by measure or by weight to them, they cause loss.
83.transliteration: Wa izaa kaaloohum aw wazanoohum yukhsiroon

83.translation: Do they not think that they will be resurrected
For a tremendous Day -
The Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the worlds?

83.text: كَلَّا إِنَّ كِتَابَ الْفُجَّارِ لَفِي سِجِّينٍ
83.translation: No! Indeed, the record of the wicked is in sijjeen.
83.transliteration: Kallaaa inna kitaabal fujjaari lafee Sijjeen

83.translation: And what can make you know what is sijjeen?
It is [their destination recorded in] a register inscribed.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers,
Who deny the Day of Recompense.

83.text: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
83.translation: And none deny it except every sinful transgressor.
83.transliteration: Wa maa yukazzibu biheee illaa kullu mu'tadin aseem

83.text: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ آيَاتُنَا قَالَ أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
83.translation: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
83.transliteration: Izaa tutlaa'alaihi aayaatunaa qaala asaateerul awwaleen

83.text: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ ۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ مَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
83.translation: No! Rather, the stain has covered their hearts of that which they were earning.
83.transliteration: Kallaa bal raana 'alaa quloobihim maa kaanoo yaksiboon

83.text: كَلَّا إِنَّهُمْ عَنْ رَبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَمَحْجُوبُونَ
83.translation: No! Indeed, from their Lord, that Day, they will be partitioned.
83.transliteration: Kallaaa innahum 'ar Rabbihim yawma'izil lamah jooboon

83.translation: Then indeed, they will [enter and] burn in Hellfire.

83.text: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ
83.translation: Then it will be said [to them], "This is what you used to deny."
83.transliteration: Summa yuqaalu haazal lazee kuntum bihee tukazziboon

83.text: كَلَّا إِنَّ كِتَابَ الْأَبْرَارِ لَفِي عِلِّيِّينَ
83.translation: No! Indeed, the record of the righteous is in 'illiyyun.
And what can make you know what is 'illiyyun?
It is [their destination recorded in] a register inscribed
Which is witnessed by those brought near [to Allah].
Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure
On adorned couches, observing.
You will recognize in their faces the radiance of pleasure.
They will be given to drink [pure] wine [which was] sealed.

83.text: خِتَامُهُ مِسْكٌ ۚ وَفِي ذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ الْمُتَنَافِسُونَ
83.translation: The last of it is musk. So for this let the competitors compete.
83.transliteration: Khitaamuhoo misk; wa fee zaalika falyatanaafasil Mutanaafisoon

83.translation: And its mixture is of Tasneem,
A spring from which those near [to Allah] drink.

83.text: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا كَانُوا مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا يَضْحَكُونَ
83.translation: Indeed, those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.
83.transliteration: Innal lazeena ajramoo kaanoo minal lazeena aamanoo yadhakoon

83.translation: And when they passed by them, they would exchange derisive glances.

83.text: وَإِذَا انْقَلَبُوا إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِمُ انْقَلَبُوا فَكِهِينَ
83.translation: And when they returned to their people, they would return jesting.
83.transliteration: Wa izan qalabooo ilaaa ahlihimun qalaboo fakiheen

83.text: وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوا إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ لَضَالُّونَ
83.translation: And when they saw them, they would say, "Indeed, those are truly lost."
83.transliteration: Wa izaa ra awhum qaalooo inna haaa'ulaaa'i ladaaal loon

83.translation: But they had not been sent as guardians over them.

83.text: فَالْيَوْمَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنَ الْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ
83.translation: So Today those who believed are laughing at the disbelievers,
83.transliteration: Fal yawmal lazeena aamanoo minal kuffaari yadhakoon

83.translation: On adorned couches, observing.

83.text: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ الْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا يَفْعَلُونَ
83.translation: Have the disbelievers [not] been rewarded [this Day] for what they used to do?
83.transliteration: Hal suwwibal kuffaaru maa kaanoo yaf'aloon

84.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا السَّمَاءُ انْشَقَّتْ
84.translation: When the sky has split [open]
And has responded to its Lord and was obligated [to do so]
84.transliteration: Wa azinat li Rabbihaa wa huqqat

84.translation: And when the earth has been extended
And has cast out that within it and relinquished [it]
84.transliteration: Wa alqat maa feehaa wa takhallat

84.translation: And has responded to its Lord and was obligated [to do so] -
84.transliteration: Wa azinat li Rabbihaa wa huqqat

84.text: يَا أَيُّهَا الْإِنْسَانُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدْحًا فَمُلَاقِيهِ
84.translation: O mankind, indeed you are laboring toward your Lord with [great] exertion and will meet it.
84.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal insaanu innaka kaadihun ilaa Rabbika kad han famulaaqeeh

84.translation: Then as for he who is given his record in his right hand,
84.transliteration: Fa ammaa man ootiya kitaabahoo biyameenih

84.translation: He will be judged with an easy account
And return to his people in happiness.

84.text: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ وَرَاءَ ظَهْرِهِ
84.translation: But as for he who is given his record behind his back,
84.transliteration: Wa ammaa man ootiya kitaabahoo waraaa'a zahrih

84.translation: He will cry out for destruction
And [enter to] burn in a Blaze.
Indeed, he had [once] been among his people in happiness;
Indeed, he had thought he would never return [to Allah].

84.text: بَلَىٰ إِنَّ رَبَّهُ كَانَ بِهِ بَصِيرًا
84.translation: But yes! Indeed, his Lord was ever of him, Seeing.
84.transliteration: Balaaa inna Rabbahoo kaana bihee baseeraa

84.translation: So I swear by the twilight glow
And [by] the night and what it envelops
And [by] the moon when it becomes full
[That] you will surely experience state after state.
So what is [the matter] with them [that] they do not believe,

84.text: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْقُرْآنُ لَا يَسْجُدُونَ ۩
84.translation: And when the Qur'an is recited to them, they do not prostrate [to Allah]?
84.transliteration: Wa izaa quri'a 'alaihimul Quraanu laa yasjudoon

84.translation: But those who have disbelieved deny,
And Allah is most knowing of what they keep within themselves.
So give them tidings of a painful punishment,

84.text: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ
84.translation: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds. For them is a reward uninterrupted.
84.transliteration: Illal lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati lahum ajrun ghairu mamnoon

85.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْبُرُوجِ
85.translation: By the sky containing great stars
And [by] the promised Day
And [by] the witness and what is witnessed,
Cursed were the companions of the trench
[Containing] the fire full of fuel,
When they were sitting near it

85.text: وَهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفْعَلُونَ بِالْمُؤْمِنِينَ شُهُودٌ
85.translation: And they, to what they were doing against the believers, were witnesses.
85.transliteration: Wa hum 'alaa maa yaf'aloona bilmu 'mineena shuhood

85.text: وَمَا نَقَمُوا مِنْهُمْ إِلَّا أَنْ يُؤْمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَمِيدِ
85.translation: And they resented them not except because they believed in Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy,
85.transliteration: Wa maa naqamoo minhum illaaa aiyu'minoo billaahil 'azeezil Hameed

85.text: الَّذِي لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ شَهِيدٌ
85.translation: To whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And Allah, over all things, is Witness.
85.transliteration: Allazee lahoo mulkus samaawaati wal ard; wallaahu 'alaa kulli shai 'in Shaheed

85.text: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ فَتَنُوا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَتُوبُوا فَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ الْحَرِيقِ
85.translation: Indeed, those who have tortured the believing men and believing women and then have not repented will have the punishment of Hell, and they will have the punishment of the Burning Fire.
85.transliteration: Innal lazeena fatanul mu'mineena wal mu'minaati summa lam yatooboo falahum 'azaabu Jahannama wa lahum 'azaabul hareeq

85.text: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَهُمْ جَنَّاتٌ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْفَوْزُ الْكَبِيرُ
85.translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have gardens beneath which rivers flow. That is the great attainment.
85.transliteration: Innal lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati lahum Jannaatun tajree min tahtihal anhaar; zaalikal fawzul kabeer

85.translation: Indeed, the vengeance of your Lord is severe.
Indeed, it is He who originates [creation] and repeats.
And He is the Forgiving, the Affectionate,
Honorable Owner of the Throne,
Effecter of what He intends.
Has there reached you the story of the soldiers -
[Those of] Pharaoh and Thamud?
But they who disbelieve are in [persistent] denial,
While Allah encompasses them from behind.
But this is an honored Qur'an
[Inscribed] in a Preserved Slate.

86.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالسَّمَاءِ وَالطَّارِقِ
86.translation: By the sky and the night comer -
And what can make you know what is the night comer?

86.text: إِنْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ لَمَّا عَلَيْهَا حَافِظٌ
86.translation: There is no soul but that it has over it a protector.
So let man observe from what he was created.
He was created from a fluid, ejected,
Emerging from between the backbone and the ribs.
Indeed, Allah, to return him [to life], is Able.
The Day when secrets will be put on trial,

86.text: فَمَا لَهُ مِنْ قُوَّةٍ وَلَا نَاصِرٍ
86.translation: Then man will have no power or any helper.
86.transliteration: Famaa lahoo min quwwatinw wa laa naasir

86.translation: And [by] the earth which cracks open,
Indeed, the Qur'an is a decisive statement,
Indeed, they are planning a plan,
But I am planning a plan.
So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile.

87.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ سَبِّحِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ الْأَعْلَى
87.translation: Exalt the name of your Lord, the Most High,
And who brings out the pasture
We will make you recite, [O Muhammad], and you will not forget,

87.text: إِلَّا مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ يَعْلَمُ الْجَهْرَ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ
87.translation: Except what Allah should will. Indeed, He knows what is declared and what is hidden.
87.transliteration: Illaa maa shaaa'al laah; innahoo ya'lamul jahra wa maa yakhfaa

87.translation: And We will ease you toward ease.
So remind, if the reminder should benefit;
He who fears [Allah] will be reminded.
But the wretched one will avoid it -
[He] who will [enter and] burn in the greatest Fire,

87.text: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ
87.transliteration: Summa laa yamootu feehaa wa laa yahyaa

87.translation: He has certainly succeeded who purifies himself
And mentions the name of his Lord and prays.
But you prefer the worldly life,
While the Hereafter is better and more enduring.
Indeed, this is in the former scriptures,
87.transliteration: Inna haazaa lafis suhu fil oolaa

87.translation: The scriptures of Abraham and Moses.

88.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ الْغَاشِيَةِ
88.translation: Has there reached you the report of the Overwhelming [event]?
[Some] faces, that Day, will be humbled,
Working [hard] and exhausted.
They will [enter to] burn in an intensely hot Fire.
They will be given drink from a boiling spring.

88.text: لَيْسَ لَهُمْ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنْ ضَرِيعٍ
88.translation: For them there will be no food except from a poisonous, thorny plant
88.transliteration: Laisa lahum ta'aamun illaa min daree'

88.text: لَا يُسْمِنُ وَلَا يُغْنِي مِنْ جُوعٍ
88.translation: Which neither nourishes nor avails against hunger.
88.transliteration: Laa yusminu wa laa yughnee min joo'

88.translation: [Other] faces, that Day, will show pleasure.
With their effort [they are] satisfied
In an elevated garden,
Wherein they will hear no unsuitable speech.
Within it is a flowing spring.
Within it are couches raised high
And cups put in place
And cushions lined up
And carpets spread around.

88.text: أَفَلَا يَنْظُرُونَ إِلَى الْإِبِلِ كَيْفَ خُلِقَتْ
88.translation: Then do they not look at the camels - how they are created?
And at the sky - how it is raised?
And at the mountains - how they are erected?
And at the earth - how it is spread out?
So remind, [O Muhammad]; you are only a reminder.
You are not over them a controller.
However, he who turns away and disbelieves -
Then Allah will punish him with the greatest punishment.
Indeed, to Us is their return.
Then indeed, upon Us is their account.

89.translation: By the dawn
And [by] ten nights
And [by] the even [number] and the odd
And [by] the night when it passes,

89.text: هَلْ فِي ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِذِي حِجْرٍ
89.translation: Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient] for one of perception?
89.transliteration: Hal fee zaalika qasamul lizee hijr

89.text: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
89.translation: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with 'Aad -
89.transliteration: Alam tara kaifa fa'ala rabbuka bi'aad

89.translation: [With] Iram - who had lofty pillars,

89.text: الَّتِي لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِي الْبِلَادِ
89.translation: The likes of whom had never been created in the land?
89.transliteration: Allatee lam yukhlaq misluhaa fil bilaad

89.translation: And [with] Thamud, who carved out the rocks in the valley?
89.transliteration: Wa samoodal lazeena jaabus sakhra bil waad

89.translation: And [with] Pharaoh, owner of the stakes? -
[All of] whom oppressed within the lands
And increased therein the corruption.
So your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.
Indeed, your Lord is in observation.

89.text: فَأَمَّا الْإِنْسَانُ إِذَا مَا ابْتَلَاهُ رَبُّهُ فَأَكْرَمَهُ وَنَعَّمَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّي أَكْرَمَنِ
89.translation: And as for man, when his Lord tries him and [thus] is generous to him and favors him, he says, "My Lord has honored me."
89.transliteration: Fa ammal insaanu izaa mab talaahu Rabbuhoo fa akramahoo wa na' 'amahoo fa yaqoolu Rabbeee akraman

89.text: وَأَمَّا إِذَا مَا ابْتَلَاهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّي أَهَانَنِ
89.translation: But when He tries him and restricts his provision, he says, "My Lord has humiliated me."
89.transliteration: Wa ammaaa izaa mabtalaahu faqadara 'alaihi rizqahoo fa yaqoolu Rabbeee ahaanan

89.translation: No! But you do not honor the orphan
89.transliteration: Kalla bal laa tukrimooo nal yateem

89.translation: And you do not encourage one another to feed the poor.
And you consume inheritance, devouring [it] altogether,
And you love wealth with immense love.

89.text: كَلَّا إِذَا دُكَّتِ الْأَرْضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا
89.translation: No! When the earth has been leveled - pounded and crushed -
89.transliteration: Kallaaa izaaa dukkatil ardu dakkan dakka

89.translation: And your Lord has come and the angels, rank upon rank,
89.transliteration: Wa jaaa'a Rabbuka wal malaku saffan saffaa

89.text: وَجِيءَ يَوْمَئِذٍ بِجَهَنَّمَ ۚ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ الْإِنْسَانُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ الذِّكْرَىٰ
89.translation: And brought [within view], that Day, is Hell - that Day, man will remember, but what good to him will be the remembrance?
89.transliteration: Wa jeee'a yawma'izim bi jahannnam; Yawma 'iziny yatazakkarul insaanu wa annaa lahuz zikraa

89.translation: He will say, "Oh, I wish I had sent ahead [some good] for my life."
So on that Day, none will punish [as severely] as His punishment,
89.transliteration: Fa Yawma izil laa yu'azzibu 'azaabahooo ahad

89.translation: And none will bind [as severely] as His binding [of the evildoers].
89.transliteration: Wa laa yoosiqu wasaaqa hooo ahad

89.translation: [To the righteous it will be said], "O reassured soul,
Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him],
And enter among My [righteous] servants
And enter My Paradise."

90.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لَا أُقْسِمُ بِهَٰذَا الْبَلَدِ
90.translation: I swear by this city, Makkah -
And you, [O Muhammad], are free of restriction in this city -
And [by] the father and that which was born [of him],
We have certainly created man into hardship.

90.text: أَيَحْسَبُ أَنْ لَنْ يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ
90.translation: Does he think that never will anyone overcome him?
He says, "I have spent wealth in abundance."
Does he think that no one has seen him?
Have We not made for him two eyes?
And a tongue and two lips?
And have shown him the two ways?
But he has not broken through the difficult pass.
And what can make you know what is [breaking through] the difficult pass?
It is the freeing of a slave

90.text: أَوْ إِطْعَامٌ فِي يَوْمٍ ذِي مَسْغَبَةٍ
90.translation: Or feeding on a day of severe hunger
90.transliteration: Aw it'aamun fee yawmin zee masghabah

90.translation: An orphan of near relationship
Or a needy person in misery

90.text: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْمَرْحَمَةِ
90.translation: And then being among those who believed and advised one another to patience and advised one another to compassion.
90.transliteration: Summa kaana minal lazeena aamanoo wa tawaasaw bissabri wa tawaasaw bilmarhamah

90.translation: Those are the companions of the right.

90.text: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِنَا هُمْ أَصْحَابُ الْمَشْأَمَةِ
90.translation: But they who disbelieved in Our signs - those are the companions of the left.
90.transliteration: Wallazeena kafaroo bi aayaatinaa hum as-haabul Mash'amah

90.translation: Over them will be fire closed in.

91.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالشَّمْسِ وَضُحَاهَا
91.translation: By the sun and its brightness
And [by] the moon when it follows it
And [by] the day when it displays it
And [by] the night when it covers it
And [by] the sky and He who constructed it
And [by] the earth and He who spread it
And [by] the soul and He who proportioned it
And inspired it [with discernment of] its wickedness and its righteousness,
He has succeeded who purifies it,
And he has failed who instills it [with corruption].
Thamud denied [their prophet] by reason of their transgression,
When the most wretched of them was sent forth.

91.text: فَقَالَ لَهُمْ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ نَاقَةَ اللَّهِ وَسُقْيَاهَا
91.translation: And the messenger of Allah [Salih] said to them, "[Do not harm] the she-camel of Allah or [prevent her from] her drink."
91.transliteration: Faqaala lahum Rasoolul laahi naaqatal laahi wa suqiyaahaa

91.text: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمْدَمَ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ بِذَنْبِهِمْ فَسَوَّاهَا
91.translation: But they denied him and hamstrung her. So their Lord brought down upon them destruction for their sin and made it equal [upon all of them].
91.transliteration: Fakazzaboohu fa'aqaroohaa fadamdama 'alaihim Rabbuhum bizambihim fasaw waahaa

91.translation: And He does not fear the consequence thereof.

92.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَىٰ
92.translation: By the night when it covers
And [by] the day when it appears
And [by] He who created the male and female,
92.transliteration: Wa maa khalaqaz zakara wal unthaa

92.translation: Indeed, your efforts are diverse.
As for he who gives and fears Allah
And believes in the best [reward],
We will ease him toward ease.
But as for he who withholds and considers himself free of need
And denies the best [reward],
We will ease him toward difficulty.

92.text: وَمَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُ مَالُهُ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰ
92.translation: And what will his wealth avail him when he falls?
92.transliteration: Wa maa yughnee 'anhu maaluhooo izaa taraddaa

92.translation: Indeed, [incumbent] upon Us is guidance.
And indeed, to Us belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].
92.transliteration: Wa inna lanaa lal Aakhirata wal oolaa

92.translation: So I have warned you of a Fire which is blazing.
None will [enter to] burn therein except the most wretched one.
Who had denied and turned away.
But the righteous one will avoid it -
[He] who gives [from] his wealth to purify himself

92.text: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِنْدَهُ مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ تُجْزَىٰ
92.translation: And not [giving] for anyone who has [done him] a favor to be rewarded
92.transliteration: Wa maa li ahadin 'indahoo min ni'matin tujzaaa

92.translation: But only seeking the countenance of his Lord, Most High.
And he is going to be satisfied.

93.translation: And [by] the night when it covers with darkness,
Your Lord has not taken leave of you, [O Muhammad], nor has He detested [you].
93.transliteration: Ma wad da'aka rabbuka wa ma qalaa

93.translation: And the Hereafter is better for you than the first [life].
And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied.
93.transliteration: Wa la sawfa y'uteeka rabbuka fatarda

93.translation: Did He not find you an orphan and give [you] refuge?
93.transliteration: Alam ya jidka yateeman fa aawaa

93.translation: And He found you lost and guided [you],
93.transliteration: Wa wa jadaka daal lan fahada

93.translation: And He found you poor and made [you] self-sufficient.
So as for the orphan, do not oppress [him].
93.transliteration: Fa am mal yateema fala taqhar

93.translation: And as for the petitioner, do not repel [him].
93.transliteration: Wa am mas saa-ila fala tanhar

93.translation: But as for the favor of your Lord, report [it].
93.transliteration: Wa amma bi ni'mati rabbika fahad dith

94.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَلَمْ نَشْرَحْ لَكَ صَدْرَكَ
94.translation: Did We not expand for you, [O Muhammad], your breast?
And We removed from you your burden
Which had weighed upon your back
And raised high for you your repute.
For indeed, with hardship [will be] ease.
So when you have finished [your duties], then stand up [for worship].
And to your Lord direct [your] longing.

95.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالتِّينِ وَالزَّيْتُونِ
95.translation: By the fig and the olive

95.text: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ فِي أَحْسَنِ تَقْوِيمٍ
95.translation: We have certainly created man in the best of stature;
95.transliteration: Laqad khalaqnal insaana fee ahsani taqweem

95.translation: Then We return him to the lowest of the low,
95.transliteration: Thumma ra dad naahu asfala saafileen

95.text: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ فَلَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ
95.translation: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have a reward uninterrupted.
95.transliteration: Ill-lal lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati; falahum ajrun ghairu mamnoon

95.translation: So what yet causes you to deny the Recompense?
95.transliteration: Fama yu kaz zibuka b'adu bid deen

95.translation: Is not Allah the most just of judges?

96.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ اقْرَأْ بِاسْمِ رَبِّكَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ
96.translation: Recite in the name of your Lord who created -
96.transliteration: Iqra bismi rab bikal lazee khalaq

96.translation: Created man from a clinging substance.
Recite, and your Lord is the most Generous -
Taught man that which he knew not.
Indeed, to your Lord is the return.
Have you seen the one who forbids
Have you seen if he is upon guidance
Have you seen if he denies and turns away -
96.transliteration: Ara-aita in kaz zaba wa ta walla

96.translation: Does he not know that Allah sees?
96.transliteration: Alam y'alam bi-an nal lahaa yaraa

96.text: كَلَّا لَئِنْ لَمْ يَنْتَهِ لَنَسْفَعًا بِالنَّاصِيَةِ
96.translation: No! If he does not desist, We will surely drag him by the forelock -
96.transliteration: Kalla la illam yantahi la nasfa'am bin nasiyah

96.translation: Then let him call his associates;
We will call the angels of Hell.
No! Do not obey him. But prostrate and draw near [to Allah].

97.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِنَّا أَنْزَلْنَاهُ فِي لَيْلَةِ الْقَدْرِ
97.translation: Indeed, We sent the Qur'an down during the Night of Decree.
And what can make you know what is the Night of Decree?
97.transliteration: Wa maa adraaka ma lailatul qadr

97.text: لَيْلَةُ الْقَدْرِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ أَلْفِ شَهْرٍ
97.translation: The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months.
97.transliteration: Lailatul qadri khairum min alfee shahr

97.text: تَنَزَّلُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَالرُّوحُ فِيهَا بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِمْ مِنْ كُلِّ أَمْرٍ
97.translation: The angels and the Spirit descend therein by permission of their Lord for every matter.
97.transliteration: Tanaz zalul malaa-ikatu war roohu feeha bi izni-rab bihim min kulli amr

97.translation: Peace it is until the emergence of dawn.
97.transliteration: Salaamun hiya hattaa mat la'il fajr

98.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لَمْ يَكُنِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ وَالْمُشْرِكِينَ مُنْفَكِّينَ حَتَّىٰ تَأْتِيَهُمُ الْبَيِّنَةُ
98.translation: Those who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists were not to be parted [from misbelief] until there came to them clear evidence -
98.transliteration: Lam ya kunil lazeena kafaru min ahlil kitaabi wal mushri keena mun fak keena hattaa ta-tiya humul bayyinah

98.text: رَسُولٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ يَتْلُو صُحُفًا مُطَهَّرَةً
98.translation: A Messenger from Allah, reciting purified scriptures
98.transliteration: Rasoolum minal laahi yatlu suhufam mutahharah

98.text: وَمَا تَفَرَّقَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ إِلَّا مِنْ بَعْدِ مَا جَاءَتْهُمُ الْبَيِّنَةُ
98.translation: Nor did those who were given the Scripture become divided until after there had come to them clear evidence.
98.transliteration: Wa maa tafarraqal lazeena ootul kitaaba il-la mim b'adi ma jaa-at humul baiyyinah

98.text: وَمَا أُمِرُوا إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ حُنَفَاءَ وَيُقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَيُؤْتُوا الزَّكَاةَ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ دِينُ الْقَيِّمَةِ
98.translation: And they were not commanded except to worship Allah, [being] sincere to Him in religion, inclining to truth, and to establish prayer and to give zakah. And that is the correct religion.
98.transliteration: Wa maa umiroo il-la liy'abu dul laaha mukhliseena lahud-deena huna faa-a wa yuqeemus salaahta wa yu-tuz zakaata; wa zaalika deenul qaiyimah

98.text: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ وَالْمُشْرِكِينَ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمْ شَرُّ الْبَرِيَّةِ
98.translation: Indeed, they who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists will be in the fire of Hell, abiding eternally therein. Those are the worst of creatures.
98.transliteration: Innal lazeena kafaru min ahlil kitaabi wal mushri keena fee nari jahan nama khaali deena feeha; ulaa-ika hum shar rul ba reeyah

98.text: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمْ خَيْرُ الْبَرِيَّةِ
98.translation: Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds - those are the best of creatures.
98.transliteration: Innal lazeena aamanu wa 'amilus saalihaati ula-ika hum khairul bareey yah

98.text: جَزَاؤُهُمْ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّاتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا ۖ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا عَنْهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنْ خَشِيَ رَبَّهُ
98.translation: Their reward with Allah will be gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever, Allah being pleased with them and they with Him. That is for whoever has feared his Lord.
98.transliteration: Jazaa-uhum inda rabbihim jan naatu 'adnin tajree min tahtihal an haaru khalideena feeha abada; radiy-yallaahu 'anhum wa ra du 'an zaalika liman khashiya rabbah.

99.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا زُلْزِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ زِلْزَالَهَا
99.translation: When the earth is shaken with its [final] earthquake
99.transliteration: Izaa zul zilatil ardu zil zaalaha

99.translation: And the earth discharges its burdens
And man says, "What is [wrong] with it?" -
That Day, it will report its news
Because your Lord has commanded it.

99.text: يَوْمَئِذٍ يَصْدُرُ النَّاسُ أَشْتَاتًا لِيُرَوْا أَعْمَالَهُمْ
99.translation: That Day, the people will depart separated [into categories] to be shown [the result of] their deeds.
99.transliteration: Yawma iziy yas durun naasu ash tatal liyuraw a'maalahum

99.text: فَمَنْ يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَرَهُ
99.translation: So whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it,
99.transliteration: Famaiy ya'mal mithqala zarratin khai raiy-yarah

99.text: وَمَنْ يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَرَهُ
99.translation: And whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it.

100.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالْعَادِيَاتِ ضَبْحًا

100.translation: And the producers of sparks [when] striking
Arriving thereby in the center collectively,
Indeed mankind, to his Lord, is ungrateful.
And indeed, he is to that a witness.
And indeed he is, in love of wealth, intense.
100.transliteration: Wa innahu lihubbil khairi la shadeed

100.text: ۞ أَفَلَا يَعْلَمُ إِذَا بُعْثِرَ مَا فِي الْقُبُورِ
100.translation: But does he not know that when the contents of the graves are scattered
100.transliteration: Afala ya'lamu iza b'uthira ma filquboor

100.translation: And that within the breasts is obtained,
Indeed, their Lord with them, that Day, is [fully] Acquainted.
100.transliteration: Inna rabbahum bihim yauma 'izil la khabeer

101.translation: And what can make you know what is the Striking Calamity?
It is the Day when people will be like moths, dispersed,
101.transliteration: Yauma ya koonun naasu kal farashil mabthooth

101.translation: And the mountains will be like wool, fluffed up.
101.transliteration: Wa ta koonul jibalu kal 'ihnil manfoosh

101.translation: Then as for one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds],
He will be in a pleasant life.
But as for one whose scales are light,
101.transliteration: Wa amma man khaffat mawa zeenuh

101.translation: His refuge will be an abyss.
And what can make you know what that is?
It is a Fire, intensely hot.

102.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَلْهَاكُمُ التَّكَاثُرُ

102.translation: No! You are going to know.
Then no! You are going to know.
No! If you only knew with knowledge of certainty...
You will surely see the Hellfire.
Then you will surely see it with the eye of certainty.
Then you will surely be asked that Day about pleasure.

103.text: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ
103.translation: Except for those who have believed and done righteous deeds and advised each other to truth and advised each other to patience.
103.transliteration: Il lal lazeena aamanu wa 'amilus saali haati wa tawa saw bil haqqi wa tawa saw bis sabr

104.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَيْلٌ لِكُلِّ هُمَزَةٍ لُمَزَةٍ
104.translation: Woe to every scorner and mocker
Who collects wealth and [continuously] counts it.
He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal.
No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher.
104.transliteration: Kalla layum ba zanna fil hutamah

104.translation: And what can make you know what is the Crusher?
It is the fire of Allah, [eternally] fueled,
Which mounts directed at the hearts.
Indeed, Hellfire will be closed down upon them

105.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصْحَابِ الْفِيلِ
105.translation: Have you not considered, [O Muhammad], how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant?
105.transliteration: Alam tara kaifa fa'ala rabbuka bi ashaabil feel

105.translation: Did He not make their plan into misguidance?
105.transliteration: Alam yaj'al kai dahum fee tad leel

105.translation: And He sent against them birds in flocks,
Striking them with stones of hard clay,
105.transliteration: Tar meehim bi hi jaaratim min sij jeel

105.translation: And He made them like eaten straw.

106.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لِإِيلَافِ قُرَيْشٍ
106.translation: For the accustomed security of the Quraysh -
Their accustomed security [in] the caravan of winter and summer -
Let them worship the Lord of this House,

106.text: الَّذِي أَطْعَمَهُمْ مِنْ جُوعٍ وَآمَنَهُمْ مِنْ خَوْفٍ
106.translation: Who has fed them, [saving them] from hunger and made them safe, [saving them] from fear.
106.transliteration: Allazi at'amahum min ju'inw-wa-aamana hum min khawf

107.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي يُكَذِّبُ بِالدِّينِ
107.translation: Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?
107.transliteration: Ara-aital lazee yu kazzibu bid deen

107.translation: For that is the one who drives away the orphan
And does not encourage the feeding of the poor.
107.transliteration: Wa la ya huddu 'alaa ta'amil miskeen

107.translation: So woe to those who pray
[But] who are heedless of their prayer -
Those who make show [of their deeds]

108.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِنَّا أَعْطَيْنَاكَ الْكَوْثَرَ
108.translation: Indeed, We have granted you, [O Muhammad], al-Kawthar.
So pray to your Lord and sacrifice [to Him alone].
Indeed, your enemy is the one cut off.

109.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْكَافِرُونَ

109.translation: I do not worship what you worship.
Nor are you worshippers of what I worship.
Nor will I be a worshipper of what you worship.
Nor will you be worshippers of what I worship.
For you is your religion, and for me is my religion."

110.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا جَاءَ نَصْرُ اللَّهِ وَالْفَتْحُ
110.translation: When the victory of Allah has come and the conquest,

110.text: وَرَأَيْتَ النَّاسَ يَدْخُلُونَ فِي دِينِ اللَّهِ أَفْوَاجًا
110.translation: And you see the people entering into the religion of Allah in multitudes,
110.transliteration: Wa ra-aitan naasa yadkhuloona fee deenil laahi afwajah

110.text: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَاسْتَغْفِرْهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ تَوَّابًا
110.translation: Then exalt [Him] with praise of your Lord and ask forgiveness of Him. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of repentance.
110.transliteration: Fa sab bih bihamdi rabbika was taghfir, innahu kaana tawwaaba

111.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ تَبَّتْ يَدَا أَبِي لَهَبٍ وَتَبَّ
111.translation: May the hands of Abu Lahab be ruined, and ruined is he.
111.transliteration: Tab bat yadaa abee Lahabinw-wa tabb

111.text: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُ مَالُهُ وَمَا كَسَبَ
111.translation: His wealth will not avail him or that which he gained.
111.transliteration: Maa aghna 'anhu maaluhu wa ma kasab

111.translation: He will [enter to] burn in a Fire of [blazing] flame
111.transliteration: Sa yas laa naran zaata lahab

111.translation: And his wife [as well] - the carrier of firewood.
Around her neck is a rope of [twisted] fiber.

112.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ

112.translation: He neither begets nor is born,
Nor is there to Him any equivalent."

113.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ
113.translation: Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak
From the evil of that which He created
And from the evil of darkness when it settles
113.transliteration: Wa min sharri ghasiqin iza waqab

113.translation: And from the evil of the blowers in knots
And from the evil of an envier when he envies."
113.transliteration: Wa min shar ri haasidin iza hasad

114.text: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ
114.translation: Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind,
From the evil of the retreating whisperer -
Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind -
114.transliteration: Al lazee yuwas wisu fee sudoorin naas

114.translation: From among the jinn and mankind."
